original: theg pa gsum po mtha' dag ston pas don che la rnam par ma bshad pas tha bar gyur pa rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa 'di bdag pas kyang blo ngan pa rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir skabs skabs nas rnam par grol ba'i thigs pa rnams bsdu bar bya'o
analyzed: theg pa gsum po mtha' dag ston pas don che la rnam par ma bshad pas tha bar gyur pa rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa 'di bdag pas kyang blo ngan pa rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir skabs skabs nas rnam par grol ba'i thigs pa rnams bsdu bar bya'o
translated: Since it teaches all three vehicles, it has great meaning. Since it is not explained, it is difficult to understand. Therefore, in order to benefit those of inferior intellect, I will collect the drops of liberation from time to time in this Bodhisattvabhumi of the Yogacaras.

original: // de la bstan pa 'di ni rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir brtsams te /
analyzed: // de la bstan pa 'di ni rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir brtsams te /

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa gsum la mkhas pa bskyed par bya ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dag kyang 'di nyid la bslabs nas rang gi theg pas rang nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa gsum la mkhas pa bskyed par bya ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dag kyang 'di nyid la bslabs nas rang gi theg pas rang nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir ro //

original: yang rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te /

original: yang rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te /

original: theg pa chen po che la the tshom za ba dang / mi shes pa dang / phyin ci log tu gyur pas ma zhugs pa'i sems can dag kyang yod de /

original: de dag la chos mtshan nyid ma nor ba bstan pas gcig tu nges par rtogs par bya zhing tshar bcad nas khong du chud par byas par 'gyur ba dang / kha cig zhugs su zin kyang dgongs pa sna tshogs can gyi mdo sde sde mnyan na blo rnam par rmongs pa dag kyang yod de /

original: yang rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te /

translated: In order to enter into the interpretable meaning of the scriptures, those who are attached to the literal meaning of the scriptures should be made to abandon all childish views by following the characteristics. And for that very reason, in order to abandon the views of those who are frightened by emptiness,

original: yang rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te /

analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa las yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang dran pa ni rnal 'byor yid la byed pa dang mthun par sdud pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: yang na dad pa dang / 'dun pa pa dang / thabs dang / brtson 'grus la rnal 'byor zhes bya ste /

analyzed: de dag gi sbyor ba bshad pa'i phyir ro //

original: dgongs pa can gyi don gyi tshigs su bcad pa las /

analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i sa las rnal 'byor gang zhe na /

original: bsdu na gnyen po'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ste /

original: de ni nyan thos dang thun mong ba'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: de ni nyan thos dang thun mong ba'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: This is the yoga that is shared with the sravakas.ğŸ”½What is the yoga that is not shared with the sravakas?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni shes rab dang snying rje'i khyad par du 'brel bar 'jug pa mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni shes rab dang snying rje'i khyad par du 'brel bar 'jug pa mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /

analyzed: de ni thun mong ma yin pa'i rnal 'byor ro //

original: yang na thabs la mkhas pa la bya ste /
analyzed: yang na thabs la mkhas pa la bya ste /

analyzed: rigs pa'i phyir rnal 'byor zhes bya'o //

translated: as in the SÅ«tra called the Chapter of the Source of Precious Qualities, where it says, â€œWhat is the practice of yoga? It is the discernment of dependent origination in its entirety.â€

original: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid med pa la bya ste /
analyzed: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid med pa la bya ste /

original: de la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de yang tshangs pa chen pos zhus pa'i mdo las / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i chos gang yang skyed par mi byed 'gog par mi byed cing /
translated: And that is like the SÅ«tra Petitioned by Great BrahmÄ, which says:ğŸ”½â€œThe yoga practitioner does not cause any phenomenon to arise or cease,

analyzed: chos gang yang grub par mi 'dod la /
translated: does not assert that any phenomenon is established,

analyzed: mngon par rtogs par mi 'dod do zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: and does not assert that any phenomenon is realized.â€

analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa ngo bo nyid med pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa ni chos gang yang skye ba'am 'gag par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //

analyzed: yang na yongs su dag pa'i de bzhin nyid la rnal 'byor zhes bya ste /
translated: Or else, yoga is called the purification of suchness,

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa'i rnal 'byor chen po ni 'di yin te ;

original: de yang sh'a ri'i bu'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnal 'byor gnag ji rnyed pa de dag gi nang na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor ni mchog ces bya'o //

original: gtso bo dang mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i bar zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gtso bo dang mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i bar zhes bya'o //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: yang na des bsdus pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bya ste /
analyzed: yang na des bsdus pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bya ste /

analyzed: de la bsgom pa ni rnal 'byor bsgom pa yin no zhes ji skad @71a * //

original: gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: nyan pa dang sems pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis de dag gi spyod pa mtshungs pa ni 'dul ba yin te /

original: rnal 'byor ba ni 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba ni 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa ste /
translated: â€œYogisâ€ are noble listeners and so on,

original: ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: as appropriate.

original: de dag gis de ni rta'i dkyus lta bu ste 'gro ba'i yul yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis de ni rta'i dkyus lta bu ste 'gro ba'i yul yin no //
translated: They are the field of progress, like the stride of a horse.

original: de ni 'di las phyi rol pa rnams la med do //
analyzed: de ni 'di las phyi rol pa rnams la med do //

original: yang na rnal 'byor spyod pa dag 'di la brten nas rang gis chos brtas pas mngon par 'phel ba ste /
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor spyod pa dag 'di la brten nas rang gis chos brtas pas mngon par 'phel ba ste /
translated: Or, yogis increase and flourish by relying on this, through their own Dharma.

original: lo tog gis dang 'dra ba de ni de dag gi sa yin no //
analyzed: lo tog gis dang 'dra ba de ni de dag gi sa yin no //
translated: That is their stage, like a field.

original: yang na ji skad smos pa'i bar bsdus pa'i ye shes kyi spyod pa mngon sum du byed pa de skyed pa'i gnas dang mthun pa ste /

original: sa dang 'dra bas na sa'o //
analyzed: sa dang 'dra bas na sa'o //

original: yang na rnal 'byor spyod pa dag sa 'di la spyod par byed cing rang gi chos kyi longs spyod nyams su myong bar byed pas ba lang gi sa dang 'dra bar de ni de dag gi sa yin no //

analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor spyod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams te mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor la spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, the bodhisattvas are the TathÄgatas, because they practice the yoga of nonabiding nirvana, the intuition of equality, etc.

analyzed: de dag gi yul rnam pa thams cad du spros pa med pa'i dbyings gang yin pa de ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa'o //
translated: The object of those is the realm of the nonconceptualization of all aspects, which is the stage of the bodhisattvas.

original: chos mngon pa bzhin no //

analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor ba'i gnas skabs ston pa'i bstan pa de la yang sa zhes bya ba sa bcu dang 'dra ste phyogs ni de lta bu'o //

original: 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba rtogs par 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pas ni dang po kho nar 'khor bar 'jug pa dang / de las ldog pa gang yin pa dang / ji ltar 'jug pa dang / 'jug pa'i gnas skabs gang yin pa dang /

translated: Thus, the yogÄcÄra who wishes to understand the process of affliction and purification should first investigate the substance of sentient beings, the basis of that process, asking, â€œWhat is the process of entry into cyclic existence? What is the process of turning away from that? How does one enter? What is the state of entry?

original: de la ji ltar ldog pa dang / ldog pa'i gnas skabs gang yin zhes de'i gzhi'i dngos po sems can gyi rdzas btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la ji ltar ldog pa dang / ldog pa'i gnas skabs gang yin zhes de'i gzhi'i dngos po sems can gyi rdzas btsal bar bya'o //
translated: How does one turn away from that? What is the state of turning away?â€

original: nyon mongs pa spog ba dang mi spong ba'i gnas skabs kyang shes par bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spog ba dang mi spong ba'i gnas skabs kyang shes par bya ste /
translated: He should also understand the states of the non-abandonment and abandonment of the afflictions.

original: yid ches pa skye bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir gnas skabs kyang btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: yid ches pa skye bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir gnas skabs kyang btsal bar bya'o //
translated: Since confidence arises from that, he should also investigate the states.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga las brtsams pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga las brtsams pa ste /
translated: The level possessing the five collections of consciousness is the one that begins with the five collections of consciousness.

original: ji ltar 'dul ba las rgyal po dang rkun po las brtsams pa ni rgyal po dang ldan pa dang / @72a * //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dul ba las rgyal po dang rkun po las brtsams pa ni rgyal po dang ldan pa dang / @72a * //
translated: The Vinaya states:ğŸ”½The king and thieves are the king and those with power.

original: rkun po dang ldan pa'i gtam yin par shes so zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rkun po dang ldan pa'i gtam yin par shes so zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: As the Vinaya declares: â€œThe stories of the king and the thief are to be understood as the stories of the king and the thief who possess the mind.â€

original: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag sa gcig tu bstan cing de yang yid kyis pas sngar bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag sa gcig tu bstan cing de yang yid kyis pas sngar bstan zhe na /
translated: Why are the five collections of consciousness taught as one realm, and that realm as the mental realm?

original: dmigs pa la rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o gnas 'byung ba'i las kyi khyad par lta bu med cing rigs gcig pa'i phyir gcig tu byas so //
analyzed: dmigs pa la rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o gnas 'byung ba'i las kyi khyad par lta bu med cing rigs gcig pa'i phyir gcig tu byas so //
translated: Because they are the same in type, since they do not have the specific activity of arising in a place, as it were, and because they have few things to be described, they are made into one.

original: de'i phyir brjod par bya ba nyung bas na sngar bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par bya ba nyung bas na sngar bstan to //
translated: Therefore, they are taught first because they have few things to be described.

original: yid kyi sa ni de las bzlog pa yin pas na log pa gcig tu bstan la brjod par bya ba'i phyir bstan to //
analyzed: yid kyi sa ni de las bzlog pa yin pas na log pa gcig tu bstan la brjod par bya ba'i phyir bstan to //
translated: The mental realm is taught last because it is the opposite of that, and because it has many things to be described.

original: ngo bo nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the phrase â€œin terms of their intrinsic natures,â€ etc.,

original: ci'i phyir dge ba la sogs pa gzhan dag mi smos par ngo bo nyid la sogs pa don lnga po dag nyid brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dge ba la sogs pa gzhan dag mi smos par ngo bo nyid la sogs pa don lnga po dag nyid brjod ce na /
translated: Why are the other topics such as virtue not mentioned, but only the five topics such as essence?

original: de dag gi ngo bo yin pa dang / de dag gis thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag gi ngo bo yin pa dang / de dag gis thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are the essence of those topics and because they include all topics.

original: 'di ltar de'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa dang / de gang las 'byung ba dang / don gang yin zhes bya bas kyang ngo bo nyid dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / grogs dang / las yongs su shes par 'gyur bas na de'i phyir don lnga po de dag bstan pas gzhan yang bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa dang / de gang las 'byung ba dang / don gang yin zhes bya bas kyang ngo bo nyid dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / grogs dang / las yongs su shes par 'gyur bas na de'i phyir don lnga po de dag bstan pas gzhan yang bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the essence of those topics is their intrinsic nature, their source is their cause, their result is their effect, their companion is their concomitant, and their function is their activity. Therefore, since the five topics include all other topics, they are taught.

original: dge ba la sogs pa nyid kyang grogs la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir dge ba la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba yang 'di nyid du 'dus pas na logs shig tu ma bstan te /
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa nyid kyang grogs la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir dge ba la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba yang 'di nyid du 'dus pas na logs shig tu ma bstan te /
translated: Since virtue and so on are also companions and so forth, the classifications of virtue and so on are also included in these five topics. Therefore they are not taught separately.

original: de'i phyir de dag gis thams cad bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gis thams cad bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Thus all topics are included in these five topics.

original: de'i phyir log nas kyang chos lnga po 'di dag gis ni phung po la mkhas pa yang bsdus la sangs rgyas kyi bka'i dngos po dgu'i bar du yang bsdus so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir log nas kyang chos lnga po 'di dag gis ni phung po la mkhas pa yang bsdus la sangs rgyas kyi bka'i dngos po dgu'i bar du yang bsdus so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, even in the reverse order, these five dharmas include the skill in aggregates up to the nine things of the Buddha's word.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for eye consciousness, etc.,

original: de la mig ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs te /
analyzed: de la mig ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs te /
translated: therein, the eye is derivative form.

original: nam mkha' phyogs gcig pas na rdzas drug po lus dang / sa dang gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams dang tha dad par mi gnas so //
analyzed: nam mkha' phyogs gcig pas na rdzas drug po lus dang / sa dang gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams dang tha dad par mi gnas so //
translated: Since space is a part of space, it does not exist separately from the six substances of body, earth, form, smell, taste, and touch.

original: yang na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa rnam par ma bzhag kyang sa bon bcu gcig dang ldan te /
analyzed: yang na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa rnam par ma bzhag kyang sa bon bcu gcig dang ldan te /
translated: Or, even without positing the foundation consciousness, it has the eleven seeds.

original: yul lnga dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / lus dang / mig gi'o //
analyzed: yul lnga dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / lus dang / mig gi'o //
translated: The five objects, the four great elements, the body, and the eye.

original: nges pa'i tshig gi tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig gi tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: The verse on the definition:

original: ma zad par du gzugs spyod dang // g-yo zhing skad cig pa nyid dang // rnam pa bzhi por grags pa dang // mdzes pa'i las las gyur pa yin //
analyzed: ma zad par du gzugs spyod dang // g-yo zhing skad cig pa nyid dang // rnam pa bzhi por grags pa dang // mdzes pa'i las las gyur pa yin //
translated: to be momentary, and to have four aspects.

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Consciousness is known as

original: dngos po dang / byed pa dang / gzhi zhes bya bar grags so //
analyzed: dngos po dang / byed pa dang / gzhi zhes bya bar grags so //
translated: a thing, an action, and a basis.

original: @72b de ni byed pa por yang snang ste /
analyzed: @72b de ni byed pa por yang snang ste /
translated: It appears as an agent,

original: zas lta bu zhes bya ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: zas lta bu zhes bya ba'i mdo las /
translated: as in the sÅ«tra that says,

original: rnam par shes par byed cing rnam par shes par byed pas na de'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes par byed cing rnam par shes par byed pas na de'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya ste /
translated: â€œBecause it cognizes, it is called the aggregate of consciousness.â€

original: ci zhig rnam par shes she na /
analyzed: ci zhig rnam par shes she na /
translated: What does it cognize?

original: gzugs rnams dang sgra rnams la sogs pa'o zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs rnams dang sgra rnams la sogs pa'o zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It cognizes forms, sounds, and so on.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni mig la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa yin pas na mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni mig la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa yin pas na mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The sÅ«tra says, â€œEye consciousness is the consciousness that is based on the eye.â€

original: yang na rnam par shes pa gang gis mig la phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa la bya ste /
analyzed: yang na rnam par shes pa gang gis mig la phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa la bya ste /
translated: Or, it is that which benefits or injures the eye through consciousness.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor bas dbang po la phan pa dang gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor bas dbang po la phan pa dang gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For, the feeling associated with consciousness benefits or injures the faculty.

original: yang na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or, it is that which transforms the eye consciousness,

original: mig ser gyi nad la sogs pas btab pa rnams kyi mig gi dbang gis rnam par shes par yang 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig ser gyi nad la sogs pas btab pa rnams kyi mig gi dbang gis rnam par shes par yang 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the eye consciousness of those who are afflicted with jaundice, etc., is transformed.

original: yang na gang mig gi phyir mthun pa la bya ste /
analyzed: yang na gang mig gi phyir mthun pa la bya ste /
translated: Or, it is that which is favorable to the eye,

original: mig nyams pa la sogs pa'i rjes su 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig nyams pa la sogs pa'i rjes su 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is engaged in the service of the eye, etc.

original: yang mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi sa bon dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir de'i dbang gis mig las mngon par 'grub par bya'o //
analyzed: yang mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi sa bon dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir de'i dbang gis mig las mngon par 'grub par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the so-called eye consciousness should be understood as that which is produced from the eye through the power of its own seed.

original: yang na rna ba la sogs pa rnam par bcad pa'i phyir de ni mig gi zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yang na rna ba la sogs pa rnam par bcad pa'i phyir de ni mig gi zhes brjod do //
translated: Or else, it is called the eye because it is the basis of the eye consciousness, since the eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form.

original: yang na gnas kyi phyogs la rnam par shes pa skye ba yod pa'i phyir mig la zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gnas kyi phyogs la rnam par shes pa skye ba yod pa'i phyir mig la zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, it is called the eye because the eye is the place where the eye consciousness arises.

original: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i khams kho na ngo bo nyid kyis bstan la de las gzhan pa mig la sogs pa'i khams dag ni ma bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i khams kho na ngo bo nyid kyis bstan la de las gzhan pa mig la sogs pa'i khams dag ni ma bstan zhe na /
translated: Why is the element of consciousness alone taught by its intrinsic nature, while the other elements, such as the eye, are not taught by their intrinsic nature?

original: rnam par shes pa rnam pa du mas byed pas skad cig re re la ngo bo nyid tha dad pa spang bar mi bar mi bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnam pa du mas byed pas skad cig re re la ngo bo nyid tha dad pa spang bar mi bar mi bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: In order to avoid the fault of attributing too many intrinsic natures, since consciousness has many aspects and its intrinsic nature would be different in each moment.

original: de ni spre'u lta bu zhes bya ba'i mdo las bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni spre'u lta bu zhes bya ba'i mdo las bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught in the sÅ«tra called â€œLike a Monkey.â€

original: rnam pa de dag kyang gang gis byas she na /
analyzed: rnam pa de dag kyang gang gis byas she na /
translated: By what aspects is it produced?

original: de'i phyir gnas dang dmigs pa la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas dang dmigs pa la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the basis, object, etc. are taught.

original: mig la sogs pa ni dang por skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de bzhin du 'jug pa'i phyir khong du chud par sla bas na de dag gi ngo bo nyid ni nges par bstan mi dgos so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni dang por skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de bzhin du 'jug pa'i phyir khong du chud par sla bas na de dag gi ngo bo nyid ni nges par bstan mi dgos so //
translated: The eye, etc. are easy to understand because they function in just the nature in which they first originate, so their nature does not need to be taught.

original: yang rnam pa gcig tu na sems ni rtse ba'i bdag gi rdzas kyi gzhi yin pas gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gcig tu na sems ni rtse ba'i bdag gi rdzas kyi gzhi yin pas gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or, in another way, mind is primary because it is the basis of the substance of the self that plays.

original: des de las gzhan pa'i chos rnams rnam par sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des de las gzhan pa'i chos rnams rnam par sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it establishes the other dharmas from it.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa dag gis ni ma bstan gyi mig la sogs pas ni ma yin no //ğŸ”½gang mig la brten nas gzugs @73a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa dag gis ni ma bstan gyi mig la sogs pas ni ma yin no // gang mig la brten nas gzugs @73a * //
translated: Therefore, it is not taught by the consciousnesses, but by the eye, etc.ğŸ”½The eye is the basis of the visual consciousness.

original: so sor rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: so sor rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The visual consciousness is that which cognizes visible form.

original: gang mig la brten nas so sor rnam par rig pa zhes bya bas kyang grub mod kyi gzugs smos pa ni gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang mig la brten nas so sor rnam par rig pa zhes bya bas kyang grub mod kyi gzugs smos pa ni gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although it is established by the phrase â€œthat which cognizes visible form by means of the eye,â€ the word â€œvisible formâ€ is mentioned in order to teach the nature of the form that is the object.

original: yang na brten nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dmigs pa la yang snyegs pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshan nyid 'dres par 'gyur ba rnam par bcad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na brten nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dmigs pa la yang snyegs pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshan nyid 'dres par 'gyur ba rnam par bcad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or else, since the term â€œdependentâ€ also applies to the object, it is stated in order to exclude the mental consciousness, which is similar to it in having a characteristic.

original: 'di ltar 'og nas rkyen gyi mtshan nyid bshad pa'i skabs nas kha dog dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams ni 'dzin pa tsam du grags pa'i shes pa'i rten yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'og nas rkyen gyi mtshan nyid bshad pa'i skabs nas kha dog dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams ni 'dzin pa tsam du grags pa'i shes pa'i rten yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: For, later, in the section on the characteristics of conditions, it says, â€œThe colors, smells, tastes, and tangibles are known as the supports of consciousness, which merely grasps them.â€

original: nges par 'byin pa'i skabs nas kyang yul rnams dmigs par 'dod pa zhes smras nas /
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa'i skabs nas kyang yul rnams dmigs par 'dod pa zhes smras nas /
translated: And in the section on definitive release, it says, â€œThe objects are asserted to be the objects of consciousness,â€

original: rten des nyon mongs pa can gyi tshor ba kun du 'byung ngo zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //ğŸ”½kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa gzhan dag la med pa'i khyad par gyis bye brag tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rten des nyon mongs pa can gyi tshor ba kun du 'byung ngo zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o // kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa gzhan dag la med pa'i khyad par gyis bye brag tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: and then it explains, â€œThrough that support, afflicted feeling arises.â€

original: sa bon thams cad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sa bon thams cad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach the foundation consciousness as a distinct form of consciousness, which is not shared with other Buddhist schools, the root text says, â€œIt is the one that holds all the seeds,â€ and so on.

original: 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa ni chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi gzhi ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa ni chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi gzhi ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the eye consciousness is not the basis of the seeds of all dharmas,

original: de med kyang dri la sogs pa bzhin du mig la sogs pa 'byung bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med kyang dri la sogs pa bzhin du mig la sogs pa 'byung bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because even though it does not exist, the eye and so on appear to arise, like smell and so on.

original: lus len par byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: lus len par byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not the appropriator of the body,

original: de ma skyes na lus gson po yang ro bzhin du rul bar thal bar 'gyur ba dang / de yod kyang rna ba la sogs pa mi zin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma skyes na lus gson po yang ro bzhin du rul bar thal bar 'gyur ba dang / de yod kyang rna ba la sogs pa mi zin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it did not arise, the body would be like a corpse, and it would follow that the body would be rotten, and even if it exists, it would follow that the ear and so on would not be appropriated.

original: rnam par smin par bsdus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin par bsdus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not included in the category of karmic maturation,

original: dus thams cad du ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dus thams cad du ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it would follow that it would be unobscured and neutral at all times.

original: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The same is true of the remaining consciousnesses.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni de las bzlog pa'i khyad par bshad pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni de las bzlog pa'i khyad par bshad pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The foundation consciousness is explained as having the opposite qualities.

original: ci gzhan dgag pa tsam gyi phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid de skad smos par zad dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci gzhan dgag pa tsam gyi phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid de skad smos par zad dam zhe na /
translated: Is the definition of foundation consciousness merely stated for the sake of refuting others?

original: de lta ma yin te /ğŸ”½lung dang rigs pa yang yod de /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te / lung dang rigs pa yang yod de /
translated: No, it is not.

original: de ni 'og nas yid kyi sa bshad pa'i skabs nas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'og nas yid kyi sa bshad pa'i skabs nas shes par bya'o //
translated: There are scriptures and reasonings, which will be understood from the section below that explains the mental faculty.

original: de la sa bon thams cad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs gsum gyis ni mdor na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por bstan te /
analyzed: de la sa bon thams cad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs gsum gyis ni mdor na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por bstan te /
translated: In brief, three verses on the foundation consciousness teach it as the thing that is cause and effect.

original: de la rgyu'i dngos po la skyed pa'i rgyu ni /
analyzed: de la rgyu'i dngos po la skyed pa'i rgyu ni /
translated: As for its being a causal entity, it is a productive cause,

original: sa bon thams cad pa zhes gang smos pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad pa zhes gang smos pa'o //
translated: as stated in the line â€œcontaining all seeds.

original: gnas pa'i rgyu nyid ni /
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyu nyid ni /
translated: It is a cause of endurance,

original: lus len par byed pa zhes smos pa ste /
analyzed: lus len par byed pa zhes smos pa ste /
translated: as stated in the line â€œthat appropriates the body.

original: 'di ltar des @73b zin na lus rul bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar des @73b zin na lus rul bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In this way, the body does not decay.

original: 'bras bu'i dngos po ni rnam par smin pa bsdus pa zhes gang smos pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dngos po ni rnam par smin pa bsdus pa zhes gang smos pa'o //
translated: As for its being an effect, it is a ripened effect, as stated in the line â€œthat is the storehouse consciousness.

original: yang gcig tu na sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa'i mtha'i gnyen por bstan te /
analyzed: yang gcig tu na sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa'i mtha'i gnyen por bstan te /
translated: Moreover, it is taught as the antidote for the extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: de la skur pa ni 'di dag thams cad rgyu med pa las byung ngo zhes zer ba ste /
analyzed: de la skur pa ni 'di dag thams cad rgyu med pa las byung ngo zhes zer ba ste /
translated: In this regard, denial is the claim that all of these things arise without a cause.

original: de'i gnyen por sa bon thams cad pa zhes bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por sa bon thams cad pa zhes bya ba bstan to //
translated: The antidote to that is the teaching on the seed of everything.

original: sgro 'dogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /ğŸ”½bdag tu ngo bo nyid yod par sgro 'dogs pa de'i gnyen por ni /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te / bdag tu ngo bo nyid yod par sgro 'dogs pa de'i gnyen por ni /
translated: Superimposition is twofold.

original: lus len par byed pa zhes bya ba bstan to //ğŸ”½de nyid la rtag pa nyid do zhes bye brag tu sgro 'dogs pa de'i gnyen por ni /
analyzed: lus len par byed pa zhes bya ba bstan to // de nyid la rtag pa nyid do zhes bye brag tu sgro 'dogs pa de'i gnyen por ni /
translated: The antidote to the superimposition that the self exists by its own intrinsic reality is the teaching on the appropriator of the body.

original: rnam par smin pa bsdus pa zhes bya ba bstan te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa bsdus pa zhes bya ba bstan te /
translated: The antidote to the superimposition that distinguishes the self as permanent is the teaching on the collection of the ripened.

original: 'di ltar rnam par smin pa ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i dus na ma byung ba las phyis byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par smin pa ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i dus na ma byung ba las phyis byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the ripened does not exist at the time of the karma and the afflictions, but arises later.

original: gang 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni mig gi 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu'i mtshan nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bstan to /ğŸ”½tshig re re dang gnyis kyis yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: gang 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni mig gi 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu'i mtshan nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bstan to / tshig re re dang gnyis kyis yongs su bstan to //
translated: The phrase â€œthe four great elementsâ€ and so on indicate the eyeâ€™s defining characteristics as an effect, as a cause, as an intrinsic nature, and as a specific .

original: rgyur byas pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Each of these is indicated by a single word, while the last is indicated by a compound.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthat is derived from themâ€ means that the eye is derived from the four great elements.

original: rgyur byas pa'i don ni rgyu las byung ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i don ni rgyu las byung ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term â€œderivedâ€ is the meaning of â€œarisen from.â€

original: mdo sde las gzugs rgyur byas nas nga'o snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: mdo sde las gzugs rgyur byas nas nga'o snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: The sÅ«tras state: â€œThe notion of â€˜Iâ€™ occurs when form is derived as its object.â€

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi rgyu ni gzugs yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi rgyu ni gzugs yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of this statement is that form is the cause of the notion of â€œIâ€ and the pride of â€œI am.â€

original: bstan du med la zhes bya ba ni ston pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pas mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan du med la zhes bya ba ni ston pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pas mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase â€œit is not visibleâ€ means that it cannot be seen by the eye consciousness.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase â€œit has resistanceâ€ means that it is impeded.

original: gcig la gcig mi reg par yul gnod par byed pa'i don ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i don yin na /
analyzed: gcig la gcig mi reg par yul gnod par byed pa'i don ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i don yin na /
translated: If the meaning of obstructive is that objects obstruct each other without touching,

original: mig ni thogs pa dang bcas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mig ni thogs pa dang bcas pa ma yin te /
translated: then the eyes are not obstructive because

original: 'di ltar nam mkha' la dri la sogs pa dang yul gcig pa'i phyir mig la ni de gnyis ka med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar nam mkha' la dri la sogs pa dang yul gcig pa'i phyir mig la ni de gnyis ka med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: the eyes and the nose are not both nonobstructive since they have the same object, such as smell.

original: de lta yin du zin kyang mig gi rang gi 'byung ba chen po thogs pa dang bcas pa de dag gi nam mkha' yul gcig pa la khyab pas na de dag gis byas pa'i thogs pa yang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams la bstan to //
analyzed: de lta yin du zin kyang mig gi rang gi 'byung ba chen po thogs pa dang bcas pa de dag gi nam mkha' yul gcig pa la khyab pas na de dag gis byas pa'i thogs pa yang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams la bstan to //
translated: Even though that is so, the eyes are obstructive because the eyes and their own great elements pervade the space that is the same object of the eyes and they obstruct derivative form.

original: gang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i sngar rol du 'das ma thag pa'i rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la bya ste /
analyzed: gang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i sngar rol du 'das ma thag pa'i rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la bya ste /
translated: The immediately past consciousness that precedes eye consciousness is mental consciousness.

original: 'og nas rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i skad cig gnyis lhan cig tu 'byung ba yang med la phan tshun gyi mjug thogs su phan tshun 'byung bar 'gyur @74a * //
analyzed: 'og nas rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i skad cig gnyis lhan cig tu 'byung ba yang med la phan tshun gyi mjug thogs su phan tshun 'byung bar 'gyur @74a * //
translated: Later it says:ğŸ”½Two moments of the fivefold collection of consciousness do not occur simultaneously, and they do not arise from each other.ğŸ”½

original: bar yang lnga po gzhan dang gzhan 'gags ma thag pa las gcig 'byung ba kho nar ma nges so zhes 'byung ngo //ğŸ”½sngon gyi spros pa dga' ba rgyur gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa sems las byung ba dang bcas pa de dag ni gcig rgyu yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: bar yang lnga po gzhan dang gzhan 'gags ma thag pa las gcig 'byung ba kho nar ma nges so zhes 'byung ngo // sngon gyi spros pa dga' ba rgyur gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa sems las byung ba dang bcas pa de dag ni gcig rgyu yin no zhes ston to //
translated: Later, it will be said that two moments of the five collections of consciousness do not occur simultaneously, and that one of the five does not definitely arise from the cessation of another.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œdelight in previous conceptual proliferationâ€ and so on teaches that the storehouse consciousness and the active forms of consciousness, together with their mental factors, are the causes of each other.

original: sngon gyi spros pa dga' ba rgyur gyur pa zhes bya bas ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang sems las byung ba de dag ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin par bstan to //
analyzed: sngon gyi spros pa dga' ba rgyur gyur pa zhes bya bas ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang sems las byung ba de dag ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin par bstan to //
translated: The phrase â€œdelight in previous conceptual proliferationâ€ teaches that the active forms of consciousness, together with their mental factors, are the cause of the storehouse consciousness.

original: sa bon thams cad pa zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gzhan dag gi rgyu yin par bstan te /
analyzed: sa bon thams cad pa zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gzhan dag gi rgyu yin par bstan te /
translated: The statement â€œthe seed of everythingâ€ indicates that the store consciousness is the cause of the others.

original: 'di ltar chos 'di pa dag gi thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'khor dang bcas pa dag ma gtogs pa gzhan dag ni spros pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos 'di pa dag gi thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'khor dang bcas pa dag ma gtogs pa gzhan dag ni spros pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, with the exception of the forms of consciousness that are born of hearing, etc., of those who are spiritual practitioners, the other forms of consciousness, together with their associated elements, are called â€œelaborations.

original: de dag nyid dga' ba yang yin te /
analyzed: de dag nyid dga' ba yang yin te /
translated: â€ They are also â€œenjoymentsâ€

original: 'khor ba la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are relished due to the delight one takes in the cycle of existence.

original: de dag nyid rgyu yang yin te /
analyzed: de dag nyid rgyu yang yin te /
translated: They are also â€œcausesâ€

original: de dag gi dbang gis 'gro ba rnams su rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi dbang gis 'gro ba rnams su rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the causes of the maturation that occurs in the various destinies.

original: yang don gzhan du spros pa zhes bya ba ni nang gi phung po rnams la bya ste /
analyzed: yang don gzhan du spros pa zhes bya ba ni nang gi phung po rnams la bya ste /
translated: â€œElaborationsâ€ also has another meaning: it refers to the internal heaps.

original: 'di ltar 'og nas kyang spros pa dang 'jig tshogs kyi dngos po rnams ni don gcig pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'og nas kyang spros pa dang 'jig tshogs kyi dngos po rnams ni don gcig pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, it will be said later that â€œelaborationsâ€ and â€œthe entities of the perishable collectionâ€ are synonymous terms.

original: de la dga' ba ni bdag la chags pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dga' ba ni bdag la chags pa yin no //
translated: â€œEnjoymentâ€ is the attachment to a self.

original: de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mngon par grub pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mngon par grub pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: It is the cause of the establishment of the foundation consciousness,

original: 'di ltar bdag bde bar 'gyur bar bya'o zhes las byed pa de yang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag bde bar 'gyur bar bya'o zhes las byed pa de yang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the performance of karma with the thought â€œI will be happyâ€ is the cause of karmic maturation.

original: yang na skye ba'i tshe bdag la chags pa kun tu 'byung ba ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyu yin pas na de'i phyir spros pa la dga' ba ni mngon sum gyi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: yang na skye ba'i tshe bdag la chags pa kun tu 'byung ba ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyu yin pas na de'i phyir spros pa la dga' ba ni mngon sum gyi rgyu yin te /
translated: Or, when one is born, attachment to self arises, and that is the cause of rebirth. Therefore, delighting in conceptual thought is the cause of direct perception.

original: 'di ltar 'og nas thams cad 'chi ba'i tshe mi gsal ba'i 'du shes kyi gnas skabs su ma gyur pas na yun ring po nas goms pas bdag la chags pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'og nas thams cad 'chi ba'i tshe mi gsal ba'i 'du shes kyi gnas skabs su ma gyur pas na yun ring po nas goms pas bdag la chags pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, it is said that when all die, attachment to self arises due to long-term familiarity with the thought â€œI will not become a state of unclear discernment,â€

original: de'i dbang gis bdag 'chi bar 'gyur ro snyam nas lus la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis bdag 'chi bar 'gyur ro snyam nas lus la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: and due to that power, one delights in the body with the thought â€œI will not die.â€

original: de ni de'i mngon par 'grub pa'i gzhi yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ni de'i mngon par 'grub pa'i gzhi yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: That is the basis of its establishment.

original: yang gcig tu ma spros pa zhes bya ba ni sa bon la bya ste /
analyzed: yang gcig tu ma spros pa zhes bya ba ni sa bon la bya ste /
translated: Also, non-elaboration refers to the seed.

original: 'di ltar 'og nas sa bon gyi rnam grangs bshad pa'i skabs nas kyang sa bon dang / bag chags dang / spros pa dang / rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sa bon gyi @74b rnam grangs su btags so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'og nas sa bon gyi rnam grangs bshad pa'i skabs nas kyang sa bon dang / bag chags dang / spros pa dang / rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sa bon gyi @74b rnam grangs su btags so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, in the section on the synonyms for seed, it says, 'Seed,' 'habit energy,' 'elaboration,' 'cause,' and so on are designated as synonyms for seed.

original: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la bya ste /
analyzed: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la bya ste /
translated: Delight refers to attachment.

original: de gnyis ka yang rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis ka yang rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Both of these are the cause of the fruitional consciousness.

original: 'di ltar sred pas bsdus pa'i sa bon ni srid pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sred pas bsdus pa'i sa bon ni srid pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the seed subsumed by craving is existence,

original: sred pa'i rkyen gyis ni rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sred pa'i rkyen gyis ni rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and craving is the condition for the actualization of the fruition.

original: yang don gzhan du spros pa zhes bya ba ni nang gi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu rmongs pa'i tha snyad kyi gzhi ste ngar 'dzin pa'o //ğŸ”½'di ltar 'og nas tshigs su bcad pa rnam par bshad pa'i skabs nas /
analyzed: yang don gzhan du spros pa zhes bya ba ni nang gi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu rmongs pa'i tha snyad kyi gzhi ste ngar 'dzin pa'o //ğŸ”½'di ltar 'og nas tshigs su bcad pa rnam par bshad pa'i skabs nas /
translated: Also, elaboration refers to the other meaning, which is the basis for the conventional designation of I as the internal fruitional effect.ğŸ”½Thus, in the section on the explanation of the verses, it says, The internal fruitional effect is the basis for the conventional designation of 'I.'

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ram mi 'gyur zhes //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ram mi 'gyur zhes //
translated: â€œWill it arise or not?â€

original: de'i phyir spros pa khas len to zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir spros pa khas len to zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, one accepts conceptual elaboration.

original: de la dga' ba ni bdag la bde ba'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: de la dga' ba ni bdag la bde ba'i dbang du byas te /
translated: Here, delight is with regard to the self and happiness.

original: de la mngon par dga' ba sngon du btang bas spros pa la mang du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la mngon par dga' ba sngon du btang bas spros pa la mang du gnas pa'o //
translated: Because of the prior delight in that, one dwells much in conceptual elaboration.

original: de ltar las gnas pa'i las gang yin pa ba des bskyed pa'i bag chags ni spros pa la dga' ba rgyur gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar las gnas pa'i las gang yin pa ba des bskyed pa'i bag chags ni spros pa la dga' ba rgyur gyur pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the latent impressions generated by that karma which is the basis of karma are the cause of delight in conceptual elaboration.

original: rgyu zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sa bon gyi rnam grangs su rtogs so zhes sngar smras pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sa bon gyi rnam grangs su rtogs so zhes sngar smras pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word â€œcauseâ€ should be understood as a synonym for â€œseed,â€ as was previously stated.

original: de ni bdag tu 'dzin pa gzhir gyur pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa tshe rabs gzhan na 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de ni bdag tu 'dzin pa gzhir gyur pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa tshe rabs gzhan na 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: That is the cause of the store consciousness, which is the basis of the apprehension of self, and which occurs in other lives.

original: de la nang rmongs pa gang yin pa dang / ngar 'dzin pa'i bar des ni ma rig pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la nang rmongs pa gang yin pa dang / ngar 'dzin pa'i bar des ni ma rig pa bstan to //
translated: Here, the inner delusion up to the apprehension of â€œIâ€ show ignorance.

original: de la dga' ba'i las kyi bag chags bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: de la dga' ba'i las kyi bag chags bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams so //
translated: The generation of the latent impressions of karma that is the cause of that is the formations conditioned by ignorance.

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis ni rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis ni rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The condition of the formations is consciousness.

original: yan lag bzhi'i sa bon gyi gnas yin no //
analyzed: yan lag bzhi'i sa bon gyi gnas yin no //
translated: It is the seed of the four branches.

original: bag chags des ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa skyed do //
analyzed: bag chags des ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa skyed do //
translated: By that latent impression, the consciousness that is the basis of all things is generated.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen la 'bras bur gyur pa da ltar byung ba'i dus kyi ming dang gzugs la sogs pa 'di 'byung ste ;
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen la 'bras bur gyur pa da ltar byung ba'i dus kyi ming dang gzugs la sogs pa 'di 'byung ste ;
translated: The condition of consciousness is the present time of name-and-form, etc., which is the result.

original: de ltar sngon gyi mtha' las bar gyi mtha'i rnam par smin par mngon par grub pas ji ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba de bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar sngon gyi mtha' las bar gyi mtha'i rnam par smin par mngon par grub pas ji ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba de bstan to //
translated: Thus, the establishment of the result of the present time from the cause of the prior time is taught.

original: yang don gzhan du na spros pa zhes bya ba ni spros pa'i bag chags la bya ste de nyid rgyu yin no //
analyzed: yang don gzhan du na spros pa zhes bya ba ni spros pa'i bag chags la bya ste de nyid rgyu yin no //
translated: Moreover, the other meaning of â€œconceptualizationâ€ is the latent tendencies of conceptualization, which is the cause.

original: dga' ba ni sred pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: dga' ba ni sred pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Joy is the cause of existence, which is the condition of craving.

original: spros pa dang dga' ba de gnyis ka yang rgyu yin no //
analyzed: spros pa dang dga' ba de gnyis ka yang rgyu yin no //
translated: Both proliferation and joy are causes.

original: bag chags la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bag chags la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of habitual tendencies:

original: srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags ni las kyi sa bon gang gis rnam par smin pa'i dngos po gzhan skye bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags ni las kyi sa bon gang gis rnam par smin pa'i dngos po gzhan skye bar byed pa'o //
translated: The habitual tendencies of the members of existence are the seeds of karma, which give rise to other things that are the results of evolution.

original: spros pa'i bag chags ni ngo bo nyid kyi sa bon no //
analyzed: spros pa'i bag chags ni ngo bo nyid kyi sa bon no //
translated: The habitual tendencies of proliferation are the seeds of the essential natures.
Here,

original: de gnyis ka kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan pas ni rkyen gyi tshogs mtha' dag smras pa yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis ka kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan pas ni rkyen gyi tshogs mtha' dag smras pa yin te /
translated: by teaching that both of these are the cause of the store consciousness, he mentions the entire collection of conditions,

original: rang gi sa bon dang las las byung bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon dang las las byung bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he teaches that they arise from their own seeds and karma.

original: 'di ltar de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gzhan dang lhan cig tu skye ba dang 'gag pa med pas na de bag chags de dag la yod /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gzhan dang lhan cig tu skye ba dang 'gag pa med pas na de bag chags de dag la yod /
translated: Thus, since the store consciousness does not arise and cease simultaneously with the other evolving consciousnesses, it is the repository of those habitual tendencies.

original: sngon med pa'i bag chags bsgom pa yang med do //
analyzed: sngon med pa'i bag chags bsgom pa yang med do //
translated: There is no cultivation of habitual tendencies that did not exist previously.

original: rkyen rnams kyis sa bon rnams brtags par byed do //
analyzed: rkyen rnams kyis sa bon rnams brtags par byed do //
translated: The conditions determine the seeds.

original: de las srid pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de las srid pa 'byung ste /
translated: From that, existence arises.

original: ji ltar thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba na kha cig sems can gyi dngos por bgrang ba dang / kha cig de la ma yin pa dang / de la yang kha cig nyan thos kyi ris kho nar gyur pa la sogs pa bzhin du sa bon 'di yang ngo bo nyid du grub ste /
analyzed: ji ltar thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba na kha cig sems can gyi dngos por bgrang ba dang / kha cig de la ma yin pa dang / de la yang kha cig nyan thos kyi ris kho nar gyur pa la sogs pa bzhin du sa bon 'di yang ngo bo nyid du grub ste /
translated: Just as in beginningless cyclic existence, some are counted as sentient beings, some are not, and some are only counted as Å›rÄvakas, etc., so too are these seeds established by their own nature.

original: 'og nas byung ba'i tshad ma dag gis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'og nas byung ba'i tshad ma dag gis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood by the valid cognitions that will be presented below.

original: de yang rnam pa du ma yod de zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa du ma yod de zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that has many types, because of the differences of blue, etc.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni kha cig na re bee d'u rya ltar snang ba ma gtogs pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gzhan dag yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni kha cig na re bee d'u rya ltar snang ba ma gtogs pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gzhan dag yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that space is derivative form, except for what appears as beryl.

original: yang kha cig na re de nyid kyi gnas skabs kyang gtogs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang kha cig na re de nyid kyi gnas skabs kyang gtogs so zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that its state also belongs to that.

original: kha dog gcig pa'o zhes bya ba ni kha cig na re sna tshogs ma yin pa la zer ro //
analyzed: kha dog gcig pa'o zhes bya ba ni kha cig na re sna tshogs ma yin pa la zer ro //
translated: Some say: It is of one color, meaning it is not variegated.

original: yang kha cig na re gzhan du mi 'gyur ba la bya ste /
analyzed: yang kha cig na re gzhan du mi 'gyur ba la bya ste /
translated: Others say: It is unchanging,

original: ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa'i kha dog gzhan du 'gyur ba ltar nam mkha' de de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa'i kha dog gzhan du 'gyur ba ltar nam mkha' de de lta ma yin te /
translated: because the color of space does not change, unlike the color of a pot, etc.,

original: 'byung ba chen po med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: because the great elements do not exist there.

original: yang kha cig na re de la kha dog gcig pur zad de /
analyzed: yang kha cig na re de la kha dog gcig pur zad de /
translated: Others say: It is of one color only,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi gzugs bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi gzugs bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: like the form of concentration.

original: yang kha dog gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni kha dog rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gtan la 'bebs te /
analyzed: yang kha dog gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni kha dog rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gtan la 'bebs te /
translated: The nature of the colors is determined by the question beginning with â€œWhat is color?â€

original: sngar ni grangs tsam zhig bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar ni grangs tsam zhig bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because only the number was previously taught.

original: gang gzugs dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni dbyibs la ma ltos pa'i dngos po tsam la bya'o //
analyzed: gang gzugs dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni dbyibs la ma ltos pa'i dngos po tsam la bya'o //
translated: The phrase â€œthat which is like formâ€ refers to mere things that are not dependent on shape.

original: dbyibs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbyibs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is shape?

original: gang gzugs rgyas pa zhes bya ba ni kha dog gi rdul phra rab rnams bsags pa kho na'i gnas skabs la dbyibs pa zhes brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gzugs rgyas pa zhes bya ba ni kha dog gi rdul phra rab rnams bsags pa kho na'i gnas skabs la dbyibs pa zhes brjod pa yin te /
translated: That which is called â€œthe growth of formâ€ is the state of the mere aggregation of minute particles of color, and it is called â€œshape.â€

original: de'i phyir de ni btags pa'i yod par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni btags pa'i yod par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be nominally existent.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched du bsdus pa'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du de yang rdzas nyid du snang ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched du bsdus pa'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du de yang rdzas nyid du snang ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: Since it is included in the form base, does it also appear as a substance, like blue and so on?

original: gang gi tshe chos can gyi bye brag log par sgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba de'i tshe ji ltar snang ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos can gyi bye brag log par sgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba de'i tshe ji ltar snang ste /
translated: When a reason is contradictory because it proves the opposite of the subject, how can it appear?

original: 'di ltar 'khrul pa med pas sngon po @75b la sogs pa bzhin du kha dog las don gzhan ma yin pa nyid dang / ring po dang thung ngu'i ngo bo nyid la sogs pa yang med par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khrul pa med pas sngon po @75b la sogs pa bzhin du kha dog las don gzhan ma yin pa nyid dang / ring po dang thung ngu'i ngo bo nyid la sogs pa yang med par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since there is no error in this case, it proves that shape is not different from color, like blue and so on, and it proves that shape does not exist as the nature of long and short and so on.

original: 'gal bar 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gal bar 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Since there is no error in contradiction, it is not indefinite.

original: 'di ltar sgra la sogs pa'i khams kyis ma bsdus pa kha dog med pa'i bum pa la sogs pa btags pa'i yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra la sogs pa'i khams kyis ma bsdus pa kha dog med pa'i bum pa la sogs pa btags pa'i yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a pot, etc., which is not included in the elements such as sound, etc., exists as a designation, although it has no color.

original: gang de dag las gud na bum pa ci yang de de /
analyzed: gang de dag las gud na bum pa ci yang de de /
translated: And what is a pot apart from those?

original: de'i phyir sgrub dang ldan no zhes zer ba de yang rtsing zing sla ste kho bos kyang brjod nus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgrub dang ldan no zhes zer ba de yang rtsing zing sla ste kho bos kyang brjod nus so //
translated: Therefore, your argument is crude and simple, and I can make it as well.

original: kha dog ni dbyibs las gud na med pa'i phyir dpe med par gyur te //
analyzed: kha dog ni dbyibs las gud na med pa'i phyir dpe med par gyur te //
translated: Color does not exist apart from shape, so your example is not established.

original: gang gzhi med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub po //
analyzed: gang gzhi med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub po //
translated: And the reason is not established because it has no basis.

original: de bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang gtan tshigs kyi skyon gsum sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang gtan tshigs kyi skyon gsum sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the three faults of the reason should be applied to the statement, â€œBecause it is the object of the eye consciousness,â€ and so on.

original: gzugs rgyas pa ring po la sogs pa'i rnam par yongs su bcad pa'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba la ring por 'dzin pa'i blo ni ring por yongs su gcod pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs rgyas pa ring po la sogs pa'i rnam par yongs su bcad pa'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba la ring por 'dzin pa'i blo ni ring por yongs su gcod pa'o //
translated: The form is the aspect of the determination of the extension of the long, etc. The cognition that apprehends long determines long.

original: des gzung bar bya ba gang yin pa de ni ring po'o ;
analyzed: des gzung bar bya ba gang yin pa de ni ring po'o ;
translated: That which is grasped by it is long.

original: / de nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gis ni rnam par rig byed kyang btags pa'i yod pa nyid yin par ston to //
analyzed: / de nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gis ni rnam par rig byed kyang btags pa'i yod pa nyid yin par ston to //
translated: The word â€œjustâ€ shows that the indicative is a nominal reality.

original: rgyur byas pa ni lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed kyang bum pa bzhin du lung du ma bstan pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa ni lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed kyang bum pa bzhin du lung du ma bstan pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: But doesnâ€™t it follow, absurdly, that the indicative is morally neutral, like a pot, because it is a derivative of the four great elements?

original: de kun nas slong bar byed pa sems pa'i dbang gis dge ba la sogs par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir thal bar 'gyur ba med do //ğŸ”½yang gcig tu na gdags pa rnams ni btags pa'i chos kyi dngos po thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug par ma nges pas na de ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: de kun nas slong bar byed pa sems pa'i dbang gis dge ba la sogs par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir thal bar 'gyur ba med do // yang gcig tu na gdags pa rnams ni btags pa'i chos kyi dngos po thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug par ma nges pas na de ni gyi na'o //
translated: No, it does not follow, because it is posited as virtuous and so on by the power of the intention that motivates it.

original: gang gi tshe btags pa dge ba dang mi dge ba'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la 'phen par byed pa yang ma yin na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe btags pa dge ba dang mi dge ba'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la 'phen par byed pa yang ma yin na /
translated: Or, alternatively, it is not the case that the designations are not definite in terms of all the things that are nominal realities, because the designations are not virtuous or nonvirtuous by nature, nor do they project.

original: ci'i phyir de las nyid du rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de las nyid du rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Why is it established as just that?

original: ji skad du rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas gzhi dang bcas pa'i mdo ni lung las ming dang gzugs la brten nas rnyog pa can gti mug las byung ba'i yid la byed pa skye'o //
analyzed: ji skad du rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas gzhi dang bcas pa'i mdo ni lung las ming dang gzugs la brten nas rnyog pa can gti mug las byung ba'i yid la byed pa skye'o //
translated: Because it is said in the sutra, â€œWith cause, with conditions, with basis, ignorance arises.

original: de la ma rig pa gang yin pa de ni gti mug go //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa gang yin pa de ni gti mug go //
translated: What is ignorance here? It is delusion.

original: rmongs pa'i 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa'i 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni sred pa'o //
translated: What is the desire of the deluded? It is craving.

original: sred pa can gyi rnam par rig byed gang yin pa de ni las yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sred pa can gyi rnam par rig byed gang yin pa de ni las yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: What is the intimation of the one with craving? It is karma.â€

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de nyid las su gsungs pa'i phyir 'di nyid rig pa yang yin te sems pa bzhin no //ğŸ”½yang na 'jig rten gyi rjes su zhugs pa ni tshul yin @76a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de nyid las su gsungs pa'i phyir 'di nyid rig pa yang yin te sems pa bzhin no // yang na 'jig rten gyi rjes su zhugs pa ni tshul yin @76a * //
translated: And it is also knowledge because the BhagavÄn said in that very sÅ«tra, â€œIt is like intention.â€

original: pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, it is a method because it accords with the world.

original: skyes pa 'gags pa zhes bya ba'i tshig ni chos 'di pa kha cig rnam par rig byed kyi gnas gzugs ni dus gzhan du yang gnas par 'dzin cing de ltar rtog pa dag yod pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes pa 'gags pa zhes bya ba'i tshig ni chos 'di pa kha cig rnam par rig byed kyi gnas gzugs ni dus gzhan du yang gnas par 'dzin cing de ltar rtog pa dag yod pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase â€œarisen and ceasedâ€ is for the purpose of refuting the assertion of some Buddhists that form, which is the basis of informative form, endures for another moment.

original: mi mthun pa'i rgyus zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'du byed par nges pa'i sems pa gcig las gcig byung ba las kun nas slong ba'i sems las bslang ba'i rtsol bas bskyed nas phyogs de nyid du gzugs 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa'i rlung gis so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i rgyus zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'du byed par nges pa'i sems pa gcig las gcig byung ba las kun nas slong ba'i sems las bslang ba'i rtsol bas bskyed nas phyogs de nyid du gzugs 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa'i rlung gis so //
translated: â€œBy a cause that is incompatibleâ€ means that the form that is the basis of informative form is generated by the wind element that is incompatible with the form that arises in that place, through the exertion that is produced by the volition that is the instigator of the action.

original: bar du mchod pa'am zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig byed dbyibs de nyid rnam par ma 'khrugs par yul gzhan du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: bar du mchod pa'am zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig byed dbyibs de nyid rnam par ma 'khrugs par yul gzhan du 'gro ba'o //
translated: â€œWithout interruptionâ€ means that the shape of the informative form moves to another place without being disturbed.

original: bar du chod pa dang bcas pa'am zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du rnam par 'khrugs pas so //
analyzed: bar du chod pa dang bcas pa'am zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du rnam par 'khrugs pas so //
translated: â€œWith interruptionâ€ means that it is disturbed again and again.

original: 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i ngo bo nyid ston to //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i ngo bo nyid ston to //
translated: â€œArisesâ€ indicates the nature of the action.

original: phyogs de nyid du yang mi 'gyur ba 'byung ba ni zhes bya bas ni rnam par rig byed g-yo ba med kyang bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: phyogs de nyid du yang mi 'gyur ba 'byung ba ni zhes bya bas ni rnam par rig byed g-yo ba med kyang bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: And in that very direction, without movement shows that even without movement, there is the nature of action.

original: rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o zhes bya bas ni spyi dang bye brag ston te /
analyzed: rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o zhes bya bas ni spyi dang bye brag ston te /
translated: Belonging to a category shows the general and specific.

original: de la spyi ni kha dog dang dbyibs dang rgyas pa dang rnam par rig byed dang las dang byed pa zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: de la spyi ni kha dog dang dbyibs dang rgyas pa dang rnam par rig byed dang las dang byed pa zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: Among them, the general are color, shape, extension, intimation, action, and activity.

original: bye brag ni snang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag ni snang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The specific are light and so on.

original: de la snang ba zhes bya ba ni phyogs gcig tu byung ba'i kha dog gsol ba'o //
analyzed: de la snang ba zhes bya ba ni phyogs gcig tu byung ba'i kha dog gsol ba'o //
translated: Among them, light is the appearance of color in one direction.

original: bsal ba zhes bya ba ni kun nas so //
analyzed: bsal ba zhes bya ba ni kun nas so //
translated: Illumination is all-around.

original: ring po zhes bya ba ni dbyibs rgyas pa phyogs gcig tu shas cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ring po zhes bya ba ni dbyibs rgyas pa phyogs gcig tu shas cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: Long is the extension of shape, appearing predominantly in one direction.

original: thung du zhes bya ba ni de bas thung ba'o //
analyzed: thung du zhes bya ba ni de bas thung ba'o //
translated: Short is less than that.

original: spyod pa zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i don rnams la nyes bar spyod pa'i lus kyi las gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i don rnams la nyes bar spyod pa'i lus kyi las gang yin pa'o //
translated: Action is that bodily action which is the means of attaining an object.

original: g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni ma thob pa rnams la rtsol zhing g-yo bar byed pa'i lus kyi las gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni ma thob pa rnams la rtsol zhing g-yo bar byed pa'i lus kyi las gang yin pa ste /
translated: Movement is that bodily action which is the means of attaining an object not yet attained.

original: de ni g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called movement.

original: rgyur bstan pa'i phyir ri mo las bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyur bstan pa'i phyir ri mo las bzhin no //
translated: It is like a picture, because it is taught as a cause.

original: yongs su g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni de gnyis ka la brtson 'grus cher rtsom pa'i lus kyi las so //
analyzed: yongs su g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni de gnyis ka la brtson 'grus cher rtsom pa'i lus kyi las so //
translated: Great movement is bodily action which is the means of attaining both.

original: spyod yul dang / yul dang / dmigs pa zhes bya ba rnams kyi don gyi bye brag ni gang gi bya ba la gnod pa med pa de ni de'i spyod yul lo //
analyzed: spyod yul dang / yul dang / dmigs pa zhes bya ba rnams kyi don gyi bye brag ni gang gi bya ba la gnod pa med pa de ni de'i spyod yul lo //
translated: The difference in meaning of the terms domain, object, and objective support is as follows: That which does not obstruct the activity of something is its domain.

original: yang gang gi blo gang la spyod pa la bya'o //ğŸ”½nyon mongs pa sna tshogs kyis 'ching bar byed pa'i don ni yul zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang gang gi blo gang la spyod pa la bya'o // nyon mongs pa sna tshogs kyis 'ching bar byed pa'i don ni yul zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, that which is the object of the activity of the mind is its domain.ğŸ”½The object is that which binds the mind through various afflictions.

original: sna tshogs kyis 'ching bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyis 'ching bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called the object because it binds the mind through various afflictions.

original: yang na bya ba la gnod pa med pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na bya ba la gnod pa med pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Or else, it is the non-obstruction of action, as before.

original: bdag tu snang ba'i 'dzin pa bskyed pa'i don ni dmigs pa'i don to //
analyzed: bdag tu snang ba'i 'dzin pa bskyed pa'i don ni dmigs pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the object of perception is the meaning of the appearance of self.

original: kha dog lta bu'o zhes bya ba @76b ni du ba dang khug rna la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog lta bu'o zhes bya ba @76b ni du ba dang khug rna la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of color is like smoke, mist, etc.

original: de ltar na dmigs pa de ni bstan pa dang / bshad pa dang / bshad pa'i bar du dbye ba dang / ngo bo nyid dang / rnam grangs dang / bsdu ba rnams kyis bstan te /ğŸ”½gzugs gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / mdor na kha dog dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / sngon po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / yang kha dog gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de la kha dog ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar na dmigs pa de ni bstan pa dang / bshad pa dang / bshad pa'i bar du dbye ba dang / ngo bo nyid dang / rnam grangs dang / bsdu ba rnams kyis bstan te / gzugs gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / mdor na kha dog dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / sngon po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / yang kha dog gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de la kha dog ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang /
translated: Thus, the object of perception is taught by way of its demonstration, explanation, division, nature, synonyms, and summary.

original: yang de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gi go rims bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: yang de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gi go rims bzhin du bstan to //
translated: The demonstration is by way of the questions, What is form? and so on, the explanation is by way of the statement, In brief, it is color and shape, the division is by way of the statement, Blue, and so on, the nature is by way of the statement, What is color? and so on, the synonyms are by way of the statement, It is also called 'visible form,' and so on, and the summary is by way of the statement, In brief, it is color and shape.ğŸ”½The explanation is by way of the questions, the explanation, the division, the nature, the synonyms, and the summary.

original: de la dbyibs dang rnam par rig byed ni kha dog las gud na med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dbyibs dang rnam par rig byed ni kha dog las gud na med pa'i phyir /
translated: Shape and expression do not exist apart from color.

original: yang de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas kha dog nyid kyi bsdu ba bstan to //ğŸ”½de dang lhan cig 'byung zhing mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos rnams te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas kha dog nyid kyi bsdu ba bstan to // de dang lhan cig 'byung zhing mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos rnams te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase â€œjust thatâ€ indicates that color alone is included.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthose phenomena that are concomitant with and arise simultaneously with the mindâ€ indicates that the mental factors are included.ğŸ”½If the phrase â€œconcomitantâ€ were omitted, it would be established that the mental factors arise simultaneously with the mind and are mental factors.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthose phenomena that are concomitant with and arise simultaneously with the mindâ€ is stated to indicate that they arise simultaneously and to indicate that they are mental factors.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya ba gzungs ba kho nas kyang lhan cig byung ba dang sems las byung ba nyid grub po zhe na /ğŸ”½lhan cig 'byung ba kho na yin no zhes nges par bya ba'i phyir dang / sems las byung ba'i sgra brjod pas sems la brten pa nyid du bstan pas sems gtso bo yin par shes par bya ba'i tshig gzhan yang smos te /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya ba gzungs ba kho nas kyang lhan cig byung ba dang sems las byung ba nyid grub po zhe na / lhan cig 'byung ba kho na yin no zhes nges par bya ba'i phyir dang / sems las byung ba'i sgra brjod pas sems la brten pa nyid du bstan pas sems gtso bo yin par shes par bya ba'i tshig gzhan yang smos te /
translated: The phrase â€œthose phenomena that are concomitant with and arise simultaneously with the mindâ€ is stated to indicate that they arise simultaneously and to indicate that they are mental factors.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthose phenomena that are concomitant with and arise simultaneously with the mindâ€ is stated to indicate that they arise simultaneously and to indicate that they are mental factors.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthose phenomena that are concomitant with and arise simultaneously with the mindâ€ is stated to indicate that they arise simultaneously and to indicate that they are mental factors.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthose phenomena that are concomitant with and arise simultaneously with the mindâ€ is stated to indicate that they arise simultaneously and to indicate that they are mental factors.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni grogs kyi don du bshad pa yin no //ğŸ”½yang na spyi dang bye brag gi sgra yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni grogs kyi don du bshad pa yin no //ğŸ”½yang na spyi dang bye brag gi sgra yin te /
translated: The phrase â€œthose phenomena that are concomitant with and arise simultaneously with the mindâ€ is stated to indicate that they arise simultaneously and to indicate that they are mental factors.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthose phenomena that are concomitant with and arise simultaneously with the mindâ€ is stated to indicate that they arise simultaneously and to indicate that they are mental factors.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthose phenomena that are concomitant with and arise simultaneously with the mindâ€ is stated to indicate that they arise simultaneously and to indicate that they are mental factors.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthose phenomena that are concomitant with and arise simultaneously with the mindâ€ is stated to indicate that they arise simultaneously and to indicate that they are mental factors.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthose phenomena that are concomitant with and arise simultaneously with the mindâ€ is stated to indicate that they arise simultaneously and to indicate that they are mental factors.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthose phenomena that are concomitant with and arise simultaneously with the mindâ€ is stated to indicate that they arise simultaneously and to indicate that they are mental factors.

original: gzhan dang mi 'khrul ba'i bye brag yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan dang mi 'khrul ba'i bye brag yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: But there is no fault, because it is a particular that is not confused with others.

original: reg pa zhes bya ba ni yul sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / gnyis ka las bzlog pa nyid du gzung ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: reg pa zhes bya ba ni yul sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / gnyis ka las bzlog pa nyid du gzung ba'i rnam pa ste /
translated: Contact is the aspect of grasping an object that is pleasant, unpleasant, or neither.

original: go rims bzhin du bde ba dang / sdug bsngal pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'i rten po yin la /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du bde ba dang / sdug bsngal pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'i rten po yin la /
