translated: It is the basis for the sensations of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain, respectively.

original: dbang po yang de bzhin du 'gyur ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: dbang po yang de bzhin du 'gyur ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: And it is the cause for the faculties to change in the same way.

original: 'di ltar sems las 'byung bar brjod par snang ba yid la byed pa la sogs pa de bzhin du de med na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir de ni rdzas su yod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems las 'byung bar brjod par snang ba yid la byed pa la sogs pa de bzhin du de med na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir de ni rdzas su yod do //
translated: Thus, mental factors such as attention are like the mind, and since visual consciousness does not occur when they are absent, they exist as real substances.

original: yang gcig tu na yid la byed pa la sogs pa thams cad kyang tshad ma gsum gyis khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: yang gcig tu na yid la byed pa la sogs pa thams cad kyang tshad ma gsum gyis khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: Or, all mental factors such as attention are to be understood by the three means of valid knowledge.

original: de la lus ni skye mched drug bstan pa de dang de dag las bcom ldan 'das kyis yid la byed pa nye bar gnas par gyur na zhes ji skad gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la lus ni skye mched drug bstan pa de dang de dag las bcom ldan 'das kyis yid la byed pa nye bar gnas par gyur na zhes ji skad gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
translated: The body is the six sense spheres, and the Bhagavat has said, â€œWhen the mental faculty is present and the dharmas are discerned, then the mental consciousness arises in dependence on the two.

original: gsum 'dus pa ni reg pa'o //
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa ni reg pa'o //
translated: The coming together of the three is contact.ğŸ”½Feeling, conceptualization, and volition arise simultaneously with contact.â€

original: reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang sems pa'o zhes ji skad @77a * //ğŸ”½gsungs pa lta bu'o //ğŸ”½tshor ba la sogs pa gsal ba rnams ni mngon sum ste /
analyzed: reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang sems pa'o zhes ji skad @77a * // gsungs pa lta bu'o // tshor ba la sogs pa gsal ba rnams ni mngon sum ste /
translated: And, â€œThe eye and form as condition, eye-consciousness arises.ğŸ”½The coming together of the three is contact.ğŸ”½Feeling, conceptualization, and volition arise simultaneously with contact.â€

original: rang gis rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gis rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The manifest elements such as feeling are direct perception because they are self-cognized.

original: rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba ltar na yul so sor rnam par rig pa dang / las tha dad pa'i phyir gzugs bzhin du rnam par shes pa las gzhan yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba ltar na yul so sor rnam par rig pa dang / las tha dad pa'i phyir gzugs bzhin du rnam par shes pa las gzhan yin no //
translated: According to the proponents of consciousness only, the object of perception is different from consciousness, like form, because it is the object of perception and is different from consciousness, the action.

original: mdo sde pa kha cig gi phyir tshor ba bzhin du sems las byung ba dag yod par brjod pa'i phyir reg pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa dag kyang gzhan pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo sde pa kha cig gi phyir tshor ba bzhin du sems las byung ba dag yod par brjod pa'i phyir reg pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa dag kyang gzhan pa yin no //
translated: because some Sautrantikas maintain that mental factors exist, like feelings, contact and attention, etc., are distinct from the mind.

original: yang na de las phung po gzhan zhig yin pa'i phyir gzugs bzhin te /
analyzed: yang na de las phung po gzhan zhig yin pa'i phyir gzugs bzhin te /
translated: Or, like form, they are a distinct aggregate because they are a different class.

original: rigs pa ni de dag la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa ni de dag la sogs pa'o //
translated: The reason is that they are of the same class as those.

original: lnga po de dag kun tu 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir brjod do //
analyzed: lnga po de dag kun tu 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir brjod do //
translated: They are called omnipresent because they are omnipresent in the five.

original: ci'i phyir lnga kho na zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lnga kho na zhe na /
translated: Why are there only five?

original: de dag las gang yang rung ba zhig med na yul gyi longs spyod kyi bya ba yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir nyung bar yang ma yin la dran pa dang / 'dun pa la sogs pa ni 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir mang ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag las gang yang rung ba zhig med na yul gyi longs spyod kyi bya ba yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir nyung bar yang ma yin la dran pa dang / 'dun pa la sogs pa ni 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir mang ba yang ma yin no //
translated: They are not fewer, because the activity of the enjoyment of objects is not complete if any one of them is absent. They are not more, because memory, desire, etc., are not always present.

original: de la yid la byed pa med na rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la yid la byed pa med na rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If there is no attention, consciousness does not occur,

original: tshogs pa ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the collection is incomplete.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang yid la byed pa nye bar gnas na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang yid la byed pa nye bar gnas na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The Lord has also said: â€œIf attention is present, eye consciousness arises.â€

original: yang gcig tu yid la byed pa dang / sems pa med na ma bsgrubs shing mngon par 'dus ma byas par rnam par shes pa ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: yang gcig tu yid la byed pa dang / sems pa med na ma bsgrubs shing mngon par 'dus ma byas par rnam par shes pa ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, if there is no attention and intention, how can consciousness arise without being produced and without being brought into existence?

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba med na yul mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / myong ba med pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba med na yul mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / myong ba med pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If there is no discernment and feeling, there would be no apprehension of the characteristics of an object and no experience of it.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'byung ba ni don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'byung ba ni don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the arising of consciousness would be meaningless.

original: reg pa med na tshor ba dang 'du shes dang / sems pa dag kyang mi 'byung ba kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: reg pa med na tshor ba dang 'du shes dang / sems pa dag kyang mi 'byung ba kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If there is no contact, there would be no feeling, discernment, or intention,

original: rten po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no support.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa bstan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa bstan pa'i mdo las /
translated: The Lord has also said in the SÅ«tra on the Teaching of the Appearance of the World:

original: reg pa byung na tshor ba 'byung la /
analyzed: reg pa byung na tshor ba 'byung la /
translated: â€œWhen contact occurs, feeling arises.

original: tshor ba byung na 'du shes dang 'du byed 'byung ngo zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshor ba byung na 'du shes dang 'du byed 'byung ngo zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: When there is feeling, there is perception and volitional formations.

original: yang tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni reg pa la brten pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni reg pa la brten pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: And it is said that all the aggregates of feeling, perception, and formations are dependent on contact.

original: de bzhin du gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu'i mdo las kyang reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu'i mdo las kyang reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba 'byung ste /
translated: In the same way, the SÅ«tra of the Elder ÅšÄriputra says: â€œFeeling arises in dependence on contact.

original: reg pa med na tshor ba mi 'byung ngo zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: reg pa med na tshor ba mi 'byung ngo zhes gsungs te /
translated: If there were no contact, feeling would not arise.â€

original: de'i phyir de dag ni gdon mi za bar 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni gdon mi za bar 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, these are definitely things that arise.

original: 'dun pa ni 'dod pa'i dngos po kho na la 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dun pa ni 'dod pa'i dngos po kho na la 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Desire arises only in relation to the object that is desired.

original: @77b gzhan la ma yin no //
analyzed: @77b gzhan la ma yin no //
translated: It does not arise in relation to anything else.

original: dran pa yang dris pa'i dngos po kho na la ste /
analyzed: dran pa yang dris pa'i dngos po kho na la ste /
translated: Recollection occurs only in relation to the object that is remembered.

original: gzhan la ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan la ma yin la /
translated: It does not occur in relation to anything else.

original: de dag la sogs pa gzhan yang 'khrul ba yod pa'i phyir ma nges pas de'i phyir kun tu 'gro ba ni lnga kho nar zad do //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa gzhan yang 'khrul ba yod pa'i phyir ma nges pas de'i phyir kun tu 'gro ba ni lnga kho nar zad do //
translated: and so on for the rest. Since they are uncertain because they are sometimes mistaken, therefore there are only five omnipresent mental factors.

original: sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan gang dag ces bya ba ni dran pa dang / dad pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //ğŸ”½rnam pa du ma yod par rtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i sems las byung ba dag bzhin du de dag dmigs pa yang tha dad par dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan gang dag ces bya ba ni dran pa dang / dad pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'o // rnam pa du ma yod par rtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i sems las byung ba dag bzhin du de dag dmigs pa yang tha dad par dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: The phrase â€œother mental factorsâ€ refers to mindfulness, faith, desire, and so on.

original: dmigs pa gcig la zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dmigs pa gcig la zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to eliminate the doubt that the objects of these mental factors are different, like other mental factors that are known to have many different aspects, the root text states, â€œThey have the same object.â€

original: ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag la dmigs pa'i phyir de dag gi dmigs pa tha dad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag la dmigs pa'i phyir de dag gi dmigs pa tha dad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Arenâ€™t the objects of these mental factors different, because they are distinguished by their own intrinsic natures?

original: de lta yin du zin kyang dmigs pa'i dngos po gcig pa'i phyir de skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de lta yin du zin kyang dmigs pa'i dngos po gcig pa'i phyir de skad ces smras so //
translated: Even though that is so, they are described in that way because they have the same object.

original: rnam pa du ma ste zhes bya ba ni yul gyi mtshan nyid tha dad pas 'dzin pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir rang gi rnam pa tha dad pa la bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa du ma ste zhes bya ba ni yul gyi mtshan nyid tha dad pas 'dzin pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir rang gi rnam pa tha dad pa la bya ste /
translated: Many aspects means that the aspects of the apprehender are different due to the difference in the characteristics of the object.

original: 'di ltar 'og nas kyang yul de nyid la sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / gnyis ka las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni reg pas rig par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'og nas kyang yul de nyid la sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / gnyis ka las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni reg pas rig par byed do //
translated: Thus, later it says, â€œThe pleasant, unpleasant, and opposite characteristics of that object are known through contact.â€

original: de nyid las tha snyad kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa ni 'du shes kyis rig par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //ğŸ”½re re 'byung la zhes bya ba ni sde tshan gcig las sems las byung ba yang gcig kho na 'byung gi gnyis pa mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nyid las tha snyad kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa ni 'du shes kyis rig par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo // re re 'byung la zhes bya ba ni sde tshan gcig las sems las byung ba yang gcig kho na 'byung gi gnyis pa mi 'byung ste /
translated: â€œThe conventional characteristics of that object are known through discriminationâ€ and so on.

original: don byas zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don byas zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One arises means that only one mental factor arises from one group, not a second, because its function has already been performed.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: With object means that the object is the same.

original: gang gi tshe mig gi yul yang gzugs yin pa'i tshe de la ci'i phyir sems las byung ba rnams dmigs pa dang bcas pa kho nar rnam par gzhag pa /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mig gi yul yang gzugs yin pa'i tshe de la ci'i phyir sems las byung ba rnams dmigs pa dang bcas pa kho nar rnam par gzhag pa /
translated: When the object of the eye is form, why are only mental factors said to have an object,

original: mig la sogs pa dag ni ma yin nam zhe na /ğŸ”½gang dmigs pa dang bcas na byung la med na mi 'byung ba de ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dag ni ma yin nam zhe na / gang dmigs pa dang bcas na byung la med na mi 'byung ba de ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: and not the eye faculty, etc.?ğŸ”½That which arises when there is an object and does not arise when there is not is said to have an object.

original: gang de med kyang 'byung ba de ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang de med kyang 'byung ba de ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa ma yin no //
translated: That which arises even when it is not present is said not to have an object.

original: yang 'di la yul ni dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang 'di la yul ni dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the object is not the object.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yin pas na brtsad du med do //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yin pas na brtsad du med do //
translated: It is the aspect of grasping, so there is no dispute.

original: de ni rnam pa drug tu blta bar bya ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa drug tu blta bar bya ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: It should be seen as sixfold.

original: de dag gi las ni mang du yod mod kyi las rnam pa drug kho nar brjod pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa las bye brag tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi las ni mang du yod mod kyi las rnam pa drug kho nar brjod pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa las bye brag tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although there are many actions, only six types of action are mentioned in order to distinguish them from mental consciousness.

original: 'di ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni rang gi lus dang / gzhan gyi yul dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi dang 'brel ba can gyi mtshan nyid la sogs pa dang / dus gsum dang / rgyun la yang dmigs pas na de las bye brag tu bstan pa'i phyir tshig bzhi po de dag @78a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni rang gi lus dang / gzhan gyi yul dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi dang 'brel ba can gyi mtshan nyid la sogs pa dang / dus gsum dang / rgyun la yang dmigs pas na de las bye brag tu bstan pa'i phyir tshig bzhi po de dag @78a * //
translated: In order to distinguish it from these, the four terms are used.

original: smos so // yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni rang dbang dang / gzhan gyi dbang gis dge ba la sogs pa nyid yin gyi lnga po dag ni gzhan gyi dbang kho nar zad do //
analyzed: smos so // yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni rang dbang dang / gzhan gyi dbang gis dge ba la sogs pa nyid yin gyi lnga po dag ni gzhan gyi dbang kho nar zad do //
translated: The mental consciousness is virtuous, etc., by its own power and by the power of others, but the five are only by the power of others.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is nonconceptual,

original: las kun nas slong ba dang / sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: las kun nas slong ba dang / sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: it should be said that it instigates action and appropriates pleasant and unpleasant results in the same way.

original: sgra rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: sgra rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: The classification of the words is from the perspective of defilement and purification.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa las brtsams nas zin pas bskyod pa las byung ba'i sgra dang / ma zin pas bskyod pa las byung ba'i sgra dang de'i rab tu dbye ba yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa las brtsams nas zin pas bskyod pa las byung ba'i sgra dang / ma zin pas bskyod pa las byung ba'i sgra dang de'i rab tu dbye ba yongs su bstan to //
translated: In this regard, the sound that arises from the vibration of the grasped and the sound that arises from the vibration of the ungrasped, beginning with the defilements, and their divisions have been taught.

original: de la zin pas bskyod pa las byung ba la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la zin pas bskyod pa las byung ba la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: In this regard, the sound that arises from the vibration of the grasped is also threefold:

original: zin pa dang ma zin pa las byung ba dang / zin pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: zin pa dang ma zin pa las byung ba dang / zin pa las byung ba ste /
translated: arising from the grasped and the ungrasped, arising from the grasped,ğŸ”½and arising from the ungrasped.

original: tshig gsum dang / bzhi dang / gnyis dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshig gsum dang / bzhi dang / gnyis dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is connected with three, four, and two phrases, respectively.

original: ma zin pas bskyod pa las byung ba ni rlung dang shing gi sgra gcig pu dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ma zin pas bskyod pa las byung ba ni rlung dang shing gi sgra gcig pu dang sbyar ro //
translated: The sound that arises from the vibration of the ungrasped is connected with the sound of wind and trees alone.

original: de'i rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de'i rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Its division is also threefold:ğŸ”½the conventional and the unconven-tional, the manifest and the unmanifest, and the one and the many.

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa tha snyad ma yin pa dang / gsal ba dang mi gsal ba dang / gcig dang du ma sta tshig bzhi dang / gsum dang / gnyis dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa tha snyad ma yin pa dang / gsal ba dang mi gsal ba dang / gcig dang du ma sta tshig bzhi dang / gsum dang / gnyis dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is connected with four, three, and two phrases, respectively.

original: rnam par byang ba las brtsams nas thog ma dang / bar dang / tha ma rnams su lung ma nod pa la sogs pa sgra la smos pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba las brtsams nas thog ma dang / bar dang / tha ma rnams su lung ma nod pa la sogs pa sgra la smos pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: In the case of purification, the first, middle, and last are applied to the terms â€œunheardâ€ and so on.

original: de la gar byed pa'i sgra zhes bya ba ni gar mkhan gyi lus dang rgyan gyi sgra'o //
analyzed: de la gar byed pa'i sgra zhes bya ba ni gar mkhan gyi lus dang rgyan gyi sgra'o //
translated: The term â€œdanceâ€ refers to the body and ornaments of a dancer.

original: sgra bo che zhes bya ba ni zin pa dang ma zin pa las byung ba'i sgra sna tshogs 'dres pa las rlom pa dang bcas pa'i sgra 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sgra bo che zhes bya ba ni zin pa dang ma zin pa las byung ba'i sgra sna tshogs 'dres pa las rlom pa dang bcas pa'i sgra 'byung ngo //
translated: The term â€œloud soundâ€ refers to the sound of a mixture of various sounds, both articulated and inarticulate, from which a sound with conceit arises.

original: phung po bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /ğŸ”½kun nas nyon mongs de rab dbye //
analyzed: phung po bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ni / kun nas nyon mongs de rab dbye //
translated: A verse on the inclusion of the aggregates:

original: rnam par byang ba gsum gsum ste //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba gsum gsum ste //
translated: The aggregates are included in the three:ğŸ”½affliction, action, and birth.ğŸ”½They are taught by ten terms, nine,

original: sgra tshig bcu dang dgu dag dang // lhag ma rnams kyis yongs su bstan //
analyzed: sgra tshig bcu dang dgu dag dang // lhag ma rnams kyis yongs su bstan //
translated: and the rest.

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan du na de nyid 'jug pa dang ldog pa las brtsams pa ste /
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan du na de nyid 'jug pa dang ldog pa las brtsams pa ste /
translated: Moreover, there is another enumeration, beginning with engagement and disengagement.

original: de la 'jug pa'i rnam pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i rnam pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: Therein, engagement is fourfold:

original: ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba dang / zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba dang / zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni tshig gsum pa gnyis kyis bstan to //
analyzed: ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba dang / zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba dang / zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni tshig gsum pa gnyis kyis bstan to //
translated: The third and fourth phrases indicate that sound is derived from the great elements that are not grasped, from the great elements that are both grasped and not grasped, and from the great elements that are grasped.

original: de'i rab tu dbye ba ni tshig bcu gsum gyis bstan to //
analyzed: de'i rab tu dbye ba ni tshig bcu gsum gyis bstan to //
translated: The fifth phrase indicates the classification of sound.

original: rab tu dbye ba yang bye brag yod pa'i phyir rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba yang bye brag yod pa'i phyir rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The classification is fourfold because there are distinctions.

original: rten du gtogs pa dang / rjod pa dang / brjod @78b par bya bar gtogs pa dang / tshad du gtogs pa dang / rang bzhin dang / 'gyur bar gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rten du gtogs pa dang / rjod pa dang / brjod @78b par bya bar gtogs pa dang / tshad du gtogs pa dang / rang bzhin dang / 'gyur bar gtogs pa'o //
translated: Sound is classified as belonging to the body, to speech, to the expressible, to the expressible measure, to nature, and to change.

original: de la rten ni sems can du bgrang ba dang sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la rten ni sems can du bgrang ba dang sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The body is either sentient or non-sentient.

original: sems can yang rnam par byang bar rung ba dang mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: sems can yang rnam par byang bar rung ba dang mi rung ba'o //
translated: Sentient beings are either capable of purification or incapable of purification.

original: mi rung ba ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas la sogs pa'i 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: mi rung ba ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas la sogs pa'i 'gro ba ste /
translated: Those incapable of purification are those in the animal realm, etc.

original: de ni glang po che lta bu ste /
analyzed: de ni glang po che lta bu ste /
translated: They are like elephants, etc.

original: glang po che dregs pa pa dga' ba'i sgra 'u ru ru ni sgra po che zhes bya'o //
analyzed: glang po che dregs pa pa dga' ba'i sgra 'u ru ru ni sgra po che zhes bya'o //
translated: The sound of an elephant in rut is called â€œloudâ€ ururura.

original: rung ba ni bud med dang skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rung ba ni bud med dang skyes pa'o //
translated: The sound of a woman or a man is â€œsuitableâ€ yukta.

original: sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa de ni rlung dang nags tshal gyi sgra lta bu'o //ğŸ”½rjod par gtogs pa'i bye brag ni gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa de ni rlung dang nags tshal gyi sgra lta bu'o // rjod par gtogs pa'i bye brag ni gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid do //
translated: The sound of wind or a forest is â€œnot counted as a sentient beingâ€ asattvÄkhya.ğŸ”½The sound of a bell is â€œarticulateâ€ sphuta.

original: brjod par bya bar gtogs pa'i bye brag ni don dang ldan pa dang don med pa nyid do //ğŸ”½tshad ni chung ngu dang 'bring po dang chen po nyid do //ğŸ”½rang bzhin ni chos kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par ma 'khrugs pa gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la brten pa'i sgra ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya bar gtogs pa'i bye brag ni don dang ldan pa dang don med pa nyid do // tshad ni chung ngu dang 'bring po dang chen po nyid do // rang bzhin ni chos kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par ma 'khrugs pa gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la brten pa'i sgra ste /
translated: The sound of a drum is â€œinarticulateâ€ asphuta.ğŸ”½The sound of a small, medium or great drum is â€œsmall, medium or greatâ€ alpamadhyÄdhimÄtra.

original: chu klung gi sgra lta bu'o //
analyzed: chu klung gi sgra lta bu'o //
translated: The sound of a river is â€œnaturalâ€ svabhÄva.

original: 'gyur ba ni chos gzhan gyis shin tu g-yengs pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba 'byung ba'i gnas de la brten pa ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ba ni chos gzhan gyis shin tu g-yengs pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba 'byung ba'i gnas de la brten pa ste /
translated: The sound of a person who is distracted by other things is â€œalteredâ€ anyathÄ«bhÅ«ta.

original: ca co'i sgra lta bu'o //
analyzed: ca co'i sgra lta bu'o //
translated: The sound of a person who is confused is â€œconfusedâ€ sammÅ«á¸ha.

original: de bzhin du 'byed par byad pa zhes bya ba'i rlung gis chu dag bskyod pa las sgra 'byung ba de la bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'byed par byad pa zhes bya ba'i rlung gis chu dag bskyod pa las sgra 'byung ba de la bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the wind called â€œdissectorâ€ causes the water to move, and sound arises from that.

original: ldog pa yang dus bzhi'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: ldog pa yang dus bzhi'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The cessation of sound is also of four types, according to the four times.

original: len pa'i dus dang / de nas 'don pa'i dus dang / de nas 'chang ba'i dus dang / de nas bdag dang gzhan gyi rgol ba la tshar bcad pa dang phan gdags pa'i dus so //
analyzed: len pa'i dus dang / de nas 'don pa'i dus dang / de nas 'chang ba'i dus dang / de nas bdag dang gzhan gyi rgol ba la tshar bcad pa dang phan gdags pa'i dus so //
translated: The time of taking up, the time of emitting, the time of holding, and the time of refuting and establishing for oneself and others.

original: bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /ğŸ”½'jug dang de yi rab dbye dang // ldog pa yang na rnam pa bzhi //ğŸ”½dung dang sgra chen lung nod pa'i //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ni / 'jug dang de yi rab dbye dang // ldog pa yang na rnam pa bzhi // dung dang sgra chen lung nod pa'i //
translated: A verse summarizing the chapterğŸ”½Sound is to be understood as having four aspects:ğŸ”½its occurrence, its classification,

original: sgra la sogs pas yongs su bstan //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pas yongs su bstan //
translated: its cessation, and its analogy.

original: gang nang dang phyi rkyen du gyur pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni nang dang phyi'i 'byung bdag ni sgra 'byung ba'i byed rgyu yin gyi gnas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang nang dang phyi rkyen du gyur pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni nang dang phyi'i 'byung bdag ni sgra 'byung ba'i byed rgyu yin gyi gnas ni ma yin no //
translated: The internal and external conditions are the cause of the occurrence of sound, but not its basis.

original: sgra'i gnas ni rang gi 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag kho na ste /
analyzed: sgra'i gnas ni rang gi 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag kho na ste /
translated: The basis of sound is only the four great elements of its own stage.

original: sgra kho na bzhin du gnas so //
analyzed: sgra kho na bzhin du gnas so //
translated: It is like sound.

original: gang dbang po dang tha dad du mi gnas pa'i sgra de ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po dag kho na la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gang dbang po dang tha dad du mi gnas pa'i sgra de ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po dag kho na la gnas pa ste /
translated: The sound that does not exist separately from the sense faculty exists in the great elements of the sense faculty itself.

original: de'i phyir de ni zin pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni zin pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, it is considered to be appropriated.

original: sgra 'byung ba na yul ji srid du grag pa'i yul de nyid du 'phral la khyab par byed cing cig car 'byung ste /
analyzed: sgra 'byung ba na yul ji srid du grag pa'i yul de nyid du 'phral la khyab par byed cing cig car 'byung ste /
translated: When sound arises, it pervades the very place where it is heard, and it arises simultaneously.

original: mar me'i 'od dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mar me'i 'od dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like the light of a lamp.

original: de'i phyir che chung du 'byung zhing 'gro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir che chung du 'byung zhing 'gro ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it does not arise as large or small, nor does it go.

original: dri zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyis ni brda'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam pa bsdu ba'i mtshan @79a * //
analyzed: dri zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyis ni brda'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam pa bsdu ba'i mtshan @79a * //
translated: The words â€œsmell, etc.â€ indicate the characteristics of conventional symbols and the characteristics of the collection of forms.

original: nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rang gi ngo bor gtogs pa'i rnam grangs kyi mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi ngo bor gtogs pa'i rnam grangs kyi mtshan nyid bstan te /
analyzed: nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rang gi ngo bor gtogs pa'i rnam grangs kyi mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi ngo bor gtogs pa'i rnam grangs kyi mtshan nyid bstan te /
translated: The characteristics of the elements are taught as the characteristics of the individual elements, the characteristics of the general elements, the characteristics of the elements that are beneficial and harmful, the characteristics of the classification of the elements, the characteristics of the synonyms that pertain to their own nature, and the characteristics of the synonyms that pertain to the nature of others.

original: gcig dang gcig dang gnyis dag dang // gsum po dag dang gcig dang ni //
analyzed: gcig dang gcig dang gnyis dag dang // gsum po dag dang gcig dang ni //
translated: One, one, two, three,

original: lnga po dag dang bzhi rnams dang // lhag ma rnams kyis yongs su bstan //
analyzed: lnga po dag dang bzhi rnams dang // lhag ma rnams kyis yongs su bstan //
translated: one, five, four, and the rest.

original: ro la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ro la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Taste should be explained in the same way.

original: reg bya'i rnam par gzhag pa ni gdags par bya ba'i gzhi dang / gdags par bya ba'o //
analyzed: reg bya'i rnam par gzhag pa ni gdags par bya ba'i gzhi dang / gdags par bya ba'o //
translated: The presentation of the tangible consists of the basis of designation and the object of designation.

original: gdags par bya ba'i gzhi ni 'byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: gdags par bya ba'i gzhi ni 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: The basis of designation is the four great elements.

original: gdags par bya ba dag ni yang ba nyid la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gdags par bya ba dag ni yang ba nyid la sogs pa ste /
translated: The object of designation is lightness, etc.

original: 'byung ba chen po de lta bur gyur pa dag kho na la gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½de la lci ba ma yin pa rnams dang / lci ba rnams dang / dang ba rnams dang / dang ba ma yin pa rnams dang / chu dang rlung 'dres pa las byung ba rnams la ni go rims bzhin du yang ba la sogs pa 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po de lta bur gyur pa dag kho na la gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro // de la lci ba ma yin pa rnams dang / lci ba rnams dang / dang ba rnams dang / dang ba ma yin pa rnams dang / chu dang rlung 'dres pa las byung ba rnams la ni go rims bzhin du yang ba la sogs pa 'dogs par byed do //
translated: because the designation is made in relation to the great elements which are the cause of heaviness, etc.ğŸ”½Among them, heaviness, etc., are designated in relation to the great elements which are not heavy, heavy, fluid, hot, and which arise from the combination of water and wind, respectively.

original: ston pa ma tshang ba rnams la ni bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / nyam chung ba dag go //
analyzed: ston pa ma tshang ba rnams la ni bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / nyam chung ba dag go //
translated: Among them, hunger, thirst, and weakness are the deficiencies of heat, wind, and bile, respectively.

original: de ma tshang ba med cing mi mnyam pa med pa rnams la ni ngoms pa dang nyams stobs so //
analyzed: de ma tshang ba med cing mi mnyam pa med pa rnams la ni ngoms pa dang nyams stobs so //
translated: Satiation and strength are the absence of deficiency and the absence of inequality of these three.

original: mi mnyam par gyur pas 'khrul ba 'byung ba rnams dang / na tshod rnam par gyur pa byung ba rnams dang / srog gi dbang po 'gags pa rnams dang / khrag gi nyes pa byung ba rnams dang / zas ngan pa zos pas ngal ba byung ba rnams dang /
analyzed: mi mnyam par gyur pas 'khrul ba 'byung ba rnams dang / na tshod rnam par gyur pa byung ba rnams dang / srog gi dbang po 'gags pa rnams dang / khrag gi nyes pa byung ba rnams dang / zas ngan pa zos pas ngal ba byung ba rnams dang /
translated: Those that arise from an imbalance of the elements, those that arise from a change in age, those that arise from the cessation of the life faculty, those that arise from a fault in blood, those that arise from the exhaustion of eating bad food,

original: sa dang chu 'dres pa las byung ba rnams dang / 'bad pa dang sha thang ba dang ldan pa rnams dang / 'bad pa dang sha thang ba med pa rnams dang / mnyan zhing snyi ba rnams dang / dri mas yongs su gos pa dang bral ba rnams la ni nad la sogs pa 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: sa dang chu 'dres pa las byung ba rnams dang / 'bad pa dang sha thang ba dang ldan pa rnams dang / 'bad pa dang sha thang ba med pa rnams dang / mnyan zhing snyi ba rnams dang / dri mas yongs su gos pa dang bral ba rnams la ni nad la sogs pa 'dogs par byed do //
translated: those that arise from a mixture of earth and water, those that arise from exertion and fatigue, those that arise without exertion and fatigue, those that are soft and tender, and those that are free from being covered by impurities are designated as diseases, etc.

original: gdags par bya ba rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa yang 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: gdags par bya ba rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa yang 'di dag yin te /
translated: These are the principles of what is to be designated:

original: mi 'bying ba dang 'bying ba las ni yang ba nyid dang lci ba nyid do //
analyzed: mi 'bying ba dang 'bying ba las ni yang ba nyid dang lci ba nyid do //
translated: Lightness and heaviness arise from non-sinking and sinking, respectively.

original: man bas na phan pa dang gnod pa las ni 'jam pa nyid dang rtsub pa nyid do //ğŸ”½rkang pa phyil ba las ni 'dred pa nyid do //
analyzed: man bas na phan pa dang gnod pa las ni 'jam pa nyid dang rtsub pa nyid do // rkang pa phyil ba las ni 'dred pa nyid do //
translated: Smoothness and roughness are respectively derived from the benefit and harm of the tangible.ğŸ”½Sliminess is derived from the swelling of the body.

original: nges par btsir du rung ba las ni nem nem po nyid do //
analyzed: nges par btsir du rung ba las ni nem nem po nyid do //
translated: Weight is derived from the heaviness of the body.

original: lhag ma rnams ni lus 'gyur ba las gdags par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni lus 'gyur ba las gdags par bya'o //
translated: The remaining ones should be understood as being designated from the transformation of the body.

original: mig kyang yongs su nyams la zhes bya ba'i rigs pa las mig kyang yongs su nyams la zhes smos pa @79b ni gcig ma tshang na yang rnam par shes pa 'byung ba med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: mig kyang yongs su nyams la zhes bya ba'i rigs pa las mig kyang yongs su nyams la zhes smos pa @79b ni gcig ma tshang na yang rnam par shes pa 'byung ba med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro /
translated: The phrase â€œand the eye is destroyedâ€ is stated in the verse because the arising of consciousness is impossible even if one of the conditions is missing.

original: mig gi rab tu dbye ba de yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: mig gi rab tu dbye ba de yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The classification of the eye is of five types:

original: lhag ma ma lus pa dang / nyams pa dang bcas pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa dang / las las gyur pa dang / nang dang phyi rol gyis gnod par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ma lus pa dang / nyams pa dang bcas pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa dang / las las gyur pa dang / nang dang phyi rol gyis gnod par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: complete, incomplete, damaged, innate, and derived from action.

original: lhan cig skyes pa zhes bya ba ni dmus long lta bu'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa zhes bya ba ni dmus long lta bu'o //
translated: The innate eye is like that of a newborn child or a blind person.

original: gzugs kyang snang bar gyur du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni gzugs gang bstan du yod pa dang / ha cang phra mo ma yin pa dang / ma reg pa dang / ma bsgribs pa dang / snang ba dang bcas pa dang / ha cang bskal ba ma yin pa dang /ğŸ”½rang dang 'og ma'i sa pa dag go //
analyzed: gzugs kyang snang bar gyur du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni gzugs gang bstan du yod pa dang / ha cang phra mo ma yin pa dang / ma reg pa dang / ma bsgribs pa dang / snang ba dang bcas pa dang / ha cang bskal ba ma yin pa dang / rang dang 'og ma'i sa pa dag go //
translated: If form is visible,

original: lha'i mig dang ldan pa kha cig gis ni mun khung na yang mthong ste ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: lha'i mig dang ldan pa kha cig gis ni mun khung na yang mthong ste ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: it is visible to some who possess the divine eye, even in the dark.ğŸ”½It is visible to those of the same level or lower levels.

original: de dang 'byung ba yid la byed pa yang nye bar ngas par gyur na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dang 'byung ba yid la byed pa yang nye bar ngas par gyur na zhes bya ba la /
translated: If the attention is directed to the element,ğŸ”½it is visible to those who direct their attention to the element.

original: yid la byed pa ni rnam pa lngas nye bar gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni rnam pa lngas nye bar gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: Attention is directed in five ways:

original: 'dod pa dang / goms pa dang / gzhan gyis mtshon pa dang / dran pa dang / yul rags pas so //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / goms pa dang / gzhan gyis mtshon pa dang / dran pa dang / yul rags pas so //
translated: through desire, through familiarity, through being indicated by another, through memory, and through gross objects.

original: de dang 'byung ba yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyi 'jug pa gang yin pa rang gi bag chags sad pas gnas yongs su ma nyams pa de dang / gzugs snang bar gyur pa de dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa de dang lhan cig tu mngon par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'byung ba yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyi 'jug pa gang yin pa rang gi bag chags sad pas gnas yongs su ma nyams pa de dang / gzugs snang bar gyur pa de dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa de dang lhan cig tu mngon par 'grub pa'o //
translated: And the phrase â€œthe occurrence of the primary elements in the mindâ€ means that the occurrence of the mind is the occurrence of the eye consciousness together with the occurrence of the primary elements that have not deteriorated, the occurrence of the form that appears, and the occurrence of the mental consciousness that arises from the eye consciousness.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthe occurrence of the three types of mindâ€ is a reference to the statement in the verse that â€œthe three types of mind occur.â€ The phrase â€œthe object that is perceivedâ€ refers to the mental consciousness that is associated with the eye consciousness.

original: sems rnam pa gsum 'byung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba brjod pa'i rigs pa las dmigs par gyur te zhes smos pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba de ni pa las byung ba zhes bya ba ni
analyzed: sems rnam pa gsum 'byung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba brjod pa'i rigs pa las dmigs par gyur te zhes smos pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba de ni pa las byung ba zhes bya ba ni
translated: The phrase â€œthe occurrence of the primary elementsâ€ refers to the occurrence of the primary elements that have not deteriorated.

original: don gyi ngo bo nyid tsam nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi ngo bo nyid tsam nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase â€œthe occurrence of the objectâ€ refers to the occurrence of the form that appears.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthe occurrence of the mindâ€ refers to the occurrence of the eye consciousness.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthe occurrence of the object that is perceivedâ€ refers to the occurrence of the mental consciousness that arises from the eye consciousness.

original: 'di ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang rnam pa de lta bur gyur pa yin pas nye bar gnas pa las byung bar 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang rnam pa de lta bur gyur pa yin pas nye bar gnas pa las byung bar 'dod do //
translated: The phrase â€œthe occurrence of the object that is perceivedâ€ refers to the occurrence of the mental consciousness that arises from the eye consciousness.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthe occurrence of the object that is perceivedâ€ refers to the occurrence of the mental consciousness that arises from the eye consciousness.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthe occurrence of the object that is perceivedâ€ refers to the occurrence of the mental consciousness that arises from the eye consciousness.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthe occurrence of the object that is perceivedâ€ refers to the occurrence of the mental consciousness that arises from the eye consciousness.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthe occurrence of the object that is perceivedâ€ refers to the occurrence of the mental consciousness that arises from the eye consciousness.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthe occurrence of the object that is perceivedâ€ refers to the occurrence of the mental consciousness that arises from the eye consciousness.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthe occurrence of the object that is perceivedâ€ refers to the occurrence of the mental consciousness that arises from the eye consciousness.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthe occurrence of the object that is perceivedâ€ refers to the occurrence of the mental consciousness that arises from the eye consciousness.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthe occurrence of the object that is perceivedâ€ refers to the occurrence of the mental consciousness that arises from the eye consciousness.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthe occurrence of the object that is perceivedâ€ refers to the occurrence of the mental consciousness that arises from the eye consciousness.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthe occurrence of the object that is perceivedâ€ refers to the occurrence of the mental consciousness that arises from the

original: 'og nas kyang de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa rtsol ba med la rnam par g-yengs shing ma 'dris pa la dmigs pa na /
analyzed: 'og nas kyang de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa rtsol ba med la rnam par g-yengs shing ma 'dris pa la dmigs pa na /
translated: When the mental consciousness is not active, but the distracted and untrained mental consciousness is focused on an object,

original: 'dun pa la sogs pa 'jug pa'i med pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa de yang nye bar gnas pa las byung bar brjod par bya'o zhes ji skad 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa la sogs pa 'jug pa'i med pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa de yang nye bar gnas pa las byung bar brjod par bya'o zhes ji skad 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: then that mental consciousness, which is not engaged in aspiration and so on, is said to arise from the mind that is present.

original: 'on gang 'dod pa kho na nas mig gi rnam par shes pa nyid do zhes 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'on gang 'dod pa kho na nas mig gi rnam par shes pa nyid do zhes 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: But it is said in the sutra that the visual consciousness is the first.

original: dang po nyid ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'o zhes de ltar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: dang po nyid ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'o zhes de ltar blta bar bya ste /
translated: The first should be understood as the visual consciousness,

original: de ni rtag tu rnam par mi rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rtag tu rnam par mi rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is always nonconceptual.

original: dang po zhes bya ba ni nye bar gnas pa las byung ba @80a * //
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba ni nye bar gnas pa las byung ba @80a * //
translated: The first is the visual consciousness, which arises from the present.

original: bzhin no // tshol ba zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pas mthong ba'i lus 'das pa de nyid la mngon par gsal bar bya ba'i tshul gyis yongs su tshol ba la bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin no // tshol ba zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pas mthong ba'i lus 'das pa de nyid la mngon par gsal bar bya ba'i tshul gyis yongs su tshol ba la bya'o //
translated: The search is the mental consciousness, which searches for the body that was seen by the visual consciousness in the past, in the manner of making it manifest.

original: gsal ba de nyid 'di ni sngon po'i zhes bya ba'i 'du shes dang 'brel ba'i dran pa dang ldan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba de ni nges pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gsal ba de nyid 'di ni sngon po'i zhes bya ba'i 'du shes dang 'brel ba'i dran pa dang ldan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba de ni nges pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The arising of the mental consciousness associated with the memory of the idea of â€œthis is blueâ€ is called â€œdetermination.â€

original: de la nye bar gnas pa las byung ba ni don tsam la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de la nye bar gnas pa las byung ba ni don tsam la dmigs pa ste /
translated: Among these, that which arises from the presence of the object is the mere perception of the object.

original: yul gyi gzugs brnyan gyi ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: yul gyi gzugs brnyan gyi ngo bo yin no //
translated: It is the nature of the image of the object.

original: tshol ba pa ni don la rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: tshol ba pa ni don la rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The seeking is the conceptualization of the object.

original: gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan ma la rjes su dpyod pa dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan ma la rjes su dpyod pa dang mthun pa'o //
translated: It is in conformity with the investigation of the sign of the image.

original: nges pa ni don la rnam par rtog pa dang / de'i ming la dmigs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa ni don la rnam par rtog pa dang / de'i ming la dmigs par byed pa'o //
translated: The determination is the conceptualization of the object and the apprehension of its name.

original: nges pa'i sems phan chad nas zhes bya ba ni de rnam par rtog pa nyid yin pa dang / rang gi 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang / de ma thag tu mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la 'dod chags la sogs pa 'phel bar byed pas de'i phyir de'i rgyu mthun pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: nges pa'i sems phan chad nas zhes bya ba ni de rnam par rtog pa nyid yin pa dang / rang gi 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang / de ma thag tu mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la 'dod chags la sogs pa 'phel bar byed pas de'i phyir de'i rgyu mthun pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: The phrase â€œafter ascertainmentâ€ indicates that it is conceptual, it possesses oneâ€™s own attachment, etc., and it increases attachment, etc., immediately after eye consciousness, etc. Therefore, it is taught to be natural outflow.

original: 'dir tshol ba ba ni 'khor lo dang po kho na la 'byung gi nges pa'i 'og tu 'byung ba mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i mjug thogs su 'khor lo gnyis pa la sogs pa dag la ni mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dir tshol ba ba ni 'khor lo dang po kho na la 'byung gi nges pa'i 'og tu 'byung ba mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i mjug thogs su 'khor lo gnyis pa la sogs pa dag la ni mi 'byung ste /
translated: Here, investigation occurs only in the first wheel, but after ascertainment, it does not occur in the second wheel, etc., immediately after eye consciousness, etc.

original: yul gsal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: yul gsal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because the object becomes clear.

original: /'on tshol ba pa ni mjug thogs su nges par 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: /'on tshol ba pa ni mjug thogs su nges par 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: But if investigation occurs immediately after ascertainment?

original: 'khor lo dang po la 'byung ba mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i dbang du byas nas smras pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'khor lo dang po la 'byung ba mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i dbang du byas nas smras pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault, because the first wheel was spoken from the perspective of the arising of the eye consciousness and so on that arise in dependence on the primary elements.

original: lhan cig rgyu ba rnam par ma bzhag na tshol ba pa yin par lta'o //
analyzed: lhan cig rgyu ba rnam par ma bzhag na tshol ba pa yin par lta'o //
translated: If the mental factors are not posited as accompanying it, then it is seen to be a searcher.

original: rnam par bzhag na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par bzhag na ni ma yin te /
translated: If they are posited as accompanying it, then it is not.

original: lhan cig rgyu ba nyid kyis mngon par gsal bar byas zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //ğŸ”½'dir ni lhan cig rgyu ba med kyang rnam par bzhag la /
analyzed: lhan cig rgyu ba nyid kyis mngon par gsal bar byas zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro // 'dir ni lhan cig rgyu ba med kyang rnam par bzhag la /
translated: This is because it is already clearly established as accompanying them.ğŸ”½Here the mental factors do not accompany it, but they are posited as accompanying it in other sources.

original: gzhan nas ni lhan cig rgyu ba dang lhan cig go zhes 'byung ba dang / 'dir ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bag chags kyi gzhi yin par bshad la ;
analyzed: gzhan nas ni lhan cig rgyu ba dang lhan cig go zhes 'byung ba dang / 'dir ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bag chags kyi gzhi yin par bshad la ;
translated: In this text the foundation consciousness is explained to be the basis of the habitual propensities,ğŸ”½but in other sources it is said to be form and so on.

original: gzhan nas ni gzugs la sogs pa'o zhes 'byung ste bstan bcos thams cad dang 'gal ba kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan nas ni gzugs la sogs pa'o zhes 'byung ste bstan bcos thams cad dang 'gal ba kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it not the case that this contradicts all of the treatises?

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa ni tshul rnam pa bzhis zab pa yin gyi ma rtogs bzhin du spong bar ma byed par sdod cig / rjes su 'jug pa'i tshul ni 'gyur byed kyi chu klung gi mdo las /ğŸ”½@80b byang chub kyi yan lag rnams ni bsgom pa'i lam yin no zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu dang / rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las kyang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang gzugs kyi bye brag gi sems kyi bag chags kyi gzhi yin te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa ni tshul rnam pa bzhis zab pa yin gyi ma rtogs bzhin du spong bar ma byed par sdod cig / rjes su 'jug pa'i tshul ni 'gyur byed kyi chu klung gi mdo las / @80b byang chub kyi yan lag rnams ni bsgom pa'i lam yin no zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu dang / rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las kyang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang gzugs kyi bye brag gi sems kyi bag chags kyi gzhi yin te /
translated: The way of engagement is like the statement in the Sutra on the River Ganges,ğŸ”½â€œThe branches of enlightenment are the path of meditation,â€ğŸ”½and also like the Compendium of Ascertainments, which says,

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par ma bzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o ;
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par ma bzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o ;
translated: â€œThe various forms of the engaging consciousness are the basis of the habitual tendencies of the mind because they are not posited as the foundation consciousness.â€

original: / mtshan nyid kyi de kho na'i tshul ni yongs su rdzogs shing ldem por dgongs pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: / mtshan nyid kyi de kho na'i tshul ni yongs su rdzogs shing ldem por dgongs pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The way of reality in terms of its characteristics is because the reality of the characteristics is taught completely and without any hidden intent.

original: ji skad du rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las lhan cig rgyu ba la sogs pa bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las lhan cig rgyu ba la sogs pa bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the Compendium of Ascertainments explains that the foundation consciousness is the support of the first seven consciousnesses, it is the support of the afflicted view of the self, and it is the support of the three natures.

original: gzhug pa'i tshul ni kha cig don zhib mo dag la khad kyis gzhug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhug pa'i tshul ni kha cig don zhib mo dag la khad kyis gzhug pa'i phyir te /
translated: The mode of introduction is because some are gradually introduced to subtle topics.

original: ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa 'di nyid du 'di ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa smos kyang de'i dmigs pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba ma byas te /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa 'di nyid du 'di ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa smos kyang de'i dmigs pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba ma byas te /
translated: For example, in this very presentation, although the foundation consciousness is mentioned, its object and so on are not analyzed.

original: dmigs pa phra ba dang / gya tshom du 'jug par dga' ba'i phyir te //
analyzed: dmigs pa phra ba dang / gya tshom du 'jug par dga' ba'i phyir te //
translated: This is because its object is subtle and it is said to engage randomly.

original: de bzhin du lhan cig rgyu bar yang rnam par dbye ba ma byas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhan cig rgyu bar yang rnam par dbye ba ma byas pa lta bu'o //
translated: Similarly, although it is said to coexist with the first seven consciousnesses, it is not analyzed.

original: mdo sde'i ldem por dgongs pa'i tshul ni 'og nas bsgoms pa las 'byung ba'i las mtha' dag ni byams pa yin no zhes ji skad 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i skabs nas rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mdo sde'i ldem por dgongs pa'i tshul ni 'og nas bsgoms pa las 'byung ba'i las mtha' dag ni byams pa yin no zhes ji skad 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i skabs nas rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: The mode of intention in sutra is like the statement below, â€œAll karma that arises from meditation is love,â€ and from the section on dependent arising, â€œWhat is consciousness?

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug yin zhes rnam par phye ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug yin zhes rnam par phye ba lta bu ste /
translated: The six are the active consciousnesses.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos kyi dgongs pa ma rtogs par spong bar byed pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos kyi dgongs pa ma rtogs par spong bar byed pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to reject the treatise without understanding its intention.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa'i sa'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa'i sa'i bshad pa'o //
translated: This concludes the explanation of the level of the five collections of consciousness.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa rnam par bshad pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa rnam par bshad pa /
translated: The explanation of the level of the practitioner of yoga.

original: yid kyi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid kyi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is the mental faculty?

original: yid ces bya ba'i sgra 'di ni rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi rnam grangs su gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: yid ces bya ba'i sgra 'di ni rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi rnam grangs su gtogs pa ste /
translated: The term â€œmental facultyâ€ is a synonym for all consciousnesses.

original: ji skad du rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las rnam par shes pa 'di dag thams cad ni sems dang yid ces kyang bya'o zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las rnam par shes pa 'di dag thams cad ni sems dang yid ces kyang bya'o zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: As it says in the Compendium of Ascertainments, â€œAll these consciousnesses are called mind and also mental faculty.â€

original: 'dir ni gong du bshad pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga po ma rtogs pa dag gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni gong du bshad pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga po ma rtogs pa dag gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the five consciousnesses explained above should be understood as the mental faculty.

original: gang gi tshe bye brag gi rnam grangs su bya ba de'i tshe ni 'das ma thag pa dang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kho na la bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bye brag gi rnam grangs su bya ba de'i tshe ni 'das ma thag pa dang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kho na la bya'o //
translated: When it is used in a specific sense, it refers only to the immediately past mind and the afflicted mind.

original: yang na yid ces bya ba ni gnas su gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa la bya'o //
analyzed: yang na yid ces bya ba ni gnas su gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa la bya'o //
translated: Or, mind refers to the consciousness that is the basis.

original: gnas kyang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gnas kyang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The basis is of four kinds:

original: sa bon gyi gnas ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //ğŸ”½'byung ba'i go 'byed pa'i gnas ni 'das @81a * //
analyzed: sa bon gyi gnas ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o // 'byung ba'i go 'byed pa'i gnas ni 'das @81a * //
translated: The seed basis is the store consciousness.

original: ma thag pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: ma thag pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The basis that provides the opportunity for arising is the immediately past consciousness.

original: mtshan ma la 'ching ba'i gnas ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yin te /
analyzed: mtshan ma la 'ching ba'i gnas ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yin te /
translated: The basis that binds to signs is the afflicted mind.

original: 'di ltar rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las kyang /
translated: Thus, the Compendium of Ascertainments says:

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de yang yid la gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de yang yid la gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That mental consciousness is called the mind.

original: yid ma 'gags na rnam par rig pa rnams kyang mtshan ma la bcings pa las mi 'grol la //
analyzed: yid ma 'gags na rnam par rig pa rnams kyang mtshan ma la bcings pa las mi 'grol la //
translated: If the mind is not stopped, the representations are not liberated from being bound to signs.

original: 'gags na de las grol bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'gags na de las grol bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: If it is stopped, they are liberated from that.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gnas ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gnas ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin te /
translated: The basis of the afflicted and the pure is the mental consciousness,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa'i gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa'i gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis of attachment, etc. and of faith, etc.

original: de'i phyir yid ces bya ba'i sgras ni thams cad bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yid ces bya ba'i sgras ni thams cad bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the word â€œmindâ€ includes all.

original: sa bon thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi pa rnam par gzhag pa ni ji ltar na sa bon thams cad dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: sa bon thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi pa rnam par gzhag pa ni ji ltar na sa bon thams cad dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: The four lines beginning with â€œendowed with all seedsâ€ are presented as follows: How is it endowed with all seeds?

original: gnas kyi dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas kyi dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the basis.

original: ji ltar na gnas kyi dngos por gnas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gnas kyi dngos por gnas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it the basis?ğŸ”½Because it is the appropriator.

original: len par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes tshig snga ma phyi mas bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: len par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes tshig snga ma phyi mas bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The latter line explains the former.

original: yang don gzhan du na phung po lngas bsdus pa'i chos rnams kyi bag chags kyi rten yin pa'i phyir dang / des zin pa dmigs pa la sogs pa'i gnas kyi dngos po nye bar len pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang don gzhan du na phung po lngas bsdus pa'i chos rnams kyi bag chags kyi rten yin pa'i phyir dang / des zin pa dmigs pa la sogs pa'i gnas kyi dngos po nye bar len pa'i phyir te /
translated: Again, it is another object because it is the support of the habitual tendencies of all phenomena included in the five aggregates and it is the appropriator of the entity that is the basis of the object and so on that is supported by it.

original: ji skad du rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las /
analyzed: ji skad du rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las /
translated: As the Compendium of Ascertainments says:

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyis 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyi bya ba byed de gnas sbyin par byed pa dang / sa bon gyi dngos por ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyis 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyi bya ba byed de gnas sbyin par byed pa dang / sa bon gyi dngos por ro //
translated: The foundation consciousness performs the function of being a condition for the evolving consciousnesses in two ways: it acts as the support and it is the seed.

original: de la gnas sbyin par byed pa ni des zin pa'i dbang po gzugs can rnams la rnam par shes pa lnga 'byung la /
analyzed: de la gnas sbyin par byed pa ni des zin pa'i dbang po gzugs can rnams la rnam par shes pa lnga 'byung la /
translated: As for acting as the support, the five sense consciousnesses arise in relation to the physical sense faculties that are supported by it,

original: ma zin pa rnams la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ma zin pa rnams la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: but not in relation to those that are not supported.

original: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dag mdung khyim gyi tshul du gcig la gcig brten cing gnas kyi dngos por gnas pa'i phyir dang / des zin na gzugs kyang sems can du bgrang ba nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dag mdung khyim gyi tshul du gcig la gcig brten cing gnas kyi dngos por gnas pa'i phyir dang / des zin na gzugs kyang sems can du bgrang ba nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And if form is included in consciousness, then form would be counted as a sentient being.

original: yang don gzhan du na mthong ba dang gnas pa dang 'phel ba dang chud mi za ba'i bye brag gis rgyu rnam pa bzhi bstan te /
analyzed: yang don gzhan du na mthong ba dang gnas pa dang 'phel ba dang chud mi za ba'i bye brag gis rgyu rnam pa bzhi bstan te /
translated: Again, in another way, the four kinds of causes are taught as the distinctions of seeing, abiding, increase, and non-wastage.

original: de dag kyang tshig bzhi po dag gis go rims bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: de dag kyang tshig bzhi po dag gis go rims bzhin du bstan to //
translated: And these are taught by the four lines in order.

original: yang don gzhan du na kun gzhi'i don rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang don gzhan du na kun gzhi'i don rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Again, in another way, the four meanings of the store consciousness are as follows:

original: 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams de la 'bras bu'i dngos por sbyor bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams de la 'bras bu'i dngos por sbyor bar byed pa'am /
translated: It is the cause of the conditioned forces that are associated with the elements, because it is the cause of the arising of the conditioned forces.

original: de dag la de rgyu'i dngos por @81b sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir kun gzhi zhes bya ba dang / sems can rnams de la bdag tu sbyor ba'i phyir kun gzhi zhes bya ba dang / de dang po kho nar mer mer por zhugs pa na grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i phyir kun gzhi zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: de dag la de rgyu'i dngos por @81b sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir kun gzhi zhes bya ba dang / sems can rnams de la bdag tu sbyor ba'i phyir kun gzhi zhes bya ba dang / de dang po kho nar mer mer por zhugs pa na grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i phyir kun gzhi zhes bya ba dang /
translated: It is called the â€œstorehouseâ€ because it is the cause of those, because it is the cause of the body, and because it is the cause of the body and the sense faculties.ğŸ”½It is called the â€œstorehouseâ€ because it is the cause of those, because it is the cause of the body, because it is the cause of the body and the sense faculties, because it is the cause of the body and the sense faculties and the world, and because it is the cause of the body and the sense faculties and the world and the experience of pleasure and pain.

original: des lus zin pa'i phyir kun gzhi zhes bya ste /
analyzed: des lus zin pa'i phyir kun gzhi zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called the â€œstorehouseâ€ because it is the cause of those, because it is the cause of the body, because it is the cause of the body and the sense faculties, because it is the cause of the body and the sense faculties and the world, and because it is the cause of the body and the sense faculties and the world and the experience of pleasure and pain.

original: len par byed pa'i don ni kun gzhi zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: len par byed pa'i don ni kun gzhi zhes bya'o ;
translated: The meaning of â€œappropriationâ€ is the storehouse consciousness.

original: / don bzhi po de dag ni tshig bzhi po rnams dang go rims bzhin du sbyor ro //
analyzed: / don bzhi po de dag ni tshig bzhi po rnams dang go rims bzhin du sbyor ro //
translated: These four meanings correspond to the four terms in order.

original: de ltar na tshig bzhi po de dag gis kun gzhi'i don gsal ba kho nar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na tshig bzhi po de dag gis kun gzhi'i don gsal ba kho nar bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, these four terms clearly teach the meaning of the storehouse consciousness.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis ni de'i ngo bo nyid ston to //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis ni de'i ngo bo nyid ston to //
translated: The remaining terms indicate its nature.

original: rnam par smin par bsdus pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par smin par bsdus pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The storehouse consciousness is the consciousness that is the result of evolution.

original: ci kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid ji skad smras pa'i tshig tsam gyis grub par zad dam /
analyzed: ci kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid ji skad smras pa'i tshig tsam gyis grub par zad dam /
translated: Does the definition of foundation consciousness merely exist as words spoken by the master?

original: 'on te khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir thabs 'ga' zhig kyang yod ce na /ğŸ”½te por yod de /
analyzed: 'on te khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir thabs 'ga' zhig kyang yod ce na / te por yod de /
translated: Or is there some method for understanding it?ğŸ”½The first is correct.

original: re zhig lung ni theg pa gnyis te /
analyzed: re zhig lung ni theg pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two scriptures:

original: de la theg pa chen po ni 'dul ba sgrogs pa zhes bya ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: de la theg pa chen po ni 'dul ba sgrogs pa zhes bya ba'i mdo las /
translated: The first is the Mahayana, for the Sutra of the Proclamation of the Vinaya says:

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'dul ba zab mo la mos pa zhes bya bas bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i rtsa ba rnam par gzhag pa gang lags zhes zhus pa dang / rigs kyi bu len pa'i rnam par shes pa la thog ma med pa'i dus sngon gyi mtha' mngon pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags sa bon du yongs su 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'dul ba zab mo la mos pa zhes bya bas bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i rtsa ba rnam par gzhag pa gang lags zhes zhus pa dang / rigs kyi bu len pa'i rnam par shes pa la thog ma med pa'i dus sngon gyi mtha' mngon pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags sa bon du yongs su 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The bodhisattva who is devoted to the profound vinaya asked, â€œBhagavan, what is the foundation of ignorance?â€ The Bhagavan replied, â€œSon of the lineage, the appropriating consciousness holds the seeds of beginningless time, the imprints of ignorance, in the manner of complete possession.â€

original: yang de nyid las rigs kyi bu rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi sa bon gyi gnas yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang de nyid las rigs kyi bu rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi sa bon gyi gnas yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Son of noble family, the consciousness that is the ripening of karma is the basis of the seeds of karmic formations.

original: chos mngon pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And the Abhidharma SÅ«tra says,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni shes bya'i gnas kyi bye brag khyad par du 'phags pa gsungs pa'o zhes bya bas shes bya'i gnas nyid yin par rgya cher rnam par phye ste bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni shes bya'i gnas kyi bye brag khyad par du 'phags pa gsungs pa'o zhes bya bas shes bya'i gnas nyid yin par rgya cher rnam par phye ste bstan to //
translated: â€œThe Bhagavat Buddha taught that the specific bases of objects of knowledge are superior.â€

original: 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtshos zhus pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtshos zhus pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And the SÅ«tra of the Questions of NÄga Lord of the Mind says,

original: rnam par shes pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: â€œConsciousness is the seed of the contaminated.â€

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa rin po che bkod pa las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa rin po che bkod pa las kyang /
translated: And the SÅ«tra of the Jewel Mound also says,

original: blo gros yangs pa rnam par shes pa des de ltar lus 'di nye bar bzung zhing blangs pa na len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa rnam par shes pa des de ltar lus 'di nye bar bzung zhing blangs pa na len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: â€œViÅ›Älamati, when that consciousness appropriates and takes up this body, it is called the appropriating consciousness.â€

original: de ltar de ni lus 'di la grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i phyir 'brel pa dang rab tu 'brel pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de ni lus 'di la grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i phyir 'brel pa dang rab tu 'brel pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is called the foundation consciousness because it is related to and intimately connected with this body, since it is the basis for the creation and happiness of this body.

original: blo gros yangs pa len pa'i rnam par shes pa de la brten cing gnas nas rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag 'byung @82a * //ğŸ”½bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa len pa'i rnam par shes pa de la brten cing gnas nas rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag 'byung @82a * // bar 'gyur te /
translated: O Vairocana, the six collections of consciousness arise in dependence on and based on that appropriating consciousness.

original: de la rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It says that based on the eye and forms, eye consciousness arises, and so on.

original: shin tu rgyas pa'i sde yangs pa'i tshul zhes bya ba'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa'i sde yangs pa'i tshul zhes bya ba'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Vaipulya SÅ«tra called the Method of Exposition also says:

translated: Monks, the six collections of consciousness arise together with and are concomitant with meritorious, nonmeritorious, and invariable compositional activity and they are not terminated. analyzed: rnam par ltung ba dka' ma yin //ğŸ”½zhes kyang brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are not difficult to make fall.

original: de lta bas na gang dag kha cig gsung rab mtha' dag las 'byung ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rtog ge skom po tsam gyis gnod pa byed pa de dag ni shin tu gzu lums byed pa yin pas rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba
analyzed: de lta bas na gang dag kha cig gsung rab mtha' dag las 'byung ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rtog ge skom po tsam gyis gnod pa byed pa de dag ni shin tu gzu lums byed pa yin pas rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba

analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
