original: de la bdag tu lta ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dmigs shing lhan cig 'byung la rtag tu kun du 'byung ba ste gzhan dag kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: de la bdag tu lta ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dmigs shing lhan cig 'byung la rtag tu kun du 'byung ba ste gzhan dag kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The view of the self focuses on the foundation consciousness and it always occurs simultaneously with it, and so too with the others.

original: ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa can gyi yid nyon mongs pa bzhi po kho na dag dang rtag tu mtshungs pa ltar gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa can gyi yid nyon mongs pa bzhi po kho na dag dang rtag tu mtshungs pa ltar gzhag ce na /
translated: Why is the afflicted intellect posited as always concomitant with just four afflictions?

original: dge ba la sogs pa kun tu spyod pa na lus la lhan cig skyes pa'i ngar 'dzin pa phra mo dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya bar blta'o //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa kun tu spyod pa na lus la lhan cig skyes pa'i ngar 'dzin pa phra mo dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya bar blta'o //
translated: When one engages in virtuous and other actions, the self and mine are seen to be connected with the subtle innate grasping of â€œIâ€ and â€œmineâ€ that arises simultaneously with the body.

original: de med par mi 'byung ba'i phyir bdag la sred pa dang / nga rgyal 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med par mi 'byung ba'i phyir bdag la sred pa dang / nga rgyal 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because craving for the self and pride do not occur without that innate view of the self, they are said to be views of the self.

original: rmongs pa med na gzhan dag 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ma rig pa zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: rmongs pa med na gzhan dag 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ma rig pa zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: Because craving and pride do not occur without ignorance, ignorance is said to exist.

original: de'i phyir nyung ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyung ba yang ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, there are not too few mental factors.

original: zhe sdang la sogs pa ni de las bzlog pa'i phyir mang du yang med de /
analyzed: zhe sdang la sogs pa ni de las bzlog pa'i phyir mang du yang med de /
translated: Because anger and so on are the opposite of that, they are not too many.

original: rgya cher ni 'og nas rnam par gtan la dbab par bsdu bar bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher ni 'og nas rnam par gtan la dbab par bsdu bar bshad par bya'o //
translated: They will be explained extensively in the Compendium of Ascertainments below.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi mtshan nyid ji skad smras pa de yang lung dang rigs pas khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi mtshan nyid ji skad smras pa de yang lung dang rigs pas khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: The characteristics of afflicted intellect should be understood through scripture and reasoning.

original: de la lung ni theg pa chen po dang nyan thos kyi theg pa'o //
analyzed: de la lung ni theg pa chen po dang nyan thos kyi theg pa'o //
translated: In this regard, the MahÄyÄna and the ÅšrÄvaka Vehicle are the scriptures.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa la dkar gshegs pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa la dkar gshegs pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Also, the noble SÅ«tra on Entering Lanka says,

original: sems dang yid dang rnam shes ni //
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam shes ni //
translated: Mind, mentation, and consciousness

original: mtshan nyid don du rab tu brtags //
analyzed: mtshan nyid don du rab tu brtags //
translated: are thoroughly imagined to be the meaning of characteristics.

original: brgyad po mtshan nyid tha dad min //ğŸ”½mtshan gzhi med cing @84a * //
analyzed: brgyad po mtshan nyid tha dad min // mtshan gzhi med cing @84a * //

original: mtshan nyid med //ğŸ”½ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med // ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: and there are no characteristics.

original: yang de nyid las /
analyzed: yang de nyid las /
translated: Also, that same text says,

original: de bzhin rnam shes bdun po ni //
analyzed: de bzhin rnam shes bdun po ni //
translated: In the same way, the seven consciousnesses

original: sems dang lhan cig ldan pa'o //ğŸ”½zhes kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: sems dang lhan cig ldan pa'o // zhes kyang gsungs so //
translated: are associated with mind.

original: de bzhin du sngar kun gzhi rnam par shes par rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i skabs su 'phags pa stug po bkod pa'i mdo las byung ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis smos pa yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngar kun gzhi rnam par shes par rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i skabs su 'phags pa stug po bkod pa'i mdo las byung ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis smos pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Also, as was done above in the chapter on the foundation consciousness, the two verses from the noble Dense Array Scripture should be quoted.

original: ji skad du mdo sde sil bu dag las kyang /ğŸ”½nyon mongs can yid rtag tu yang //
analyzed: ji skad du mdo sde sil bu dag las kyang / nyon mongs can yid rtag tu yang //
translated: Also, in the various sÅ«tras it says,ğŸ”½The afflicted mind always

original: nyon mongs lhan cig 'byung ba yang /
analyzed: nyon mongs lhan cig 'byung ba yang /
translated: arises simultaneously with the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs lhan cig 'byung zhing 'gag / de ni nyon mongs pa dag las //ğŸ”½grol bar ma gyur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs lhan cig 'byung zhing 'gag / de ni nyon mongs pa dag las // grol bar ma gyur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It arises and ceases simultaneously with the defilements.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is not liberated, nor will it be liberated from the defilements.

original: rigs pa yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni sa bon gyi gnas las gzhan pa'i gnas lhan cig 'byung ba dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: rigs pa yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni sa bon gyi gnas las gzhan pa'i gnas lhan cig 'byung ba dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: The reason is that mental consciousness is associated with a simultaneous support other than the support of the seeds.

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i bye brag sna tshogs yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i bye brag sna tshogs yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has various distinctions of virtue, etc.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin te /
translated: It is like visual consciousness.

original: chos mi mthun pa ni nam mkha' la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa ni nam mkha' la sogs pa'o //
translated: The dissimilar example is space, etc.

original: yang gcig du de ma thag pa'i yid las byung ba'i phyir te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yang gcig du de ma thag pa'i yid las byung ba'i phyir te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: It arises from the immediately antecedent mind, just as before.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
translated: It apprehends objects such as form, etc.,

original: snga ma kho na bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma kho na bzhin no //
translated: just as before.

original: yang na chos kyi khams yongs su gcod pa'i phyir de la brten pa'i shes rab bzhin te phyogs ni de lta'o //
analyzed: yang na chos kyi khams yongs su gcod pa'i phyir de la brten pa'i shes rab bzhin te phyogs ni de lta'o //
translated: Or, it is like the wisdom that is based on it, because it determines the element of mental objects.

original: gzhi gzugs can yin par gyur pas gtan tshigs 'gal lo zhes bya ba yang med de /
analyzed: gzhi gzugs can yin par gyur pas gtan tshigs 'gal lo zhes bya ba yang med de /
translated: Also, it is not the case that the reason is contradictory, because it is a physical basis,ğŸ”½because it is damaged by the assertion of the Vaibhasikas that the mental faculty is a homogeneous and concomitant basis,

original: thams cad yod par smra ba rnams dang / 'phags pa gnas brtan pa dag gis kyang gnod pa byas pa'i phyir ba dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni gnas lhan cig 'byung ba dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba rnams dang / 'phags pa gnas brtan pa dag gis kyang gnod pa byas pa'i phyir ba dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni gnas lhan cig 'byung ba dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: because mental consciousness is a basis that is concomitant with the mental faculty,

original: rnam par rtog pa yod pa'i phyir ba'am /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yod pa'i phyir ba'am /
translated: because it is a conceptual consciousness or

original: chos kyi khams spyod yul du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos kyi khams spyod yul du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it has the element of mental objects as its domain,

original: de la gnas pa'i sems las byung ba bzhin pas de la sogs pa rjes su dpag pa dag gis kyang gnod pa byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i sems las byung ba bzhin pas de la sogs pa rjes su dpag pa dag gis kyang gnod pa byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is damaged by the inference that it is like the mental factors that abide in it, and so on.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyis ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyis ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Also, it is not indeterminate by the arya path,

original: kha cig na re yid gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re yid gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: because the mental faculty is transformed.

original: yang kha cig na re zag pa dang bcas shing 'jig rten pa'i yan lag bye brag tu byas pa'i phyir ro zhes zer bas de'i phyir yid grub pa yin no //
analyzed: yang kha cig na re zag pa dang bcas shing 'jig rten pa'i yan lag bye brag tu byas pa'i phyir ro zhes zer bas de'i phyir yid grub pa yin no //
translated: The mind is established for that reason.ğŸ”½The mind is that which is present as the awareness of an object.

original: dmigs pa rnam par rig par byed pas nye bar gnas pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa rnam par rig par byed pa 'byung ba la bya ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa rnam par rig par byed pas nye bar gnas pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa rnam par rig par byed pa 'byung ba la bya ste /
translated: This is the arising of the awareness of an object.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyang yin mod kyi 'on kyang @84b rnam par shes pa bdun po dag gi bye brag las logs shig tu bkar bas na yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyang yin mod kyi 'on kyang @84b rnam par shes pa bdun po dag gi bye brag las logs shig tu bkar bas na yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Although this is the characteristic of all consciousnesses, still, because it is distinguished from the seven consciousnesses, it should be understood as the mental consciousness alone.

original: bstan du med cing thogs pa med pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bstan du med cing thogs pa med pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba la /
translated: The form that is not demonstrable and is unimpeded.

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is of two kinds:

original: rdzas su yod pa dang / btags pa'i yod pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa dang / btags pa'i yod pa'o //
translated: substantial and nominal.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par grub pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdzas su yod pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par grub pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rdzas su yod pa'o //
translated: That which is the result of the accomplishment of a special meditative concentration is substantial.

original: ting nge 'dzin de yang 'jig rten pa zag pa dang bcas pa yin gyi 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de yang 'jig rten pa zag pa dang bcas pa yin gyi 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: This concentration is mundane, contaminated, not supramundane, uncontaminated.

original: de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is non-conceptual.

original: gzugs de ni rnam par rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam par bsgrubs pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs de ni rnam par rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam par bsgrubs pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: This form is established by the concentration of conceptualization.

original: de ni snang ba tsam du zad kyi de la dri la sogs pa yang med la sa la sogs pa yang med de /
analyzed: de ni snang ba tsam du zad kyi de la dri la sogs pa yang med la sa la sogs pa yang med de /
translated: It is merely an appearance, for it has no smell, etc., nor does it have earth, etc.

original: 'byung ba'i byed rgyu med pa'i phyir ba dang // dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i byed rgyu med pa'i phyir ba dang // dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no cause for the elements, and because there is no need for them.

original: 'o na 'og nas ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs de ni ting nge 'dzin gang dang ldan pa kho na'i 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas pa yin no zhes 'byung ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'og nas ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs de ni ting nge 'dzin gang dang ldan pa kho na'i 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas pa yin no zhes 'byung ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But below, it is said that form as the domain of concentration is the materiality derived from the great elements of one who possesses concentration.

original: der ni brten pa'i 'bras bu rten gyis brjod par zad de /
analyzed: der ni brten pa'i 'bras bu rten gyis brjod par zad de /
translated: There, the result that is supported is expressed by the support.

original: bdag gi don de rnam pa 'di dag gis thos zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: bdag gi don de rnam pa 'di dag gis thos zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The meaning of â€œmineâ€ is like â€œI heard this in this way.â€

original: sa gang dang ldan pa'i 'byung ba chen po la brten pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa'i ting nge 'dzin de ni 'byung ba de dag gi 'bras bu yin par bstan te /
analyzed: sa gang dang ldan pa'i 'byung ba chen po la brten pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa'i ting nge 'dzin de ni 'byung ba de dag gi 'bras bu yin par bstan te /
translated: The meditative stabilization that is based on the great elements that are possessed on a certain level is taught to be the result of those elements.

original: de yang snyoms par 'jug pa la brten pa kho na yin gyi 'byung ba chen po la brten pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang snyoms par 'jug pa la brten pa kho na yin gyi 'byung ba chen po la brten pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is only based on meditative attainment and not based on the great elements.

original: ji skad du rnam par gtan pa dbab pa bsdu ba las kyang /
analyzed: ji skad du rnam par gtan pa dbab pa bsdu ba las kyang /
translated: Ascertainment of the aphorisms of the Abhidharma states:

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'bras bu'i gzugs gang chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa de ni snyoms par 'jug pa la brten pa kho na yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'bras bu'i gzugs gang chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa de ni snyoms par 'jug pa la brten pa kho na yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The form that is the result of meditative attainment and belongs to the phenomena element should be known as only based on meditative attainment.

original: 'byung ba chen po la brten pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po la brten pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not based on the great elements.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pas ting nge 'dzin 'grub pa'i phyir 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas pa zhes brjod par zad kyi /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pas ting nge 'dzin 'grub pa'i phyir 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas pa zhes brjod par zad kyi /
translated: Since meditative stabilization is achieved by means of observing a reflection that is similar to it, it is said to be derived from the great elements.

original: de la brten te 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ngo / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de ni btags pa'i yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de la brten te 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ngo / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de ni btags pa'i yod pa yin te /
translated: Nonindicative form that exists as a nominal reality is

original: de ni spong ba'i sems pa la gdags pa yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de ni spong ba'i sems pa la gdags pa yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: designated in dependence on the volition that abandons it.

original: / gzugs su brjod pa ni sems pa de'i bye brag gi dbang gis 'byung ba'i rlung gi khams kyis lus dang ngag bskyod pa la brjod pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½ldan pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir 'du byed kyi phung por ma gtogs pas sa bon rnams logs shig tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: / gzugs su brjod pa ni sems pa de'i bye brag gi dbang gis 'byung ba'i rlung gi khams kyis lus dang ngag bskyod pa la brjod pa'i phyir ro // ldan pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir 'du byed kyi phung por ma gtogs pas sa bon rnams logs shig tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: The term form is used to refer to the wind element that arises due to the power of the specific volition that moves the body and voice.ğŸ”½Since it is not associated with the mind, it is not included in the aggregate of formation.

original: sa bon thams cad ces bya ba smos @85a * //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad ces bya ba smos @85a * //
translated: To indicate that seeds are distinct from that, the root text states, â€œall seeds.â€

original: so ; / snga na med pa la sogs pa dang / bum pa la sogs pa dag kyang ci'i phyir ma smos she na /
analyzed: so ; / snga na med pa la sogs pa dang / bum pa la sogs pa dag kyang ci'i phyir ma smos she na /
translated: Why are nonexistents such as a rabbitâ€™s horns and nonexistent things such as a vase not mentioned?

original: de dag ni sems dang sems las byung ba dag las tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag ni sems dang sems las byung ba dag las tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are not mentioned because they are not distinct from the mind and mental factors.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dag gi gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan ma tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dag gi gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan ma tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are mere representations of the form of mind and mental factors.

original: yang na de dag ni rnam par rig byed bzhin du yul rnams las don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir brjod pa kho na yin no //ğŸ”½yid la byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
analyzed: yang na de dag ni rnam par rig byed bzhin du yul rnams las don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir brjod pa kho na yin no // yid la byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
translated: Or else, like the form of informative action, they are only speech because they are not objects that are distinct from the sense objects.

original: yid la byed pa la sogs pa lnga po dag ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa'i sa'i skabs su 'chad par byas zin to //
analyzed: yid la byed pa la sogs pa lnga po dag ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa'i sa'i skabs su 'chad par byas zin to //
translated: The five beginning with attention have already been explained in the section on the five collections of consciousness associated with the stage of the realm of desire.

original: lhag ma rnams kyi mngon sum dang rtags kyang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyi mngon sum dang rtags kyang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The remaining ones are like the former ones in terms of direct perception and inference.

original: lung ni brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: lung ni brjod par bya ste /
translated: Scripture will be discussed.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyi chos thams cad ni 'dun pa'i rtsa ba las byung ba'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyi chos thams cad ni 'dun pa'i rtsa ba las byung ba'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said, â€œThe Blessed One said, â€˜All dharmas arise from the root of aspiration.â€™â€

original: de bzhin du bdag gi sems ni ci nas kyang nang gi skye mched drug po 'di dag la bdag med par mos so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gi sems ni ci nas kyang nang gi skye mched drug po 'di dag la bdag med par mos so //
translated: In the same way, â€œI aspire that my mind will be free from the notion of self in regard to these six internal sense bases.â€

original: de bzhin du dran pa dang / rjes su dran pa dang / rab tu dran pa dang / nye bar dran pa dang / dran pa nyid dang / mi brjed pa med pa'i chos nyid dang / sems pa'i mngon par brjod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa dang / rjes su dran pa dang / rab tu dran pa dang / nye bar dran pa dang / dran pa nyid dang / mi brjed pa med pa'i chos nyid dang / sems pa'i mngon par brjod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Likewise, it is called mindfulness, recollection, full recollection, close mindfulness, mindfulness itself, the nature of non-forgetfulness, and mental expression.

original: de bzhin du sems gnas pa dang / yang dag par gnas pa dang / rab tu gnas pa dang / nye bar gnas pa dang / shin tu gnas pa dang / mi g-yeng ba dang / mi 'phyar ba dang ; bsdus pa dang / zhi gnas dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems gnas pa dang / yang dag par gnas pa dang / rab tu gnas pa dang / nye bar gnas pa dang / shin tu gnas pa dang / mi g-yeng ba dang / mi 'phyar ba dang ; bsdus pa dang / zhi gnas dang /
translated: Likewise, it is called the stability of mind, right stability, full stability, close stability, complete stability, non-distraction, non-agitation, collectedness, serenity,

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid gang yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid gang yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: concentration, and one-pointedness of mind.

original: de bzhin du brtson 'grus @85b brtsams pa la gnas pa ni mthu dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du yid dga' bas lus shin tu sbyangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du brtson 'grus @85b brtsams pa la gnas pa ni mthu dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du yid dga' bas lus shin tu sbyangs pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, one who is joyful in mind is physically fit.

original: de bzhin du dge ba'i chos gang dag ji snyed 'byung ba de dag thams cad ni bag yod pa'i rtsa ba las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba'i chos gang dag ji snyed 'byung ba de dag thams cad ni bag yod pa'i rtsa ba las byung ba yin no //
translated: Likewise, all the wholesome states that arise are rooted in heedfulness.

original: de bzhin du brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba bsal ba'i phyir sems btang snyoms su byed do / btang snyoms la gnas pa ni dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba bsal ba'i phyir sems btang snyoms su byed do / btang snyoms la gnas pa ni dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin no //
translated: Likewise, one who is equanimous in mind, free from covetousness and dissatisfaction, is mindful and alert.

original: de bzhin du mkhas pa nye bar shes pa ni rnam par 'tshe ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mkhas pa nye bar shes pa ni rnam par 'tshe ba yin no //
translated: Likewise, one who is skilled in the knowledge of the near and far is free from violence.ğŸ”½Likewise, one who is attached does not know the teachings.

original: de bzhin du chags pas chos rnams mi shes so zhes tshigs su bcad pa dang / de bzhin du zhe sdang can ni zhe sdang gis zil gyis gnon pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du chags pas chos rnams mi shes so zhes tshigs su bcad pa dang / de bzhin du zhe sdang can ni zhe sdang gis zil gyis gnon pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, one who is angry is overcome by anger.

original: rmongs pa ni gti mug gis zil gyis gnon pa yin no //
analyzed: rmongs pa ni gti mug gis zil gyis gnon pa yin no //
translated: One who is confused is overcome by delusion.

original: de bzhin du gsum po 'di dag ni nga rgyal gyi rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gsum po 'di dag ni nga rgyal gyi rnam pa yin te /
translated: Likewise, these three are types of pride:

original: bdag che'o snyam pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag che'o snyam pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: the thought â€œI am great,â€ and so on.

original: de bzhin des kun tu spyod pa gsum spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin des kun tu spyod pa gsum spangs pa yin te /
translated: Likewise, he has abandoned the three types of conduct:

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom mo //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom mo //
translated: the view of the transitory collection, holding a discipline and ritual to be paramount, and doubt.

original: de bzhin du k'a t+ya'i bu 'jig rten 'di ni gnas te /
analyzed: de bzhin du k'a t+ya'i bu 'jig rten 'di ni gnas te /
translated: Likewise, KÄtyÄyanÄ«putra says, â€œThis world is based on two things:

original: 'di lta ste yod pa nyid dang / med pa nyid la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba 'di mthar 'dzin par lta ba yin par bstan pa dang / yang de ni chad par smra ba yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / tshangs pa'i dra ba las kyang rtog par smra ba yin no //

translated: existence and nonexistence.â€ This is a teaching on the view grasping an extreme, and he also says, â€œHe is a nihilist,â€ and in the BrahmÄâ€™s Net Sutra, â€œHe is a specious reasoner.â€

original: de bzhin du phyin ci log tu mthong ba ste log par lta ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyin ci log tu mthong ba ste log par lta ba yin no //
translated: Likewise, he sees things in a distorted way, that is, he has wrong view.

original: de bzhin du 'chal bar 'dzi pa ni rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin cing gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / sgyu dang / g-yo'i bar du 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½de bzhin du byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa ni ci nad med pa'i rgyags pas myos pa dang / lang tsho'i rgyags pas myos pa dang / gson pa'i rgyags pas myos pa yin no yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'chal bar 'dzi pa ni rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin cing gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / sgyu dang / g-yo'i bar du 'gyur ro // de bzhin du byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa ni ci nad med pa'i rgyags pas myos pa dang / lang tsho'i rgyags pas myos pa dang / gson pa'i rgyags pas myos pa yin no yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang /
translated: Likewise, â€œfraudâ€ is the state of being attached to the view of self.ğŸ”½Likewise, â€œdeceitâ€ is the state of being attached to the view of self.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la tho 'tshams pa'i rang bzhin can de ni rnam par 'tshe ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la tho 'tshams pa'i rang bzhin can de ni rnam par 'tshe ba yin no //
translated: Likewise, â€œconcealmentâ€ is the state of being attached to the view of self.ğŸ”½Likewise, â€œobstinacyâ€ is the state of being attached to the view of self.ğŸ”½Likewise, â€œshamelessnessâ€ is the state of being attached to the view of self.ğŸ”½Likewise, â€œlack of sense of proprietyâ€ is the state of being attached to the view of self.ğŸ”½Likewise, â€œlack of faithâ€ is the state of being attached to the view of self.ğŸ”½Likewise, â€œlack of sense of shameâ€ is the state of being attached to the view of self.

analyzed: de bzhin du ngo tsha bar bya bas ngo tsha med pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams skyes pas ngo tsha bar mi byed do //
translated: Likewise, â€œlack of sense of decorumâ€ is the state of being attached to the view of self.ğŸ”½Likewise, â€œlack of restraintâ€ is the state of being attached to the view of self.ğŸ”½Likewise, â€œlack of conscientiousnessâ€ is the state of being attached to the view of self.ğŸ”½Likewise, â€œlack of modestyâ€ is the state of being attached to the view of self.ğŸ”½Likewise, â€œlack of respectâ€ is the state of being attached to the view of self.ğŸ”½Likewise, â€œlack of deferenceâ€ is the state of being attached to the view of self.ğŸ”½Likewise, â€œlack of self-controlâ€ is the state of being attached to the view of self.ğŸ”½Likewise, â€œlack of self-restraintâ€ is the state of being attached to the view of self.ğŸ”½Likewise, â€œlack of self-disciplineâ€ is the state of being attached to the view of self.ğŸ”½Likewise, â€œlack of self-controlâ€ is the state of being attached to the view of self.ğŸ”½Likewise, â€œlack of self-restraintâ€ is the state of being attached to the view of self.ğŸ”½Likewise, â€œlack of self-disciplineâ€ is the state of being attached to the view of self.ğŸ”½Likewise, â€œlack of self-controlâ€ is the state of being attached

original: khrel bar bya ba khrel med pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams skyes pas khrel bar mi byed do //
analyzed: khrel bar bya ba khrel med pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams skyes pas khrel bar mi byed do //
translated: He is shameless about what should cause shame, and he is not ashamed of what he should be ashamed of.

original: de bzhin du de'i lus kyi rmugs pa yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i lus kyi rmugs pa yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, his body becomes heavy and sluggish.

original: yang rmugs pa dang gnyis che ba ni lus lci bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang rmugs pa dang gnyis che ba ni lus lci bar 'gyur ro //
translated: His body becomes heavy and sluggish.

original: de bzhin pa ni rgod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin pa ni rgod pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, he is agitated.

original: @86a * // de bzhin du 'di la kha cig ji srid du ma dad pas sems la khyad par byas te mi gnas pa de srid du des dge ba'i chos rnams spong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @86a * // de bzhin du 'di la kha cig ji srid du ma dad pas sems la khyad par byas te mi gnas pa de srid du des dge ba'i chos rnams spong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, as long as he does not remain with a mind that is not full of faith, he does not abandon the wholesome dharmas.

original: de bzhin du brtson 'grus zhan pa ni le lo can yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du brtson 'grus zhan pa ni le lo can yin no //
translated: Likewise, he is lazy if he is weak in vigor.

original: de bzhin du /ğŸ”½bag yod bdud rtsi'i gnas yin te //
analyzed: de bzhin du / bag yod bdud rtsi'i gnas yin te //
translated: Likewise,ğŸ”½he is heedless if he is not established in mindfulness.ğŸ”½Heedlessness is the abode of death.

original: bag med 'chi ba'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: bag med 'chi ba'i gnas yin no //
translated: Heedfulness is the abode of immortality.

original: zhes tshigs su bcad pa dang / de bzhin du shes bzhin ma yin par gnas pa ni brjed ngas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes tshigs su bcad pa dang / de bzhin du shes bzhin ma yin par gnas pa ni brjed ngas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, he is forgetful if he is not established in vigilance.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la rjes su mthun par zhugs pa ni sems rnam par g-yeng ba yin no zhes bya bas rnam par g-yeng ba bstan pa dang / 'gyod pas 'chi ba'i dus byed pa de ni lus zhig nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la rjes su mthun par zhugs pa ni sems rnam par g-yeng ba yin no zhes bya bas rnam par g-yeng ba bstan pa dang / 'gyod pas 'chi ba'i dus byed pa de ni lus zhig nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang /
translated: â€œOne who dies with regretâ€ and so on.ğŸ”½â€œOne who eats a lot becomes sleepyâ€ is stated in a verse.

original: de bzhin du mang du za ba de ni gnyid dang ldan par 'gyur zhes tshigs su bcad pa dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang ldan pa ni tshig smra par byed kyi rtog pa dang dpyod pa med pa ni ma yin no zhes kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du mang du za ba de ni gnyid dang ldan par 'gyur zhes tshigs su bcad pa dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang ldan pa ni tshig smra par byed kyi rtog pa dang dpyod pa med pa ni ma yin no zhes kyang gsungs so //
translated: â€œOne who possesses investigation and analysis speaks words, but one who lacks investigation and analysis does not.â€

original: yid la byed pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni chos mngon pa kun las btus pa la sogs pa dang 'dra bas ma smras so //
analyzed: yid la byed pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni chos mngon pa kun las btus pa la sogs pa dang 'dra bas ma smras so //
translated: The characteristics of attention and so on are similar to those in the Compendium of Abhidharma and so on, so I will not comment on them.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba rnams kyi yang 'og nas rtog pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i sa dag la nyon mongs pa rab tu 'byed pa'i skabs nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba rnams kyi yang 'og nas rtog pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i sa dag la nyon mongs pa rab tu 'byed pa'i skabs nas 'byung ngo //
translated: The roots of the defilements will be explained later in the chapter on the defilements in the section on the stages of thought and so on.

original: lhag ma rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par brjod par bya ste /
translated: The characteristics of the remaining ones should be stated.

original: de la khro ba ni gzu lums su smra ba ste /
analyzed: de la khro ba ni gzu lums su smra ba ste /
translated: Anger is the sudden expression of rage.

original: khong khro bas kun nas dkris pa'o //
analyzed: khong khro bas kun nas dkris pa'o //
translated: It is the envelopment of hatred.

original: 'khon du 'dzin pa ni de nyid las nang gi bsam pas dgra'i dngos por 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'khon du 'dzin pa ni de nyid las nang gi bsam pas dgra'i dngos por 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Bearing a grudge is the same as anger, but it is the holding on to the state of an enemy through an inner attitude.

original: 'chab pa ni sdig pa mkhyud pa'o //ğŸ”½'tshig pa ni nyon mongs pa can te yongs su gdung ba'o //
analyzed: 'chab pa ni sdig pa mkhyud pa'o // 'tshig pa ni nyon mongs pa can te yongs su gdung ba'o //
translated: Concealment is the hiding of one's faults.ğŸ”½Spite is the persistence of hatred due to an afflicted attitude.

original: phrag dog ni pha rol 'byor ba la mngon par dga' ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs te mi bzod pa'o //
analyzed: phrag dog ni pha rol 'byor ba la mngon par dga' ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs te mi bzod pa'o //
translated: Jealousy is the inability to bear another's success and is an affliction that is the opposite of satisfaction.

original: ser sna ni yo byad rnams la kun tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ser sna ni yo byad rnams la kun tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Avarice is the tight grasping of possessions.

original: sgyu ni slu ba'i bsam pas gzhan du gnas la gzhan du ston pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ni slu ba'i bsam pas gzhan du gnas la gzhan du ston pa'o //
translated: Deceit is the display of something else through a deceptive attitude.

original: g-yo ni sems drang po ma yin pas mi gsal zhing gsal ba ma yin par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo ni sems drang po ma yin pas mi gsal zhing gsal ba ma yin par sgrub pa'o //
translated: Deceit is the mental factor that, in order to deceive others, makes one's mind unclear and unclearly revealing.

original: rgyags pa ni phun sum tshogs pa gang yang rung bas khengs pas nyon mongs pa can gyi sems gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyags pa ni phun sum tshogs pa gang yang rung bas khengs pas nyon mongs pa can gyi sems gang yin pa'o //
translated: Arrogance is a defiled mind that is inflated by any kind of excellence.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba ni sems can bred ngas pa la tho 'tshams par rtsom pa ste snying rje med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba ni sems can bred ngas pa la tho 'tshams par rtsom pa ste snying rje med pa'o //
translated: Harmfulness is the mental factor that is the basis for the intention to harm sentient beings who are afraid.

original: ngo tsha med pa ni bdag la mi ltos pa'i phyir kha na ma tho bas mi 'dzem pa'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa ni bdag la mi ltos pa'i phyir kha na ma tho bas mi 'dzem pa'o //
translated: Shamelessness is the lack of self-respect that does not avoid wrongdoing.

original: khrel med pa ni gzhan la mi ltos pas so //
analyzed: khrel med pa ni gzhan la mi ltos pas so //
translated: Lack of embarrassment is the lack of respect for others.

original: rmugs pa ni lus dang sems blong pa'o //
analyzed: rmugs pa ni lus dang sems blong pa'o //
translated: Dullness is the heaviness of body and mind.

original: rgod pa ni nye ngu'i rnam @86b par rtog pa la sogs pa la brten nas nye bar ma zhi zhing 'phyang ba'o //
analyzed: rgod pa ni nye ngu'i rnam @86b par rtog pa la sogs pa la brten nas nye bar ma zhi zhing 'phyang ba'o //
translated: Excitement is the lack of tranquility that is based on the conceptualization of what is near.

original: ma dad pa ni dad pa dang mi mthun pa ste /
analyzed: ma dad pa ni dad pa dang mi mthun pa ste /
translated: Lack of faith is the opposite of faith.

original: dge ba la sems mngon par yid mi ches pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba la sems mngon par yid mi ches pa'o //
translated: It is the lack of mental confidence in virtue.

original: le lo ni 'dod pa'i bsod nyams la phan yon du lta zhing dge ba la sems mngon bar mi spro ba'o //
analyzed: le lo ni 'dod pa'i bsod nyams la phan yon du lta zhing dge ba la sems mngon bar mi spro ba'o //
translated: Laziness is the lack of mental exertion toward virtue, seeing the enjoyment of desire as beneficial.

original: bag med pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa las sems mi srung ba dang / rnam par byang ba mi bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: bag med pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa las sems mi srung ba dang / rnam par byang ba mi bsgom pa'o //
translated: Carelessness is the lack of protection of the mind from defilement and the non-cultivation of purification.

original: brjed ngas pa ni nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i dran pa'o //
analyzed: brjed ngas pa ni nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i dran pa'o //
translated: Forgetfulness is the memory associated with defilement.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba ni lus dang ngag gi spyod pa mi rtog pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba ni lus dang ngag gi spyod pa mi rtog pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: Distraction is the cause of the non-contemplation of the conduct of body and speech.

original: sems rnam par 'phro ba'o //
analyzed: sems rnam par 'phro ba'o //
translated: It is the scattering of the mind.

original: shes bzhin ma yin pa ni nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: shes bzhin ma yin pa ni nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: Lack of vigilance is the wisdom associated with defilement.

original: 'gyod pa ni 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa ma byas pa la sems kyis dmigs nas yid la gcags pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa ni 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa ma byas pa la sems kyis dmigs nas yid la gcags pa'o //
translated: Regret is the remorse of the mind that focuses on what was done or not done that is undesirable or desirable.

original: gnyid ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga mngon par sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnyid ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga mngon par sdud par byed pa'o //
translated: Sleep is the gathering of the five collections of consciousness.

original: rtog pa ni shes pa dang sems pa'i rang bzhin te mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na go rims bzhin du shes rab dang sems la brten nas go bar bya ba dang / bye brag tu go bar bya ba'i rnam pas rags pa yongs su tshol ba'i yid la brjod pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa ni shes pa dang sems pa'i rang bzhin te mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na go rims bzhin du shes rab dang sems la brten nas go bar bya ba dang / bye brag tu go bar bya ba'i rnam pas rags pa yongs su tshol ba'i yid la brjod pa'o //
translated: Conception is the nature of knowledge and intention. At the time of realization, it is mental attention that investigates the gross, in the aspect of understanding and specific understanding, respectively, based on wisdom and mind.

original: dpyod pa ni de bzhin du so sor rtog pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: dpyod pa ni de bzhin du so sor rtog pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: Discrimination is the same, in the aspect of discernment.

original: zhi ba mor rjes su dpyod pa'i yid la brjod pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba mor rjes su dpyod pa'i yid la brjod pa'o //
translated: It is mental attention that investigates tranquility.

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ni ru gdug dang 'phya smod la sogs pa dag ste /
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ni ru gdug dang 'phya smod la sogs pa dag ste /
translated: Such as these means such as slander, contempt, and so on.

original: de dag mtshan nyid kyang gzhan la gnod pa'i ngang tshul ni ru gdug go ;
analyzed: de dag mtshan nyid kyang gzhan la gnod pa'i ngang tshul ni ru gdug go ;
translated: Slander is the nature of harming others.

original: /'phya ba'i ngang tshul la sogs pa ni 'phya smod ces bya ste /
analyzed: /'phya ba'i ngang tshul la sogs pa ni 'phya smod ces bya ste /
translated: Contempt and so on are called disparagement.

original: gzhi bsdu ba'i skabs nas gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhi bsdu ba'i skabs nas gzung bar bya'o //
translated: They should be understood from the chapter on the compendium of bases.

original: sems las byung ba de dag kyang kun tu 'gro ba dang / so sor nges par kun tu 'gro ba dang / dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams su rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sems las byung ba de dag kyang kun tu 'gro ba dang / so sor nges par kun tu 'gro ba dang / dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams su rnam par gzhag go //
translated: These mental factors are also established as omnipresent, specific omnipresent, virtuous, afflictive, and secondary afflictive.

original: de la kun tu 'gro ba rnams ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa'i sa'i skabs su rnam par gzhag pa byas zin to //
analyzed: de la kun tu 'gro ba rnams ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa'i sa'i skabs su rnam par gzhag pa byas zin to //
translated: The omnipresent ones have already been established in the context of the five collections of consciousness.

original: so sor nges par kun tu 'gro ba rnams ni 'dod pa dang / nges pa dang / 'dris pa dang / brtag pa dang / dmigs pa la so sor nges par 'jug pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: so sor nges par kun tu 'gro ba rnams ni 'dod pa dang / nges pa dang / 'dris pa dang / brtag pa dang / dmigs pa la so sor nges par 'jug pa nyid yin te /
translated: The specific omnipresent ones are determined to engage their objects specifically as desired, determined, familiar, imagined, and focused.

original: go rims bzhin du rnam par gzhag par bya'o ;
analyzed: go rims bzhin du rnam par gzhag par bya'o ;
translated: They should be established in that order.

original: / dge ba rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa ni dus drug po nges pa'i dus dang / sdig pa las ldog pa'i dus dang / dge ba'i phyogs bya ba'i dus dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral pa'i dus dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dus dang /
analyzed: / dge ba rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa ni dus drug po nges pa'i dus dang / sdig pa las ldog pa'i dus dang / dge ba'i phyogs bya ba'i dus dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral pa'i dus dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dus dang /
translated: The classification of virtues is presented in terms of six times: the time of certainty, the time of turning away from evil, the time of engaging in virtue, the time of mundane freedom from attachment, the time of supramundane freedom from attachment, and the time of benefiting sentient beings.ğŸ”½The six times are presented in terms of the time of certainty, the time of turning away from evil, the time of engaging in virtue, the time of mundane freedom from attachment, the time of supramundane freedom from attachment, and the time of benefiting sentient beings.ğŸ”½The six times are presented in terms of the time of certainty, the time of turning away from evil, the time of engaging in virtue, the time of mundane freedom from attachment, the time of supramundane freedom from attachment, and the time of benefiting sentient beings.

original: sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i @87a * //ğŸ”½dus su 'jug pa las brtsams nas /
analyzed: sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i @87a * // dus su 'jug pa las brtsams nas /
translated: The six times are presented in terms of the time of certainty, the time of turning away from evil, the time of engaging in virtue, the time of mundane freedom from attachment, the time of supramundane freedom from attachment, and the time of benefiting sentient beings.

original: gcig dang / gnyis dang / bzhi dang / gcig dang / gnyis dang / gcig dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: gcig dang / gnyis dang / bzhi dang / gcig dang / gnyis dang / gcig dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: The six times are presented in terms of the time of certainty, the time of turning away from evil, the time of engaging in virtue, the time of mundane freedom from attachment, the time of supramundane freedom from attachment, and the time of benefiting sentient beings.ğŸ”½The six times are presented in terms of the time of certainty, the time of turning away from evil, the time of engaging in virtue, the time of mundane freedom from attachment, the time of supramundane freedom from attachment, and the time of benefiting sentient beings.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gzhi yin pas gtso bo yin pa'i phyir nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pas sngar smos shing logs shig tu bstan te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gzhi yin pas gtso bo yin pa'i phyir nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pas sngar smos shing logs shig tu bstan te /
translated: The six times are presented in terms of the time of certainty, the time of turning away from evil, the time of engaging in virtue, the time of mundane freedom from attachment, the time of supramundane freedom from attachment, and the time of benefiting sentient beings.ğŸ”½The six times are presented in terms of the time of certainty, the time of turning away from evil, the time of engaging in virtue, the time of mundane freedom from attachment, the time of supramundane freedom from attachment, and the time of benefiting sentient beings.ğŸ”½The six times are presented in terms of the time of certainty, the time of turning away from evil, the time of engaging in virtue, the time of mundane freedom from attachment, the time of supramundane freedom from attachment, and the time of benefiting

original: de dag kyang bza' bar bya ba gang yin pa dang / zab mo gang yin pa dang / de la phyin ci log pa gang yin pa de dag la log par sgrub pa'i phyir rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de dag kyang bza' bar bya ba gang yin pa dang / zab mo gang yin pa dang / de la phyin ci log pa gang yin pa de dag la log par sgrub pa'i phyir rnam par gzhag go //
translated: They are established as the three kinds of wrong practice with regard to what is to be eaten, what is profound, and what is non-erroneous.

original: de la bza' bar bya ba ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba rnams te /
analyzed: de la bza' bar bya ba ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba rnams te /
translated: What is to be eaten is the three kinds of feelings: pleasant, unpleasant, and neither.

original: de dag la log par sgrub pa ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag la log par sgrub pa ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams te go rims bzhin no //
translated: The three kinds of wrong practice with regard to them are attachment, hostility, and ignorance, respectively.

original: za ba po ni sems can te /
analyzed: za ba po ni sems can te /
translated: The eater is the sentient being.

original: de la bdag tu rab tu 'dzin cing log bar sgrub pa ni nga rgyal yin no //
analyzed: de la bdag tu rab tu 'dzin cing log bar sgrub pa ni nga rgyal yin no //
translated: The wrong practice with regard to it is pride, because of the grasping of the self.

original: de la phyin ci ma log pa ni yang dag par nges pa ste /
analyzed: de la phyin ci ma log pa ni yang dag par nges pa ste /
translated: What is non-erroneous is right practice.

original: de la log par sgrub pa ni log par nges pa dang ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: de la log par sgrub pa ni log par nges pa dang ma nges pa'o //
translated: The two kinds of wrong practice with regard to it are wrong practice and indeterminate practice.

original: de gnyis kyang lta ba rnams dang the tshom ste go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyang lta ba rnams dang the tshom ste go rims bzhin no //
translated: They are, respectively, the views and doubt.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni gzhi rnam pa drug gi phyir rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni gzhi rnam pa drug gi phyir rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The secondary mental afflictions are presented as being six types of bases.

original: thab mo dang rtsod pa la sogs pa'i gzhi dang / rnyed pa la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi chos kyi gzhi dang / tshul khrims la gnod pa'i gzhi dang / zhi gnas dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gzhi dang / dbang po lnga ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i gzhi dang /
analyzed: thab mo dang rtsod pa la sogs pa'i gzhi dang / rnyed pa la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi chos kyi gzhi dang / tshul khrims la gnod pa'i gzhi dang / zhi gnas dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gzhi dang / dbang po lnga ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i gzhi dang /
translated: The bases of quarreling, disputing, and so on; the bases of the worldly dharmas of gain and so on; the bases that harm morality; the bases that are adverse to calm; the bases that are adverse to the five faculties;

original: bslab pa gsum gyi dri ma'i gzhi rnams te /
analyzed: bslab pa gsum gyi dri ma'i gzhi rnams te /
translated: and the bases that are the defilements of the three trainings.

original: de dag kyang bzhi dang / drug dang / gnyis dang / gnyis dang / drug dang / bzhi dang / go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang bzhi dang / drug dang / gnyis dang / gnyis dang / drug dang / bzhi dang / go rims bzhin no //
translated: They are four, six, two, two, six, four, respectively.

original: de la dad pa la sogs pa dbang po lnga po dag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni ma dad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la dad pa la sogs pa dbang po lnga po dag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni ma dad pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The five faculties of faith and so on have lack of faith and so on as their adverse objects.

original: de dag gi 'bras bu ni bag med pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu ni bag med pa ste /
translated: Their result is heedlessness,

original: de dag gis dge ba'i chos rnams sgom par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis dge ba'i chos rnams sgom par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not cultivate virtuous dharmas.

original: tshul khrims kyi dri ma ni 'gyod pa yin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi dri ma ni 'gyod pa yin te /
translated: Regret is the stain of morality.

original: shin tu 'gyod pa dang ldan pa ni tshul khrims rnam par ma dag par shes pa na rgyun du 'gyod pa'i dri mas gong du mi rtsol ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: shin tu 'gyod pa dang ldan pa ni tshul khrims rnam par ma dag par shes pa na rgyun du 'gyod pa'i dri mas gong du mi rtsol ba'i phyir te /
translated: One who has a great deal of regret, knowing that morality is impure, is stained by continuous regret and therefore does not strive for higher qualities.

original: de'i phyir de ni 'dir nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni 'dir nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, it is considered a secondary defilement here.

original: gang nyes pa byung na skad cig nyid du 'gyod par byed pa de ni dge ba yin pa'i phyir nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang nyes pa byung na skad cig nyid du 'gyod par byed pa de ni dge ba yin pa'i phyir nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ma yin no //
translated: But if one regrets the occurrence of a fault immediately, that is virtue and not a secondary defilement.

original: de bzhin du gnyid kyang ting nge 'dzin gyi dri @87b ma yin pas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyid kyang ting nge 'dzin gyi dri @87b ma yin pas brjod par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, sleep is a stain of meditative concentration and should be mentioned.

original: shes rab kyi dri ma ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi dri ma ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis te /
translated: Conceptualization and discursiveness are the stains of wisdom.

original: 'di ltar shin tu yun ring por nges par rtog pa dran pa rmongs pa dang blo 'khrugs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar shin tu yun ring por nges par rtog pa dran pa rmongs pa dang blo 'khrugs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For, due to them, one is confused about the object of memory and the mind is disturbed for a long time.

original: de'i phyir rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the Compendium of Ascertainments says:

original: de gnyis nye ba'i nyon mongs pa nyid yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis nye ba'i nyon mongs pa nyid yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: These two are called secondary mental afflictions.

original: de lta ma yin na dge ba la sogs par dge ba'i chos ma phye bas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa nyid yin par rtogs dka' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dge ba la sogs par dge ba'i chos ma phye bas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa nyid yin par rtogs dka' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were not, then since they would not distinguish virtuous dharmas, etc., it would be difficult to understand that they are secondary mental afflictions.

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan du na de dag ni mtshungs par ldan pa rnam pa bzhi'i phyir rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan du na de dag ni mtshungs par ldan pa rnam pa bzhi'i phyir rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Moreover, they are posited as four types of concomitant mental factors.

original: re re yang mi dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir khro ba la sogs pa bcu ste /
analyzed: re re yang mi dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir khro ba la sogs pa bcu ste /
translated: Ten, such as anger, are concomitant with nonvirtuous and afflicted minds.

original: gang du gcig 'byung ba der gnyis pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang du gcig 'byung ba der gnyis pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when one occurs, the other does not occur.

original: mi dge ba'i sems thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa gnyis so //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sems thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa gnyis so //
translated: Two, nonembarrassment and shamelessness, are concomitant with all nonvirtuous minds.

original: khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi sems can thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rmugs pa la sogs pa brgyad do //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi sems can thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rmugs pa la sogs pa brgyad do //
translated: Eight, such as lethargy, are concomitant with all afflicted minds of the three realms.

original: nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir 'gyod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir 'gyod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Regret and so on are associated with afflicted and unafflicted minds.

original: 'jug pa rjes su 'jug par byed do zhes bya ba ni rgyus kun nas bslang ba dang de'i skad cig mas kun nas bslang ba dag gis so //
analyzed: 'jug pa rjes su 'jug par byed do zhes bya ba ni rgyus kun nas bslang ba dang de'i skad cig mas kun nas bslang ba dag gis so //
translated: It is said that the mental faculty engages and continues to engage because it is motivated by both the cause and the moment.ğŸ”½Because it is the cause that arises from that, it is the cause that is similar to the cause that motivates it.

original: de'i rgyu las byung ba rgyu mthun pa kun nas slong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa de ni de'i rgyu las byung ba rgyu mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu las byung ba rgyu mthun pa kun nas slong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa de ni de'i rgyu las byung ba rgyu mthun pa yin te /
translated: That mental consciousness is the cause that arises from that, which is similar to the cause.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dge ba dang mi dge ba dag go //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dge ba dang mi dge ba dag go //
translated: It is the virtuous and nonvirtuous eye consciousnesses and so on.

original: de'i kun nas slong ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i kun nas slong ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid du 'byung ngo //
translated: Its motivation arises as virtuous and nonvirtuous.

original: khyad par gyur pa'i las zhes bya ba ni las snga ma ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag dang thun mongs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par gyur pa'i las zhes bya ba ni las snga ma ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag dang thun mongs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The action that is a transformation is the action that is not shared in common with the five collections of consciousness.

original: ra ro bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni chang 'thungs te 'khrugs par byas pas 'byung ba 'khrugs par gyur pa'i phyir lus 'gyur ba dang sems 'gyur bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ra ro bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni chang 'thungs te 'khrugs par byas pas 'byung ba 'khrugs par gyur pa'i phyir lus 'gyur ba dang sems 'gyur bar gyur pa'o //
translated: â€œIntoxicationâ€ is a disturbance of the elements caused by drinking alcohol, and it is a transformation of the body and mind.

original: rnam par rtog pa bdun po dag rnam pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / mtshungs par ldan pas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bdun po dag rnam pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / mtshungs par ldan pas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: These seven types of conceptualization are established by way of their aspect, nature, and concomitants.

original: gnyis dang / gsum dang / gnyis dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyis dang / gsum dang / gnyis dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: They are two, three, and two, respectively.

original: 'das pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'das pa gsal bar myong ba'i mtshan ma yul du byas pas na de'i phyir mtshan ma can zhes bya'o //ğŸ”½ma 'ongs pa'i yul mtshan ma bkra bar yod @88a * //
analyzed: 'das pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'das pa gsal bar myong ba'i mtshan ma yul du byas pas na de'i phyir mtshan ma can zhes bya'o // ma 'ongs pa'i yul mtshan ma bkra bar yod @88a * //
translated: Conceptualization that focuses on the past is called â€œhaving signsâ€ because it takes as its object the signs of the experience of the clarity of the past.

original: kyang dmigs pa ma myong ba'i phyir mtshan ma can yin pa kho na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kyang dmigs pa ma myong ba'i phyir mtshan ma can yin pa kho na zhes bya ste /
translated: Conceptualization that focuses on the future is called â€œhaving signsâ€ because, although the object of the future exists with clear signs, it is not experienced as an object.

original: de ni gsal ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gsal ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not clear.

original: rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar gnas pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag gis de ni rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar gnas pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag gis de ni rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: That which is called â€œdestruction by its very natureâ€ is the third type of impermanence.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Association is of two types:

original: nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: defiled and undefiled.

original: gzhan dag ni gzhan du rnam par 'chad de /ğŸ”½sngon nyams su myong ba'i don rnams la zhes bya ba ni sngon nyams su myong ba de dang 'dra ba da ltar byung ba kho na dag la sngon nyams su myong ba'i rjes su 'brang bas sgro btags te mtshan mar bzung nas 'jug pa'i phyir mtshan ma can
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gzhan du rnam par 'chad de / sngon nyams su myong ba'i don rnams la zhes bya ba ni sngon nyams su myong ba de dang 'dra ba da ltar byung ba kho na dag la sngon nyams su myong ba'i rjes su 'brang bas sgro btags te mtshan mar bzung nas 'jug pa'i phyir mtshan ma can
translated: Others explain it differently.ğŸ”½That which is associated with the sign is that which engages its object by superimposing a sign, by following after the sign of the object that was previously experienced.

original: yin te / 'dir ni gang yod pa nyid dang mngon par phrad pa ni mtshan ma khyad par can yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: yin te / 'dir ni gang yod pa nyid dang mngon par phrad pa ni mtshan ma khyad par can yin par 'dod do //
translated: The sign is the particular entity that is the object of the experience.

original: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa la rnam par rtog pa ni mtshan ma can ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa la rnam par rtog pa ni mtshan ma can ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, conceptualization of the future is not associated with the sign.

original: mtshan mar bya ba yod kyang yod pa nyid dang mngon par phrad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½'das pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni ltos pas gnyis kar yang brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan mar bya ba yod kyang yod pa nyid dang mngon par phrad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // 'das pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni ltos pas gnyis kar yang brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: although there is a representation of the sign, it is not a representation of what is present.

original: mtshan mar bya ba mi gsal ba'i phyir dang / yod pa nyid dang mngon par phrad pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mtshan mar bya ba mi gsal ba'i phyir dang / yod pa nyid dang mngon par phrad pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The conceptualization that has the past as its object is not described as being either of those two, because it is not clear that there is a representation of the sign, and it is not a representation of what is present.

original: de bas na 'dir ma brjod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir ma brjod do zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not mentioned here.

original: de ltar na de ni dmigs pa la rnam par rtog pa ma yin pas thams cad 'dus par mi rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni dmigs pa la rnam par rtog pa ma yin pas thams cad 'dus par mi rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, since it is not a conceptualization that has an object, it is not suitable that all be included in that.

analyzed: de ma byas kyang rung ste zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i mchog ma byas pa'am mang du ma byas pa'o //
