original: gang lan mang du goms par byas pa zhes bya ba ni dper na bya rog dag las zho bsrung ngo zhes bya ba bzhin du nye bar mtshon pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang lan mang du goms par byas pa zhes bya ba ni dper na bya rog dag las zho bsrung ngo zhes bya ba bzhin du nye bar mtshon pa'i don to //
translated: â€œThat which is frequently practicedâ€ is like the example of â€œprotecting yogurt from crows.â€

original: shin tu lci ba dang nye ba ni de'i tshe na ches stobs dang ldan pa nyid do //
analyzed: shin tu lci ba dang nye ba ni de'i tshe na ches stobs dang ldan pa nyid do //
translated: â€œVery heavyâ€ and â€œnearâ€ means that at that time, it is very powerful.

original: de spyad na zhes bya ba ni phal cher spyad pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de spyad na zhes bya ba ni phal cher spyad pa la bya'o //
translated: â€œIf one engages in thatâ€ means if one engages in that for the most part.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni snga ltas rnams myong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar gyi sngar byas pa 'di dang sbyar ba ni ma yin no //ğŸ”½phyi ma red kyi dus smos pa ni phyi ma red kyi @90a * //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni snga ltas rnams myong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar gyi sngar byas pa 'di dang sbyar ba ni ma yin no // phyi ma red kyi dus smos pa ni phyi ma red kyi @90a * //
translated: â€œHereâ€ is connected with â€œone experiences the signs,â€ not with â€œpreviously done.â€

original: dus na grib ma che ba bzhin du des 'das pa'i las sngon rab tu nyal ba yang de'i tshe na ltas 'byin pa la sogs pa'i bya bas rnam par mched par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus na grib ma che ba bzhin du des 'das pa'i las sngon rab tu nyal ba yang de'i tshe na ltas 'byin pa la sogs pa'i bya bas rnam par mched par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of the time of dawn is because at the time of dawn, like a great shadow, the previously deeply lain karmas of the past are awakened by the activity of producing signs, etc., and become manifest.

original: 'bab cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams ni go rims bzhin du chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po yin te /
analyzed: 'bab cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams ni go rims bzhin du chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po yin te /
translated: The words â€œfallingâ€ and so on refer to the small, medium, and great stages, respectively.

original: tshig phra ba rnams kyi don chung ba dang / lhag pa dang / mngon du shas che ba'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig phra ba rnams kyi don chung ba dang / lhag pa dang / mngon du shas che ba'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the small, medium, and great stages of the path of action are, respectively, the small, medium, and great stages of the object.

original: mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu yin la zhes bya ba ni gdol pa la sogs pa dag nyid mun pa yin te /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu yin la zhes bya ba ni gdol pa la sogs pa dag nyid mun pa yin te /
translated: The result of nonvirtuous action is the hells, which are the abode of darkness.

original: ches nag po dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ches nag po dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The hells are the abode of darkness because they are the abode of the most intense darkness.ğŸ”½Thinking â€œI will cease to exist,â€ he is afraid of the annihilation of the self.

original: bdag ni med par 'gyur ro snyam nas zhes bya ba ni bdag chad par 'gyur ram 'on te chad par mi 'gyur zhing skye bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems shing ma 'ongs pa'i lus la mngon par dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni med par 'gyur ro snyam nas zhes bya ba ni bdag chad par 'gyur ram 'on te chad par mi 'gyur zhing skye bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems shing ma 'ongs pa'i lus la mngon par dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: Thinking â€œI will cease to existâ€ means thinking â€œWill I be annihilated or not? Will I be born or not?â€ and taking delight in a future body.

original: mngon par spong bar byed kyi zhes bya ba ni 'jug bcom pa'i phyir te /ğŸ”½bag med par spyod pa nyam chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par spong bar byed kyi zhes bya ba ni 'jug bcom pa'i phyir te /ğŸ”½bag med par spyod pa nyam chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is afraid of the annihilation of the self, because he is afraid of the destruction of the self.ğŸ”½He is afraid of the annihilation of the self, because he is afraid of the destruction of the self.

original: bdag ni med par 'gyur ro zhes bdag tu lta ba de gang yin //
analyzed: bdag ni med par 'gyur ro zhes bdag tu lta ba de gang yin //
translated: What is the view of self that thinks, â€œI will not existâ€?

original: re zhig kun brtags pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig kun brtags pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the imaginary view of self,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa dag gis de spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa dag gis de spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because those who have entered the stream have abandoned it.

original: lhan cig skyes pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the innate view of self,

original: rgyu ba bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ba bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is removed from the cause.ğŸ”½The nonreturner does not have the innate view of self, because it does not occur, since it is associated with the afflicted mind.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir kun tu 'byung ba med do zhes bya bar 'gal te 'di ltar de ni rtag tu kun tu 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir kun tu 'byung ba med do zhes bya bar 'gal te 'di ltar de ni rtag tu kun tu 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: It is contradictory to say that it always occurs, since it is removed from the cause.

original: de ni kun brtags pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni kun brtags pa yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not the imaginary view of self,

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid la brten pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid la brten pa yang ma yin te /
translated: nor is it based on the afflicted mind.

original: de ni rnam par rtog pa can lhan cig skyes pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba gzhan zhig yin te /
analyzed: de ni rnam par rtog pa can lhan cig skyes pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba gzhan zhig yin te /
translated: It is another innate view of self that is conceptual and is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: 'og nas khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: 'og nas khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: This will be understood later.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba rnams ni de'i tshe bdag la chags pa de kun spyod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'i stobs bskyed par gyur pa dang / grogs phal cher ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba rnams ni de'i tshe bdag la chags pa de kun spyod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'i stobs bskyed par gyur pa dang / grogs phal cher ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-returners do not have attachment to self at that time, because the power of the antidote has been generated and because the majority of friends are incomplete.

original: sems can dmyal ba pa rnams ni 'chi ba la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir ma gtogs so zhes smos so //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba pa rnams ni 'chi ba la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir ma gtogs so zhes smos so //
translated: Except for those hell beings who delight in death.

original: dbang po nyams pa rnams ni rim gyis shing yin no //
analyzed: dbang po nyams pa rnams ni rim gyis shing yin no //
translated: Those whose faculties are impaired die gradually.

original: lus 'dod pa ni lus grub pa'i rten yin te /
analyzed: lus 'dod pa ni lus grub pa'i rten yin te /
translated: Those who desire a body have a basis for the formation of a body.ğŸ”½Because it is the principal abode.

original: gnas kyi gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa de'i phyir da lus la chags pa skyes pa dang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gnas kyi gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa de'i phyir da lus la chags pa skyes pa dang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said: â€œWhen attachment to the body arises.â€

original: rgyu de gnyis zhes bya ba ni smras ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu de gnyis zhes bya ba ni smras ma thag pa'o //
translated: The two causes are those just mentioned.

original: rang gi sa bon las zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi sa bon las zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa ste /
translated: From its own seed means from its own nature.

original: yang @90b dang yang du rang gi 'bras bur gyur pa bar ma do'i srid pa kun tu 'byung ba 'thob pa'i stobs skyed par byed pa'i sa bon las so //
analyzed: yang @90b dang yang du rang gi 'bras bur gyur pa bar ma do'i srid pa kun tu 'byung ba 'thob pa'i stobs skyed par byed pa'i sa bon las so //
translated: and again and again, it generates the seed that produces the power to obtain the intermediate existence that is its effect.

original: phyar ba nag po zhes bya ba ni ra bal las byas pa ste mi phal ba'i gos yin no //
analyzed: phyar ba nag po zhes bya ba ni ra bal las byas pa ste mi phal ba'i gos yin no //
translated: The black blanket is made of wool and is the clothing of ordinary people.

original: de rigs ni mthun pa'i mig ji lta bu'i spyod yul du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de rigs ni mthun pa'i mig ji lta bu'i spyod yul du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: What kind of eye is the eye that sees it?

original: de ni lha'i mig shin tu rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul yin no zhes bya smos so //
analyzed: de ni lha'i mig shin tu rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul yin no zhes bya smos so //
translated: It is the eye of the gods, which is very pure.

original: bdag dang skal ba mnyam pa rnams zhes bya ba ni skyes pas skyes pa'i lta bu'o //ğŸ”½mig ni thur du gsal te zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba pa dag gi dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang skal ba mnyam pa rnams zhes bya ba ni skyes pas skyes pa'i lta bu'o // mig ni thur du gsal te zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba pa dag gi dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: Those who are similar to me are men, who see it in the same way.ğŸ”½The eye of hell beings is directed downward.

original: dud 'gro rnams ni gang du skyes pa de dang mthun par 'jig rten gyi khams 'og mar ro //
analyzed: dud 'gro rnams ni gang du skyes pa de dang mthun par 'jig rten gyi khams 'og mar ro //
translated: The eye of animals is directed in all directions, because they are born in all directions.

original: bsod nams brten pa ni las kyi dbang gis 'gro ba gong ma'i 'du shes kyis 'gro'o //
analyzed: bsod nams brten pa ni las kyi dbang gis 'gro ba gong ma'i 'du shes kyis 'gro'o //
translated: â€œThe one who is supported by merit goes by the perception of the higher realm due to the power of karma.

original: nges pa med do zhes bya ba ni de mngon du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa med do zhes bya ba ni de mngon du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no certaintyâ€ means that it is due to the manifestation of that.

original: yang zhag bdun du gnas so zhes bya ba ni tshe de tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang zhag bdun du gnas so zhes bya ba ni tshe de tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œIt also remains for seven daysâ€ means that the life span is exhausted in that time.

original: bdun phrag bdun gyi bar du yang gnas so zhes bya ba ni de tsam gyis na bar ma do'i srid pa'i las kyi shugs zad par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdun phrag bdun gyi bar du yang gnas so zhes bya ba ni de tsam gyis na bar ma do'i srid pa'i las kyi shugs zad par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: â€œIt also remains for seven weeksâ€ means that the force of the karma of the intermediate existence is exhausted in that time.

original: de lta bas na de'i tshe na las gzhan gyis zil gyis non pas na rigs mi mthun pa gzhan du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i tshe na las gzhan gyis zil gyis non pas na rigs mi mthun pa gzhan du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, at that time, due to being overwhelmed by other karma, one is born in another realm that is not compatible.

original: gal te las gzhan gyi bya ba yongs su gyur pas zhes bya ba ni gal te sngon byas pa'i las gzhan mngon du gyur pas bar ma do'i srid pa la gnas pa'i rnam par smin pas gang byas pa des yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te las gzhan gyi bya ba yongs su gyur pas zhes bya ba ni gal te sngon byas pa'i las gzhan mngon du gyur pas bar ma do'i srid pa la gnas pa'i rnam par smin pas gang byas pa des yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œIf the activity of other karma is transformedâ€ means that if the activity of other previously created karma manifests, then the activity of the karma of the intermediate existence is transformed due to the ripening of the karma that was created.

original: kha cig na re dgra bcom pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal can sems can dmyal bar skye ba 'chi ba'i srid pa la gnas pa kho na ni skye ba'i mtshan ma mthong ba'i phyir log par lta bas der skye ba yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re dgra bcom pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal can sems can dmyal bar skye ba 'chi ba'i srid pa la gnas pa kho na ni skye ba'i mtshan ma mthong ba'i phyir log par lta bas der skye ba yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: Only the arhat who is conceited about his realization and who is born in the hells sees the signs of birth because he is born there through wrong view.

original: kha cig na re de las 'das pa phan chad ni zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe na las rnams kyi chogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re de las 'das pa phan chad ni zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe na las rnams kyi chogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: From then on, because the collection of karma that establishes the intermediate existence is completed.

original: 'o na bdun pa dang po nyid nas kyang ci'i phyir mi byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na bdun pa dang po nyid nas kyang ci'i phyir mi byed ce na /
translated: Why doesnâ€™t it arise from the first moment of the seventh existence?

original: de tsam gyis na las kyi nus pa yongs su smin pa rab mthar phyin ba thob pa'i phyir des gzung bar dka' ba'i stobs kyi rkyen 'dren par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na las kyi nus pa yongs su smin pa rab mthar phyin ba thob pa'i phyir des gzung bar dka' ba'i stobs kyi rkyen 'dren par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the power of the ripening of karma is fully completed by that much, it is difficult to hold and it draws the condition of the power of karma.

original: zhag bdun gyis shi 'phos pa de yang zhes bya ba ni zhag bdun phrag bdun po gang yang rung ba dag gis de nas shi 'phos nas bar ma do'i srid pa gzhan du skye @91a * //
analyzed: zhag bdun gyis shi 'phos pa de yang zhes bya ba ni zhag bdun phrag bdun po gang yang rung ba dag gis de nas shi 'phos nas bar ma do'i srid pa gzhan du skye @91a * //
translated: And if he dies after seven days, he is reborn in another intermediate existence.

original: bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: This means that if he dies after any of the seven weeks, he is reborn in another intermediate existence.

original: 'dir bar mdo'i srid pa de nyid du byas pa'i las kyis sam gzhan gyis yin pa ni gcig tu ma nges so //
analyzed: 'dir bar mdo'i srid pa de nyid du byas pa'i las kyis sam gzhan gyis yin pa ni gcig tu ma nges so //
translated: It is not certain that the action is done in the intermediate existence itself or in another existence.

original: bar ma do'i srid pa'i las yongs su rdzogs par byed pa kho na dang / tshe 'di nyid la myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i grub pa'i mtha' 'di ni kho bo cag gi ma yin no //
analyzed: bar ma do'i srid pa'i las yongs su rdzogs par byed pa kho na dang / tshe 'di nyid la myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i grub pa'i mtha' 'di ni kho bo cag gi ma yin no //
translated: This is not our tenet that the action of the intermediate existence is only completed and experienced in this life.

original: sngar bshad pa rnams ni phal cher yod par smra bar chos mngon pa la 'dris pa las 'ongs pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa rnams ni phal cher yod par smra bar chos mngon pa la 'dris pa las 'ongs pa yin no //
translated: Most of what has been explained above comes from the Abhidharma of the VÄtsÄ«putrÄ«yas.

original: dri'i phyir 'gro bas na dri za zhes kyang bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dri'i phyir 'gro bas na dri za zhes kyang bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are called gandharvas because they go by smell.

original: aarh'a zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: aarh'a zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word arhat means â€œone who goes.â€

original: dris brtas par 'gyur bzhes bya ba ni de nyid de'i zas yin par ston to //ğŸ”½lus kyi 'gro bas 'gro'i dmigs pa'i 'gro bas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yul gzhan du 'byung ba dang ldan pa'ang phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du lus kyis 'gro ba yin gyi /
analyzed: dris brtas par 'gyur bzhes bya ba ni de nyid de'i zas yin par ston to // lus kyi 'gro bas 'gro'i dmigs pa'i 'gro bas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yul gzhan du 'byung ba dang ldan pa'ang phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du lus kyis 'gro ba yin gyi /
translated: The phrase â€œit is said that the object is its foodâ€ shows that that is its food.ğŸ”½The body moves, not the object.

original: gzugs med pa'i rnam par shes pa tsam ni yul rgyu ba med pa'i phyir dmigs pa la 'dzin pa lta bus 'gro ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i rnam par shes pa tsam ni yul rgyu ba med pa'i phyir dmigs pa la 'dzin pa lta bus 'gro ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The body moves to another place, like a pot, etc., but the formless consciousness does not move to the object, because it is not a substance.

original: sems can gyi rgyud ni rgyun chad cing mi rigs te /
analyzed: sems can gyi rgyud ni rgyun chad cing mi rigs te /
translated: The continuum of sentient beings is not interrupted and is not a species,

original: 'bru la sogs pa bzhin du rgyun gyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bru la sogs pa bzhin du rgyun gyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a continuum, like a seed, etc.

original: de'i phyir 'dis ni skye ba'i gnas su 'byung ba ni dmigs pa tsam du zad do zhes zer ba bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis ni skye ba'i gnas su 'byung ba ni dmigs pa tsam du zad do zhes zer ba bkag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this passage refutes the assertion that the object is merely the place where the consciousness arises.

original: 'o na theg pa chen po'i mdo rnam par shes pa 'pho ba zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: 'o na theg pa chen po'i mdo rnam par shes pa 'pho ba zhes bya ba las /
translated: Now, in the Mahayana sutra called the Transference of Consciousness,

original: bzang skyong gang khyod 'di skad du ji ltar na rnam par shes pa 'dis lus bor nas 'pho zhing 'gro bar 'gyur zhes zer ba ni me long gi gzugs brnyan lta bu dang / rgya'i 'bur lta bur 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bzang skyong gang khyod 'di skad du ji ltar na rnam par shes pa 'dis lus bor nas 'pho zhing 'gro bar 'gyur zhes zer ba ni me long gi gzugs brnyan lta bu dang / rgya'i 'bur lta bur 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: BhadrapÄla, you asked, â€œHow does consciousness abandon this body and pass on?â€ It is like a reflection in a mirror or like a seal and its impression.

original: bstan pa de ni byis pa la sogs pa gang 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'pho'i zhes yun ring po nas rnam par shes pa la bdag nyid dang / rtag pa nyid du 'dzin par goms pa'i sems can de yod pas /
analyzed: bstan pa de ni byis pa la sogs pa gang 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'pho'i zhes yun ring po nas rnam par shes pa la bdag nyid dang / rtag pa nyid du 'dzin par goms pa'i sems can de yod pas /
translated: The teaching that â€œa being passes from this world to the nextâ€ is for the childish, who are habituated to apprehending consciousness as a self and as permanent.

original: de dgag pa'i phyir phung po 'di dag la brten nas phung po gzhan dag rgya'i 'bur kho na bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de dgag pa'i phyir phung po 'di dag la brten nas phung po gzhan dag rgya'i 'bur kho na bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: To refute that, the Buddha taught, â€œIn dependence on these aggregates, other aggregates arise, like a seal and its impression.â€

original: bar ma do'i srid pa dgag pa'i phyir ni ma yin pas na de la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: bar ma do'i srid pa dgag pa'i phyir ni ma yin pas na de la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: But he did not teach this to refute intermediate existence. Therefore what contradiction is there in this?

original: mdo sde de'i don de kho na yin gyi gzhan du mi bzhed par ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: mdo sde de'i don de kho na yin gyi gzhan du mi bzhed par ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How do we know that the meaning of that sÅ«tra is just that and not otherwise?

original: don gzhan du rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: don gzhan du rtogs par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood in another way.

original: ji ga 'gal ba med do zhes smra'o //
analyzed: ji ga 'gal ba med do zhes smra'o //
translated: We say there is no contradiction.

original: gal te de ltar yi ge bsgyur ba tsam gyis mdo sde rnams @91b gzhan du drang du rung na ni mdo sde thams cad 'chol bas na yid brtan du ni mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yi ge bsgyur ba tsam gyis mdo sde rnams @91b gzhan du drang du rung na ni mdo sde thams cad 'chol bas na yid brtan du ni mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: If it is suitable to interpret the sÅ«tras in another way merely by changing the letters, then all the sÅ«tras would be confused and it would not be reliable.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar 'gyur te /
translated: Why would that be?

original: lung dang rigs pa yod pas na de dag gis bar ma do'i srid pa'i lus su grub pa'i phyir mdo sde de'i don de ltar drang du rung ngo //ğŸ”½de la rigs pa ni smras zin to //
analyzed: lung dang rigs pa yod pas na de dag gis bar ma do'i srid pa'i lus su grub pa'i phyir mdo sde de'i don de ltar drang du rung ngo // de la rigs pa ni smras zin to //
translated: Since there is scripture and reasoning, those establish the existence of an intermediate existence. Therefore it is suitable to interpret the meaning of that sÅ«tra in that way.ğŸ”½Regarding that, the reasoning has already been explained.

original: lung yang nyan thos kyi theg pa ni 'og nas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lung yang nyan thos kyi theg pa ni 'og nas brjod par bya'o //
translated: The scripture will be stated below.

original: theg pa chen po brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po brjod par bya ste /
translated: The MahÄyÄna must be stated.

original: 'phags pa dam pa'i chos dran pa nya bar gzhag pa'i mdo las sems can dmyal ba mnar med pa las brtsams nas de yang mthong ba rnam par 'khrul cing snum zad pa'i mar me bzhin du de'i bar ma do'i srid pa'i gzugs thogs pa med pa'i byis pa
analyzed: 'phags pa dam pa'i chos dran pa nya bar gzhag pa'i mdo las sems can dmyal ba mnar med pa las brtsams nas de yang mthong ba rnam par 'khrul cing snum zad pa'i mar me bzhin du de'i bar ma do'i srid pa'i gzugs thogs pa med pa'i byis pa
translated: The Sutra of Mindfulness of the Holy Dharma states:

original: lo brgyad lon pa tsam du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lo brgyad lon pa tsam du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: â€œFrom the AvÄ«ci hell, the intermediate existence of a child of the same unimpeded form as that intermediate existence will appear, like a mirage or like a fire ring or like a butter lamp that is not moved by the wind.ğŸ”½â€ğŸ”½The Descent into the Womb SÅ«tra also says:

original: de bzhin du mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo las kyang dga' bo 'di la pha dang ma chags par gyur pa dang dri za nye bar gnas pa'i bar du gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo las kyang dga' bo 'di la pha dang ma chags par gyur pa dang dri za nye bar gnas pa'i bar du gyur na /
translated: â€œNanda, if the father and mother are passionate and the gandharva is present,

original: dga' bo de ltar 'jug par 'dod pa'i dri za ni bar mdo'i srid pa'o zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dga' bo de ltar 'jug par 'dod pa'i dri za ni bar mdo'i srid pa'o zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: Nanda, the gandharva that desires to enter is the intermediate existence.ğŸ”½â€

original: rnam grangs kyi lung dag las kyang bar ma do'i srid pa zhes bya 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs kyi lung dag las kyang bar ma do'i srid pa zhes bya 'byung ste /
translated: The sÅ«tras that are categorized as enumerations also mention intermediate existence.

original: ji skad du srid pa bdun pa zhes pa'i mdo las kyang srid pa bdun pa zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba'i srid pa dang / las kyi srid pa dang / bar ma do'i srid pa'i bar dag ste /
analyzed: ji skad du srid pa bdun pa zhes pa'i mdo las kyang srid pa bdun pa zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba'i srid pa dang / las kyi srid pa dang / bar ma do'i srid pa'i bar dag ste /
translated: The seven existences are the existence of hell beings, the existence of animals, the existence of ghosts, the existence of gods, the existence of humans, the existence of karma, and the intermediate existence.

original: dri za zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dri za zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The gandharva is called the existence of karma.ğŸ”½It also says:

original: ji skad du gnas gsum mngon du gyur na mngal du 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji skad du gnas gsum mngon du gyur na mngal du 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: When three conditions are present, conception occurs:

original: ma nyams bde zhing zla mtshan dang ldan pa dang / pha dang ma chags par gyur cing phrad pa dang / dri za yang nye bar gnas par gyur pa'o zhes kyang gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ma nyams bde zhing zla mtshan dang ldan pa dang / pha dang ma chags par gyur cing phrad pa dang / dri za yang nye bar gnas par gyur pa'o zhes kyang gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: the mother and father have united and the mother is fertile, and a gandharva is present.ğŸ”½The way of birth and death should be understood as before,

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa'i tshul ni snga ma bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni srang gi mgo mjug mthon dman du 'gyur pa'i tshul bzhin du'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa'i tshul ni snga ma bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni srang gi mgo mjug mthon dman du 'gyur pa'i tshul bzhin du'o //
translated: like the way the two ends of a scale move up and down.

original: de der log par zhes bya ba ni ri dags bshor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de der log par zhes bya ba ni ri dags bshor bar bya'o //
translated: The gandharva enters the womb through the vagina,ğŸ”½like a strong man sitting down on his heels.

original: rtsed mo bya'o snyam pa las de'i 'og tu brdeg pa dang du bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rtsed mo bya'o snyam pa las de'i 'og tu brdeg pa dang du bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and then, after the thought of play, he becomes intent on beating and killing.

original: yongs su tsha ba chen pos kyang zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba'i mes so //
analyzed: yongs su tsha ba chen pos kyang zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba'i mes so //
translated: And also by great heat means by the fire of the hells.

original: de nas snga ma bzhin du der dga' ba dang zhes bya ba ni sngon goms pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de nas snga ma bzhin du der dga' ba dang zhes bya ba ni sngon goms pa bzhin du'o //
translated: Then, as before, he becomes attached to that means as before, through previous habituation.

original: ma nyams bde zhing zhes bya ba ni mngal gyis 'dzin nus pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: ma nyams bde zhing zhes bya ba ni mngal gyis 'dzin nus pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs su gyur pa ste /
translated: When the mother is healthy and strong means when the mother is in a condition of body able to carry the embryo.

original: ci 'dra zhe @92a * //
analyzed: ci 'dra zhe @92a * //
translated: What is the condition of the mother?

original: na ; zla mtshan dang ldan pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: na ; zla mtshan dang ldan pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says: when she is in season.

original: de'i phyir pha nyams pa de zhing zhes bya ba ni ma smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir pha nyams pa de zhing zhes bya ba ni ma smos so //
translated: Therefore, the fatherâ€™s fault is not mentioned.

original: de ji skad du mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo las kyang dga' bo zla mtshan zhes bya ba ni dus dang dus tshod la bya ste /
analyzed: de ji skad du mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo las kyang dga' bo zla mtshan zhes bya ba ni dus dang dus tshod la bya ste /
translated: As it says in the GarbhÄvakrÄnti SÅ«tra: â€œ Nanda, in season means at the proper time.

original: de la bud med kha cig ni zhag gsum na'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la bud med kha cig ni zhag gsum na'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Some women are in season for three days.

original: de la skye gnas kyi nyes pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la skye gnas kyi nyes pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is the fault of the womb?

original: skye gnas kyi nyes pa ni glo bur dang / lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: skye gnas kyi nyes pa ni glo bur dang / lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: The faults of the womb are adventitious and inborn.

original: glo bur ni rlung gis ma rung bar byas pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: glo bur ni rlung gis ma rung bar byas pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The adventitious are those caused by wind disorders, etc.

original: lhan cig skyes pa dag ni dbyibs gyur pa dang / dbyibs ma gyur na yang pags shun la skyon yod pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa dag ni dbyibs gyur pa dang / dbyibs ma gyur na yang pags shun la skyon yod pa'o //
translated: The inborn are those in which the shape is defective or the skin is defective even though the shape is not defective.

original: de la dbyibs gyur pa zhes bya ba ni skye gnas kyis khu chu gzhi bas nas phyir 'dzag pa'am mi 'jib pa'o //
analyzed: de la dbyibs gyur pa zhes bya ba ni skye gnas kyis khu chu gzhi bas nas phyir 'dzag pa'am mi 'jib pa'o //
translated: The shape is defective when the womb is such that the semen is expelled or not drawn in.

original: pags shun gyi skyon zhes bya ba ni rma'i skyon yod pa'i don te /
analyzed: pags shun gyi skyon zhes bya ba ni rma'i skyon yod pa'i don te /
translated: The skin is defective when the womb is like a wound.

original: de na rnam dang chu ser la sogs pa 'dres pa yod na khu chu de rul bar 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½ska ba yod pa zhes bya ba ni de ska bar gyur na yang dang yang du skam par 'gyur bas nal nal por mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: de na rnam dang chu ser la sogs pa 'dres pa yod na khu chu de rul bar 'gyur ro // ska ba yod pa zhes bya ba ni de ska bar gyur na yang dang yang du skam par 'gyur bas nal nal por mi 'jug ste /
translated: If there is a mixture of blood, pus, etc. in the womb, the semen will be spoiled.

original: de'i phyir der khu chu dang khrag zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir der khu chu dang khrag zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The womb is dry when it is dry and rough, and the semen and blood do not remain there because they are repeatedly dried up.

original: de na pha ma gnyis po nyal po byed pa yang med bzhin du zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log tu gyur par ston pa'o //
analyzed: de na pha ma gnyis po nyal po byed pa yang med bzhin du zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log tu gyur par ston pa'o //
translated: â€œThere is no sexual intercourse between the parentsâ€ shows that the conception is mistaken.

original: gal te bud med du 'gyur bar 'dod na ni zhes bya ba ni mngal du dbang po 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa des tha snyad du brjod do //
analyzed: gal te bud med du 'gyur bar 'dod na ni zhes bya ba ni mngal du dbang po 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa des tha snyad du brjod do //
translated: â€œIf it is a girl, she wants to mount from behindâ€ refers to the development of the sexual organs in the womb, which is conventionally called â€œher.â€

original: nyal bar 'dod pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis spyod par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: nyal bar 'dod pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis spyod par 'dod pa'o //
translated: â€œThe desire to lie down arisesâ€ means the desire to engage in sexual intercourse.

original: bud med dang bral bar 'dod pa skye'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bud med dang bral bar 'dod pa skye'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: â€œThe desire to be free from the woman arisesâ€ meansğŸ”½that the man wants to be free from the woman.

original: 'dir bud med ces bya ba ni ma la bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir bud med ces bya ba ni ma la bya'o //
translated: Here, â€œwomanâ€ refers to the mother.

original: snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bar ma do'i srid pa de mi snang bar 'gyur zhing skye ba'i srid pa 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bar ma do'i srid pa de mi snang bar 'gyur zhing skye ba'i srid pa 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: â€œIt should be understood as beforeâ€ means that the intermediate existence disappears and the birth existence is achieved.

original: 'jug pa'i tshe zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i sems la mi bya'i bar ma do'i srid pa na gnas pa nyid kyi sems de la bya ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i tshe zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i sems la mi bya'i bar ma do'i srid pa na gnas pa nyid kyi sems de la bya ste /
translated: â€œAt the time of entryâ€ refers to the mind of birth, not the mind that remains in the intermediate existence.

original: de'i tshe na de ltar shin tu gsal pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe na de ltar shin tu gsal pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time, the mental consciousness is not so clear.

original: 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khu chu dang khrag skye gnas na gnas pa kho na'i khu chu dang khrag gi thigs pa rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis mngal gyi gnas su 'jug pa la bya'o //ğŸ”½de las gzhan pa'i dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po cha phra ba dang 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po med pa'i gong bu snga ma de la 'byung ba @92b chen po gang dag yod pa de las gzhan pa dbang po'i gnas kyi 'byung ba chen po
analyzed: 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khu chu dang khrag skye gnas na gnas pa kho na'i khu chu dang khrag gi thigs pa rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis mngal gyi gnas su 'jug pa la bya'o // de las gzhan pa'i dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po cha phra ba dang 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po med pa'i gong bu snga ma de la 'byung ba @92b chen po gang dag yod pa de las gzhan pa dbang po'i gnas kyi 'byung ba chen po
translated: â€œIt entersâ€ means that the consciousness enters the womb through the power of the drop of semen and blood, which is the embryo.

original: cha phra ba dag dang 'dres pa la bya'o //
analyzed: cha phra ba dag dang 'dres pa la bya'o //
translated: â€œThe subtle parts of the other sense organs, mixed with the great elementsâ€ means that the previous body, which does not have the sense organs, has great elements, and the other sense organs, which are the seats of the sense organs, are mixed with the subtle parts of the great elements.

original: de dang mthun pa'i zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang bcas pa nyid kyang de'i rnam pa yongs su btang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang mthun pa'i zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang bcas pa nyid kyang de'i rnam pa yongs su btang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œIn conformity with thatâ€ means that the body with the sense organs is also the same, except for the form of the sense organs.

original: dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams kyi rten po ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams kyi rten po ste /
translated: The great elements that are the basis of the sense faculties are the great elements that are the support of the forms derived from the great elements, the eyes, etc.

original: tha mi dad par 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa dag go //
analyzed: tha mi dad par 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa dag go //
translated: They are not different from the latter.

original: dbang po'i rten gyi 'byung ba chen po rnams zhes bya ba ni dper na mig gi 'bras bu dkar po'i 'byung ba chen po dag lta bu ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i rten gyi 'byung ba chen po rnams zhes bya ba ni dper na mig gi 'bras bu dkar po'i 'byung ba chen po dag lta bu ste /
translated: The great elements that are the basis of the sense faculties are, for example, the great elements of the white part of the eye.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: The same is true of the other sense faculties, as is appropriate.

original: lus kyi ni gzhan dag gi rten po'i 'byung ba chen po dag ma gtogs par rten gyi 'byung ba chen po dag gud na med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi ni gzhan dag gi rten po'i 'byung ba chen po dag ma gtogs par rten gyi 'byung ba chen po dag gud na med pa kho na yin no //
translated: The great elements that are the basis of the body are not separate from the great elements that are the support of the other sense faculties.

original: gcig la gcig grub pa dang bde bas zhugs pa zhes bya ba na gsus po che'i mdo las mdung khyim gyi dpes bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gcig la gcig grub pa dang bde bas zhugs pa zhes bya ba na gsus po che'i mdo las mdung khyim gyi dpes bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: They are established and function in mutual dependence, as is explained in the MahÄnÄman SÅ«tra by the example of the bundle of reeds.

original: sa bon yongs su tshang ba yin no zhes bya ba ni kha cig na re zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi nus pa yod pa la bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sa bon yongs su tshang ba yin no zhes bya ba ni kha cig na re zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi nus pa yod pa la bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The seeds are complete means that some say that the potency of contaminated and uncontaminated phenomena exists.

original: kha cig na re kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sa bon med de /ğŸ”½'di ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i rkyen gyi sa bon las byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: kha cig na re kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sa bon med de / 'di ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i rkyen gyi sa bon las byung ba yin gyi /
translated: Some say that the seeds of supramundane phenomena do not exist in foundation consciousness.

original: de'i bag chags bsags pa'i sa bon las byung ba ma yin no zhes bstan bcos las 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i bag chags bsags pa'i sa bon las byung ba ma yin no zhes bstan bcos las 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus the Treatise declares that supramundane phenomena arise from the seeds of the condition that focuses on suchness and not from the seeds that accumulate the latent propensities of negative tendencies.

original: de la phyogs snga ma smra ba dag gis lan btab pa /
analyzed: de la phyogs snga ma smra ba dag gis lan btab pa /
translated: The proponents of the former position respond:

original: bstan bcos kyi don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the treatise is this:

original: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i rkyen rnams kyi sa bon brtas par bya ba ni de dag gi rgyu yin gyi gnas ngan len gyi bag chags bsags pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i rkyen rnams kyi sa bon brtas par bya ba ni de dag gi rgyu yin gyi gnas ngan len gyi bag chags bsags pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The seeds of the conditions that focus on suchness are the cause of supramundane phenomena, but they are not the seeds that accumulate the latent propensities of negative tendencies.

original: 'di ltar de ni gnas ngan len gyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni gnas ngan len gyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because this is the context of the seeds of negative reflex actions.

original: rnam par shes pa la zag pa med pa'i sa bon med na ni dang po nyid nas 'di ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs can dang / de dag gi rigs med pa'o zhes rnam par gzhag pa kho na yang mi rigs par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la zag pa med pa'i sa bon med na ni dang po nyid nas 'di ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs can dang / de dag gi rigs med pa'o zhes rnam par gzhag pa kho na yang mi rigs par 'gyur bas /
translated: If consciousness did not have the seeds of the uncontaminated, then it would be impossible to establish that someone belongs to the spiritual lineages of the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and tathagatas, or that someone does not belong to any of these spiritual lineages.

original: de'i phyir zag pa med pa'i chos rnams 'byung ba'i rgyus sa bon gyi rnam grangs kyi rigs yod do //ğŸ”½'bras bu'i @93a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir zag pa med pa'i chos rnams 'byung ba'i rgyus sa bon gyi rnam grangs kyi rigs yod do // 'bras bu'i @93a * //
translated: Therefore, the existence of the spiritual lineage is the cause for the arising of the uncontaminated dharmas.

original: bye brag byang chub rnam gsum yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bye brag byang chub rnam gsum yang med par 'gyur te /
translated: The three kinds of enlightenment would not exist,

original: dmigs pa tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no difference in the result.ğŸ”½What is the point of asserting suchness, since it is the same for all?

original: de bzhin nyid la 'dod pa bzhin byed pa ci zhig yod na 'di ltar gcig la ni nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir nye bar gnas la /ğŸ”½gcig ni shes bya'i sgrib pa spang ba'i phyir nye bar gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la 'dod pa bzhin byed pa ci zhig yod na 'di ltar gcig la ni nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir nye bar gnas la /ğŸ”½gcig ni shes bya'i sgrib pa spang ba'i phyir nye bar gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, it would be the same for all, and there would be no difference in the result.

original: de'i phyir rgyud la gnas pa'i rgyu yod par 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyud la gnas pa'i rgyu yod par 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should accept that the cause exists in the continuum.

original: phyogs gnyis pa smra ba dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa smra ba dag gis smras pa /
translated: Those who speak of a second position say:

original: bstan bcos ni gzhan du drang bar mi nus te /
analyzed: bstan bcos ni gzhan du drang bar mi nus te /
translated: The treatise cannot be interpreted in any other way.

original: gal te gnas ngan len gyi bag chags des sa bon thams cad bsdus pa yin na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sa bon gang yin te /
analyzed: gal te gnas ngan len gyi bag chags des sa bon thams cad bsdus pa yin na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sa bon gang yin te /
translated: If the latent afflictions include all seeds, then what are the seeds that give rise to supramundane qualities?ğŸ”½It is illogical that the cause of those is the seed of the latent afflictions.

original: de dag gi rgyu gnas ngan len gyi sa bon yin par mi rigs so zhes rab tu bsgribs te bstan to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu gnas ngan len gyi sa bon yin par mi rigs so zhes rab tu bsgribs te bstan to zhes zer ro //
translated: The treatise clearly teaches this.

original: rigs rnam par gzhag pa yang de nyid las bstan te /
analyzed: rigs rnam par gzhag pa yang de nyid las bstan te /
translated: Also, the presentation of the types of beings is taught in the same text.ğŸ”½Those whose continua have the seed of the obscurations that are not overcome by the realization of suchness are the type of being who will not attain nirvana.

original: gang dag gi rgyud la de bzhin nyid dmigs pa rtog par mi 'gyur ba gtan du ba'i sgrib pa'i sa bon yod pa de dag ni yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i rigs rgyud la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i sa bon ni med la /
analyzed: gang dag gi rgyud la de bzhin nyid dmigs pa rtog par mi 'gyur ba gtan du ba'i sgrib pa'i sa bon yod pa de dag ni yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i rigs rgyud la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i sa bon ni med la /
translated: Those whose continua have the seed of the afflictive obscurations but not the seed of the obscurations that are not overcome by the realization of suchness are the type of being who will attain nirvana.

original: gtan du ba'i shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sa bon yod pa de dag ni kha cig nyan thos kyi rigs can yin pa dang // kha cig rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can yin par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gtan du ba'i shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sa bon yod pa de dag ni kha cig nyan thos kyi rigs can yin pa dang // kha cig rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can yin par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Those who have the seeds of the obscurations to omniscience are classified as having the lineage of the Å›rÄvaka or having the lineage of the pratyekabuddha.

original: gang dag la de gnyis ka med pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs can yin no zhes 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: gang dag la de gnyis ka med pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs can yin no zhes 'byung ba ste /
translated: Those who have neither are said to have the lineage of the tathÄgata.

original: 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa yang de nyid kyis bstan to //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa yang de nyid kyis bstan to //
translated: The presentation of the result is also taught by that.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: gal te byang chub kyi sa bon med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gal te byang chub kyi sa bon med pa kho na yin no //
translated: If they are those who definitely lack the seed of enlightenment,

original: rnam pa gsum po gang med pas byang chub rnam pa gsum gyi sa bon gang med cing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po gang med pas byang chub rnam pa gsum gyi sa bon gang med cing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can yin zhe na /
translated: what are the three aspects that are absent that are the seeds of the three aspects of enlightenment, and what is the attribute of not attaining nirvana?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa las ni dbang po rnon po la sogs pa ni rgyu yin te nus pa dang rigs yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa las ni dbang po rnon po la sogs pa ni rgyu yin te nus pa dang rigs yin par 'dod do //
translated: The BodhisattvabhÅ«mi explains that those of sharp faculty and so on are causes, since they are asserted to be potential and lineage.

original: dad pa la sogs pa'i sa bon mjug thogs kho nar gnas ngan len zhes bya ba yang med do zhes kyang 'og nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa'i sa bon mjug thogs kho nar gnas ngan len zhes bya ba yang med do zhes kyang 'og nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and the seeds of faith, etc. are not the so-called negative reflex actions.

original: lung ni gcig tu ma nges la rigs pa ni yod de /
analyzed: lung ni gcig tu ma nges la rigs pa ni yod de /
translated: The scriptural passages are not definite, but there is a logical reason.

original: zag pa med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i sa bon las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i sa bon las byung ba yin te /
translated: The pure minds and mental functions arise from the seeds in the consciousness that is retribution,

original: 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i @93b phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i @93b phyir ro ;
translated: because they are associated with the elements.

original: / zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad bzhin te /
analyzed: / zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad bzhin te /
translated: They are like all the impure minds and mental functions.

original: chos mi mthun pa ni nam mkha'o //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa ni nam mkha'o //
translated: The dissimilar example is space.

original: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sa bon yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sa bon yin te /
translated: The objective support of suchness is the seed of the supramundane,

original: lam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the path.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam bzhin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam bzhin te /
translated: It is like the mundane path.

original: chos mi mthun pa ni nam mkha'o //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa ni nam mkha'o //
translated: The dissimilar example is space.

original: ji ltar bkod pa'i bstan bcos ni drang bar mi nus te /
analyzed: ji ltar bkod pa'i bstan bcos ni drang bar mi nus te /
translated: The treatise is not to be interpreted as it is set forth.

original: shin tu gsal bar rgya cher rnam par phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu gsal bar rgya cher rnam par phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is very clear and is extensively differentiated.

original: de'i phyir gnyis ka yang rnam par gzhag tu rung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis ka yang rnam par gzhag tu rung ste /
translated: Therefore, both are suitable to be posited,

original: de bzhin nyid dang bden pa bzhi mngon par rtogs pa rnam par gzhag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang bden pa bzhi mngon par rtogs pa rnam par gzhag pa bzhin no //
translated: like the positing of the four noble truths and the realization of thatness.

original: 'gal ba yang med do //
analyzed: 'gal ba yang med do //
translated: There is also no contradiction,

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa'i mjug tu gtan tshigs smras zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa'i mjug tu gtan tshigs smras zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the reason has already been stated at the end of the five collections of consciousness.

original: kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: Some say:

original: gal te gnyis ka rnam par gzhag na de gnyis las gcig ni drang ba yin la gcig ni gtso bo yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gnyis ka rnam par gzhag na de gnyis las gcig ni drang ba yin la gcig ni gtso bo yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If both are posited, then one of those two is provisional and the other is definitive,

original: dper na bstan pa 'di nyid la bden pa bzhi dag rab tu rgya cher rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams te rnam par gzhag kyang de bzhin nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni bden pa'o zhes gsungs pas na /
analyzed: dper na bstan pa 'di nyid la bden pa bzhi dag rab tu rgya cher rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams te rnam par gzhag kyang de bzhin nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni bden pa'o zhes gsungs pas na /
translated: just as in this teaching, although the four noble truths are extensively posited, the positing of thatness is definitive because it is said, â€œThat is the truth.â€

original: de ni gtso bo yin pa de bzhin du 'di la yang gang gtso bo yin par gang nas gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni gtso bo yin pa de bzhin du 'di la yang gang gtso bo yin par gang nas gsungs te /
translated: Just as the body is primary, so too is the body primary in this case.

original: lung dang rigs pa dag gi skabs kyang yod pas 'di la ni nges par 'byung ba'i thabs med do //
analyzed: lung dang rigs pa dag gi skabs kyang yod pas 'di la ni nges par 'byung ba'i thabs med do //
translated: And since there is also a context for scripture and reasoning, there is no means of escape from this.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i brjod pa'i di ni rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las nges par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i brjod pa'i di ni rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las nges par bya ba'o //
translated: This statement of an absurd consequence should be ascertained from the Compendium of Ascertainments.

original: lus mngon par 'grub pa ci yang rung ste zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: lus mngon par 'grub pa ci yang rung ste zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Any formation of the body refers to those of non-Äryas.

original: de gnyis ka ches rgya che bar 'gyur bas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de gnyis ka ches rgya che bar 'gyur bas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Since both of those are very extensive,

original: ming gi rgya cher 'gyur ba ni skye mched drug gi sgo nas mang du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming gi rgya cher 'gyur ba ni skye mched drug gi sgo nas mang du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the name is very extensive because it occurs in many ways through the six sense bases.

original: lus yongs su rdzogs par gyur gyi bar du skye bar lta'o zhes bya ba ni rdzas yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yongs su bsams pa'o //
analyzed: lus yongs su rdzogs par gyur gyi bar du skye bar lta'o zhes bya ba ni rdzas yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yongs su bsams pa'o //
translated: It is seen to arise until the body is fully formed refers to the fully formed substance.

original: de la sa'i khams rgyur byas nas zhes bya ba ni de yul gnon cing skye ste /
analyzed: de la sa'i khams rgyur byas nas zhes bya ba ni de yul gnon cing skye ste /
translated: The phrase â€œtaking the earth element as its causeâ€ means that it arises by pressing down on that element.

original: de dang nam mkha'i yul gcig pa'i phyir rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams kyi skye ba'i yul gnod pa zhes bya ba skye'o //
analyzed: de dang nam mkha'i yul gcig pa'i phyir rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams kyi skye ba'i yul gnod pa zhes bya ba skye'o //
translated: Because it has the same domain as space, it arises in the domain of the arising of derivative form.

original: 'dzag par mi 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis brtan par byed do zhes bya ba ni mi'i khams kyang 'dzag par byed pa yin pas khyad par du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dzag par mi 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis brtan par byed do zhes bya ba ni mi'i khams kyang 'dzag par byed pa yin pas khyad par du bstan to //
translated: The phrase â€œit stabilizes by not leaking outâ€ indicates that the earth element also causes things to leak out.

original: spros pa la mngon par dga' ba nyid gtso bo'i rgyu yin par lta'o zhes @94a * //
analyzed: spros pa la mngon par dga' ba nyid gtso bo'i rgyu yin par lta'o zhes @94a * //
translated: It is the primary cause of the delight in elaboration.

original: bya ba ni sa bon thams cad pa'i rnam par shes pa ni des bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba ni sa bon thams cad pa'i rnam par shes pa ni des bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The consciousness that contains all the seeds is generated by that delight in elaboration.

original: kha cig na re sa bon nyid rgyu'i rkyen yin pas na las ni bdag po'i rkyen yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re sa bon nyid rgyu'i rkyen yin pas na las ni bdag po'i rkyen yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that karma is the dominant condition because the seed itself is the causal condition.

original: 'phags pa rnams ni sdug bsngal nyid du 'dzin to zhes bya ba ni mngal du zhugs pa dag go //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni sdug bsngal nyid du 'dzin to zhes bya ba ni mngal du zhugs pa dag go //
translated: The phrase â€œthe noble ones consider it to be sufferingâ€ refers to those who have entered the womb.

original: mngal du gnas pa la ni rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kho na yin te /
analyzed: mngal du gnas pa la ni rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kho na yin te /
translated: â€œNaturallyâ€ means by its very nature,

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the store consciousness is associated with it.

original: yul gyi rkyen las gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni yul gyi stobs las byung ba ste /
analyzed: yul gyi rkyen las gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni yul gyi stobs las byung ba ste /
translated: â€œArising from the condition of an objectâ€ means arising from the power of an object,

original: nyon mongs pa can la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as a pleasant object.

original: kha cig na re yul gyi stobs kho na las skyes pa gang yin pa de ni dper na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re yul gyi stobs kho na las skyes pa gang yin pa de ni dper na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that the store consciousness is born from the power of an object, like the supramundane consciousness.

original: gang yul gyi rkyen las gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang yul gyi rkyen las gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: â€œArising from the condition of an objectâ€ meansğŸ”½that the store consciousness arises from the power of an object.

original: ci yul mngon sum du gyur na gdon mi za bar 'byung ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci yul mngon sum du gyur na gdon mi za bar 'byung ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: Does the store consciousness arise when the object is present?

original: de la bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag ni ched 'ga' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so ;
analyzed: de la bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag ni ched 'ga' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so ;
translated: The author of the commentary says, â€œSometimes pleasure and sometimes pain, etc.â€

original: / thog ma med pa'i dus nas yod pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon gyi ngo bo nyid ni grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / thog ma med pa'i dus nas yod pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon gyi ngo bo nyid ni grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œIt exists from beginningless timeâ€ means that the nature of the seed of the instinct for verbal expression is established.

original: sad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yongs su gsos pa'i gnas skabs gzhan thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yongs su gsos pa'i gnas skabs gzhan thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œIt awakensâ€ means that it attains another state of development.

original: 'bras bu spyad zin pa yin te zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i sa bon gyi skad cig dang po kho na la ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu spyad zin pa yin te zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i sa bon gyi skad cig dang po kho na la ste /
translated: â€œThe result has been used upâ€ means that the seed of the eye, etc., is in the very first moment.

original: de'i 'og tu rnam par smin par gyur pa'i sa bon las de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rnam par smin par gyur pa'i sa bon las de 'byung ngo //
translated: After that, it arises from the seed of the result that is to be ripened.

original: lus rang gi sa bon las 'byung bar smras nas /ğŸ”½yongs su rdzogs pa yang rang gi sa bon las 'byung ba kho na yin par /
analyzed: lus rang gi sa bon las 'byung bar smras nas / yongs su rdzogs pa yang rang gi sa bon las 'byung ba kho na yin par /
translated: Having said that the body arises from its own seed,ğŸ”½he shows that the development of the body also arises from its own seed.

original: rang gi sa bon yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: â€œIts own seedâ€ and so on.

original: 'bras bu gzhan skye ba gang yin pa de yang zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan skye ba gang yin pa de yang zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi ste /
translated: â€œThe arising of another resultâ€ means the external result.

original: lus las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œIt is different from the bodyâ€ because it is external to the body.

original: che zad pa ni 'dir sa bon de zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de'o //
analyzed: che zad pa ni 'dir sa bon de zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de'o //
translated: The seed that is exhausted here is that which is to be matured.

original: gang de'i rgyur gyur pa des ni de'i snga rol du 'byung ba'i tshe na 'bras bu spyad zin te /
analyzed: gang de'i rgyur gyur pa des ni de'i snga rol du 'byung ba'i tshe na 'bras bu spyad zin te /
translated: That which is its cause, prior to its arising, has already experienced its result,

original: rnam par smin par gyur pa'i sa bon bskyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin par gyur pa'i sa bon bskyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has already generated the seed that is to be matured.

original: sa bon de yang de nyid kyi sa bon 'dug pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu 'byin par nus pa na'o //ğŸ”½gcig la chags na yang thams cad la chags par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sa bon de yang de nyid kyi sa bon 'dug pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu 'byin par nus pa na'o // gcig la chags na yang thams cad la chags par brjod par bya'o //
translated: And that seed is the seed of that very seed, when it is able to produce a result.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: And when one is attached to one, one should say that one is attached to all.

original: gzugs na spyod pa rang gi lus la chags @94b pa na 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus spangs pa la ji ltar chags par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa rang gi lus la chags @94b pa na 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus spangs pa la ji ltar chags par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one is attached to the body in the form realm, how can one be attached to the body in the desire realm, which has been abandoned?

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i lus ni 'dod pa'i lus kyi sa bon yin te so so'i skye bo'o //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i lus ni 'dod pa'i lus kyi sa bon yin te so so'i skye bo'o //
translated: The body in the form realm is the seed of the body in the desire realm, for ordinary beings.

original: de chags pa na don gyis de'i 'bras bu 'dod pa'i lus la yang chags pa yin no //
analyzed: de chags pa na don gyis de'i 'bras bu 'dod pa'i lus la yang chags pa yin no //
translated: When one is detached from that, one is also detached from the body that is the object of that attachment.

original: yang na rgyur gyur pa'i lus la mngon sum du chags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na rgyur gyur pa'i lus la mngon sum du chags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, one is directly detached from the body that is the cause.

original: gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba na yang thams cad las 'dod chags dang bral bar brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba na yang thams cad las 'dod chags dang bral bar brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: When one is detached from one, one should be said to be detached from all.

original: gal te 'dod pa na spyod pa rang gi lus la 'dod chags dang bral bas khams gsum pa'i las la yang 'dod chags dang bral ba yin na ;
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa na spyod pa rang gi lus la 'dod chags dang bral bas khams gsum pa'i las la yang 'dod chags dang bral ba yin na ;
translated: If one is detached from the body that is in the realm of desire, one is also detached from the karma of the three realms.

original: ci'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir rtsom par byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir rtsom par byed ce na /
translated: Why does one practice in order to become detached from the attachment of the form and formless realms?

original: rgyur gyur pa'i lus la 'dod chags dang bral ba yang 'bras bur gyur pa'i spang ba'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral bar rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa'i lus la 'dod chags dang bral ba yang 'bras bur gyur pa'i spang ba'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral bar rtsom par byed do //
translated: One practices in order to become detached from the body that is the cause, in order to abandon the body that is the result.

original: yang na smras ma thag pa thams cad las 'dod chags dang bral lo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na smras ma thag pa thams cad las 'dod chags dang bral lo zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, it is said that one is free from attachment to all that has just been mentioned.

original: kha cig na re ji ltar 'di'i 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba kho na dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re ji ltar 'di'i 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba kho na dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: It is just like being free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: sa bon nyon mongs pa'i phyogs gang yin pa de dag ni zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa 'khor dang bcas pa dag gi sa bon yin no //
analyzed: sa bon nyon mongs pa'i phyogs gang yin pa de dag ni zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa 'khor dang bcas pa dag gi sa bon yin no //
translated: Those seeds that are on the side of the afflictions are the seeds of the afflictions along with their retinue.

original: gnas ngan len zhes bya ba yang med do zhes bya ba ni las su mi rung ba'i don gyi gnas ngan len med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas ngan len zhes bya ba yang med do zhes bya ba ni las su mi rung ba'i don gyi gnas ngan len med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And there is no negative reflex action means that there is no negative reflex action that is the meaning of unserviceability.

original: de'i phyir / 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is like this and so on.

original: sa bon rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las /
analyzed: sa bon rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las /
translated: In the Compendium of Ascertainments on Seeds,

original: sa bon thams cad ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod pa'i gnas ngan len yin no zhes 'byung ba ni dge ba'i chos kyi sa bon ni gnas ngan len dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod pa'i gnas ngan len yin no zhes 'byung ba ni dge ba'i chos kyi sa bon ni gnas ngan len dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is said that all seeds are negative reflex actions that exist in the foundation consciousness because the seeds of virtuous phenomena possess negative reflex actions.

original: las gzhan pa dag ni gnas ngan len gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las gzhan pa dag ni gnas ngan len gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the other actions have the nature of negative reflex actions.

original: rang bzhin shes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid yin pa la bya ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin shes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid yin pa la bya ste /
translated: The term â€œnatureâ€ should be understood as â€œessence,â€

original: bag zan gyi rtag bzhin zhes ston to //
analyzed: bag zan gyi rtag bzhin zhes ston to //
translated: like the term â€œcow-nature.â€

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di skad du gang gi phyir ji skad smos pa'i mtshan nyid kyis lus mtha' dag la gnas ngan len med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal nyid mi 'byung bas /ğŸ”½de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni dad pa la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas par bsdu ba'i phyir 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal du @95a * //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di skad du gang gi phyir ji skad smos pa'i mtshan nyid kyis lus mtha' dag la gnas ngan len med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal nyid mi 'byung bas / de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni dad pa la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas par bsdu ba'i phyir 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal du @95a * //
translated: Therefore, etc. means that because the entire body is devoid of negative reflex action, as has been explained, suffering does not arise.

original: 'dogs par mdzad do //
analyzed: 'dogs par mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, the TathÄgatas designate the conditioned as suffering by the suffering of the conditioned, in order to include such things as faith, which are associated with the outflows.

original: zag pa med pa rnams ni nam yang de'i rjes su mi 'gro bas de dag la thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams ni nam yang de'i rjes su mi 'gro bas de dag la thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The uncontaminated never follow that, so the consequence does not apply to them.

original: gzhan gyis bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bskyed pa'am /
translated: generated by another,

original: rang dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'dzin pas na khams so //
analyzed: rang dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'dzin pas na khams so //
translated: The realm is so called because it holds the result that is in accordance with itself.

original: de las byung bas don gyis rigs gzhan dang 'dra bas na rigs so //
analyzed: de las byung bas don gyis rigs gzhan dang 'dra bas na rigs so //
translated: The lineage is so called because it is similar to the other lineages that arise from it.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa na rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa na rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature is so called because it is established by its own nature.

original: byed rgyu'i dngos por 'jug cing 'gro bas na rgyu'o //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i dngos por 'jug cing 'gro bas na rgyu'o //
translated: The cause is so called because it is engaged in the state of being a cause and it goes.

original: 'jig pa'i bdag nyid kyi tshogs yin pas na 'jig tshogs so //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i bdag nyid kyi tshogs yin pas na 'jig tshogs so //
translated: The perishable collection is so called because it is a collection that has the nature of destruction.

original: 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can gyi phung po de dag ni sa bon zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can gyi phung po de dag ni sa bon zhes bya ste /
translated: Those aggregates that have the nature of destruction are called seeds.

original: ji skad du rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las kyang sa bon ni 'du byed rnams la so so so sor dbye zhing gzhan du rnam par gzhag par mi nus mod kyi /
analyzed: ji skad du rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las kyang sa bon ni 'du byed rnams la so so so sor dbye zhing gzhan du rnam par gzhag par mi nus mod kyi /
translated: As the Compendium of Ascertainments observes, â€œSeeds cannot be distinguished and posited as separate from the formations.

original: 'on kyang de ltar byung ba'i 'du byed de dag kho na la sa bon zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ltar byung ba'i 'du byed de dag kho na la sa bon zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: However, those very formations that arise in that way are called seeds.â€

original: spro bar bya ba dang spro bar byed pas na spros pa ste /
analyzed: spro bar bya ba dang spro bar byed pas na spros pa ste /
translated: Elaboration is so called because it elaborates and it causes elaboration.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin par gyur pa'i skye mched kyi khams rnams so //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin par gyur pa'i skye mched kyi khams rnams so //
translated: The elements of the sense-sources which are the apprehended object and the apprehending subject.

original: de dag nyid sa bon yin te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag nyid sa bon yin te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: They are seeds, as above.

original: rgyud dang 'brel pa'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni kun gzhi zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyud dang 'brel pa'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni kun gzhi zhes bya ste /
translated: The store-consciousness is called the store because it is connected with the stream.

original: ji skad du 'di ltar de ni lus de la 'brel zhing rab tu 'brel ba na kun gzhi zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du 'di ltar de ni lus de la 'brel zhing rab tu 'brel ba na kun gzhi zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: As has been stated: â€œIn this way, it is called the store because it is connected with and related to that body.â€

original: sa bon du gyur pa de nyid 'bras bu len par byed pa'i phyir len pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon du gyur pa de nyid 'bras bu len par byed pa'i phyir len pa'o //
translated: It is the appropriating because that which is the seed is the appropriator of the result.

original: 'bras bur gyur na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba yin no //
translated: When it is the result, it is suffering because of the suffering of the formative forces.

original: yang na de las byung ba'i chos rnams sdug bsngal ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na de las byung ba'i chos rnams sdug bsngal ba yin no //
translated: Alternatively, the dharmas that originate from it are suffering.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir de dag gi gnas yin no //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir de dag gi gnas yin no //
translated: It is the basis of these two because it is the objective support of the false view of individuality and of the pride that thinks â€˜I amâ€™.

original: rnam grangs de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa yang ngo bo nyid bstan pa dang / bye brag bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa yang ngo bo nyid bstan pa dang / bye brag bstan pa'o //
translated: The presentation of these synonyms is in terms of their nature and their varieties.

original: ngo bo nyid ni rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / rang gi ngo bo dang / las kyis bstan to //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / rang gi ngo bo dang / las kyis bstan to //
translated: Their nature is shown in terms of cause, result, essence, and activity.

original: bye brag ni blang bar bya ba dang / len par byed pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bye brag ni blang bar bya ba dang / len par byed pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Their varieties are shown in terms of the two types of appropriator and the appropriated.

original: blang bar bya ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: blang bar bya ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams so //
translated: The appropriated is the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: len par byed pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: len par byed pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The appropriator is the store consciousness.

original: de yang ngo bo nyid dang rgyu dang 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: de yang ngo bo nyid dang rgyu dang 'bras bu ste /
translated: It is also shown in terms of its nature, cause, and result.

original: rnam grangs gcig dang gcig dang gsum gyis bstan to //
analyzed: rnam grangs gcig dang gcig dang gsum gyis bstan to //
translated: It is shown in terms of one synonym, one, and three.

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni zhes bya ba ni bag chags dang byed rgyu la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni zhes bya ba ni bag chags dang byed rgyu la sogs pa dag go //
translated: â€œSuch as theseâ€ refers to residual impressions, causal conditions, and so on.

original: @95b rkyen rnams dang mi ldan par byed cing zhes grogs nyams pas na yod kyang mthu med pa'i phyir phyi mar 'bras bu 'byin par 'gyur ba'i nus pa med pa la bya'o //
analyzed: @95b rkyen rnams dang mi ldan par byed cing zhes grogs nyams pas na yod kyang mthu med pa'i phyir phyi mar 'bras bu 'byin par 'gyur ba'i nus pa med pa la bya'o //

translated: means that the internal conditions, such as the eye, are not carried off by objects of mind and mental factors.ğŸ”½The SÅ«tra on Entering the Womb states:

original: mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo las zhes bya ba ni dga' bo de la bu de ni zhag bdun pa dang po la ma'i mngal du mer mer por 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo las zhes bya ba ni dga' bo de la bu de ni zhag bdun pa dang po la ma'i mngal du mer mer por 'gyur te /
translated: â€œ Nanda, in the motherâ€™s womb, during the first week the embryo is called kalala.

original: mer mer po'i ngo bo nyid kyang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mer mer po'i ngo bo nyid kyang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of the kalala?ğŸ”½It is like a drop of sour gruel or cream of curds.â€

original: 'di lta ste dper na 'bras khu'am zho ga chu lta bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo sde las rab tu mang du gsungs pa rnams mdor bsdus te brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na 'bras khu'am zho ga chu lta bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo sde las rab tu mang du gsungs pa rnams mdor bsdus te brjod par bya'o //

original: de la zhag bdun pa rnams ni go rims bzhin du mer mer po dang nur nur po dang ltar ltar po dang mkhrang gyur dang yan lag 'bur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la zhag bdun pa rnams ni go rims bzhin du mer mer po dang nur nur po dang ltar ltar po dang mkhrang gyur dang yan lag 'bur bar 'gyur ro //

original: de nas bzhis ni rkang lag 'gyus pa dang / mkhregs pa dang / bu gu dgu dang / nang grol rnams dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / chu rgyus rnams dang / mig la sogs pa 'byung ngo //

analyzed: gzhan drug gis ni mig la sogs pa'i gnas rnam par 'byed pa dang / dang ba dang / gsal ba dang / mig la sogs pa bzhi po dag rim gyis 'thob par 'gyur ro ;

analyzed: de nas zhag bzhi lon na bca' bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni der zla ba dgu tshang pa'i phyir te /

original: phal che bas de skad bstan to //
analyzed: phal che bas de skad bstan to //

analyzed: skyes pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni ming dang gzugs skyes pa ni dbang po yongs su smin pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa la bya'o //
translated: The cause of birth refers to the cause of the birth of name-and-form, which is the cause that conforms with the maturation of the faculties.

analyzed: gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba ni pha dang ma dag las gzhan pa dag go //
translated: Others refers to those other than the father and mother.

original: smra ba'i tha snyad dag slob tu 'jug ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: smra ba'i tha snyad dag slob tu 'jug ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: They cause them to learn the conventions of speech.

original: ci'i phyir lus kyi las bor te ngag gi las kho na bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lus kyi las bor te ngag gi las kho na bstan zhe na /
translated: Why is it that, having omitted bodily action, only verbal action is taught?

original: kha cig na re lus kyi las ni gdon mi za bar bslab par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re lus kyi las ni gdon mi za bar bslab par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
