original: yang kha cig na re tha snyad ces bya ba'i sgra ni spyi la snyegs pas brtsad du med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang kha cig na re tha snyad ces bya ba'i sgra ni spyi la snyegs pas brtsad du med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The term â€œconventionâ€ is applied to the general, so there is no dispute.

original: de bas na 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa sgo gnyis kyis ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba gdags te bstan te /
analyzed: de bas na 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa sgo gnyis kyis ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba gdags te bstan te /
translated: Therefore, it is taught that the designation of the view of the transitory collection is by way of two doors, as stated in the lines: â€œIt is taught that the view of the transitory collection is twofold:

original: gang na yang zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnams dang yul dang dus na'o //
analyzed: gang na yang zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnams dang yul dang dus na'o //
translated: In any place means in the realms, directions, and times.

original: su yang zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang bud med dang de las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: su yang zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang bud med dang de las gzhan pa'o //
translated: â€œAnyoneâ€ refers to men, women, and those of other genders.

original: ci yang med do zhes bya ba ni bu'am phu nu'o //
analyzed: ci yang med do zhes bya ba ni bu'am phu nu'o //
translated: â€œNothing at allâ€ refers to sons and daughters.

original: bdag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said about â€œmyselfâ€ and so on.

original: shin tu rtogs par dka' ste zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi ste /
analyzed: shin tu rtogs par dka' ste zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi ste /
translated: â€œVery difficult to understandâ€ means for the world.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa la shin tu goms pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½sems can rnams kyi 'jig pa dang 'chags par 'gyur ba'i las kyis 'gyur te zhes bya ba la 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan du med pa yin pa'i phyir zhig pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin na /ğŸ”½ji ltar las kyi rgyu las byung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa la shin tu goms pa'i phyir ro // sems can rnams kyi 'jig pa dang 'chags par 'gyur ba'i las kyis 'gyur te zhes bya ba la 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan du med pa yin pa'i phyir zhig pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin na / ji ltar las kyi rgyu las byung ba yin zhe na /
translated: Because of the strong habit of grasping a self.ğŸ”½â€œThe world is destroyed and formed by the karma of sentient beingsâ€ means that the world is destroyed by the karma of sentient beings.ğŸ”½If the world is destroyed by the karma of sentient beings, how can it be said that the world is destroyed by fire and so on?

original: dper na ma byin par len pa las longs spyod med par 'gyur ba bzhin du de dang mi mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dper na ma byin par len pa las longs spyod med par 'gyur ba bzhin du de dang mi mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the world is destroyed by the karma of sentient beings, it is said that the world is destroyed by fire and so on.

original: nang gi @96b rnams zhes bya ba sa chos mi mthun pa'i dpes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang gi @96b rnams zhes bya ba sa chos mi mthun pa'i dpes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The inner ones are taught by the example of the earth and its properties, which are not in agreement.

original: tshe zad par 'gyur ba lta bus ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni tshe nyid med pas na zad pa yang med de /
analyzed: tshe zad par 'gyur ba lta bus ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni tshe nyid med pas na zad pa yang med de /
translated: It is not like the exhaustion of life, because life itself does not exist, and therefore its exhaustion does not exist.

original: de ni dam bca' ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni dam bca' ba yin no //
translated: This is the thesis.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: It is because of this, etc. is the reason.

original: de'i phyir phyi rol la srog yod par smra ba dag gi phyir de dag la tshe zad pas 'chi ba med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol la srog yod par smra ba dag gi phyir de dag la tshe zad pas 'chi ba med de /
translated: Therefore, for those who say that external things have life, there is no death due to the exhaustion of life.

original: sems can gyi chos su grags pa med pa'i phyir te nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi chos su grags pa med pa'i phyir te nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: Because they are not known as the properties of sentient beings, like space.

original: chos mi mthun pa ni mi lta bu'o zhes de dag gi sgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa ni mi lta bu'o zhes de dag gi sgrub pa bstan to //
translated: The example of a human is the dissimilar case. This is the teaching of their proof.

original: sems can gyi chos su grags pa med pa rnam par dbye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can gyi chos su grags pa med pa rnam par dbye ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to analyze what is not known as the properties of sentient beings,

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams ni gzugs can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams ni gzugs can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said that external things are material, etc.

original: gzugs can gyi dngos po kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs can gyi dngos po kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are only material things.

original: gzhan dag la yang de bzhin sems can las bzlog pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang de bzhin sems can las bzlog pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the other realms, with the exception of sentient beings.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni las sna tshogs mngon par 'du byed pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni las sna tshogs mngon par 'du byed pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: For they are the creators of various actions.

analyzed: yid las byung ba yin te zhes bya ba ni yid tsam las nges par byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: de ltar thams cad mdo nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ma tshang ba med pa dang dbang po dman pa ma yin pa dang mdzes pa la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad mdo nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ma tshang ba med pa dang dbang po dman pa ma yin pa dang mdzes pa la sogs pa dag go //
translated: Thus, it is as stated in the sutra.

original: mdo las ji skad 'byung ba kho na bzhin du rgyas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas 'jog pa'i steng chus gcig tu khyab par gyur pa la rlung gis spris mar byas pa de ni sa'i bcud kha dog la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa yin te /ğŸ”½kha dog ni 'di lta ste dper na mar sar lta bu'o //
analyzed: mdo las ji skad 'byung ba kho na bzhin du rgyas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas 'jog pa'i steng chus gcig tu khyab par gyur pa la rlung gis spris mar byas pa de ni sa'i bcud kha dog la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa yin te / kha dog ni 'di lta ste dper na mar sar lta bu'o //
translated: The sutra should be expanded in the same way as it is stated, namely, that the water element becomes completely filled with earth, and the wind element churns it into cream, which is the essence of the earth element, perfect in color, taste, and so on.ğŸ”½Its color is like that of clarified butter.

original: ro ni 'di lta ste dper na sbrang ma'i sbrang rtsi ma bskol ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ro ni 'di lta ste dper na sbrang ma'i sbrang rtsi ma bskol ba lta bu'o //
translated: Its taste is like that of uncontaminated honey.

original: de nas dus gzhan zhig na sems can brkam pa'i rang bzhin can zhig gis de sor mo'i rtse mos myangs te zos nas gzhan du yang de bzhin du byed do //
analyzed: de nas dus gzhan zhig na sems can brkam pa'i rang bzhin can zhig gis de sor mo'i rtse mos myangs te zos nas gzhan du yang de bzhin du byed do //
translated: Then, at another time, a being of greedy nature tasted it with the tip of his finger and ate it, and other beings did likewise.

original: de nas de dag gi lus sra pa dang phyi bar gyur nas kha dog kyang yal lo //
analyzed: de nas de dag gi lus sra pa dang phyi bar gyur nas kha dog kyang yal lo //
translated: Then their bodies became hard and rough, and their complexions faded.

original: sa'i bcud de yang med par gyur to //
analyzed: sa'i bcud de yang med par gyur to //
translated: The essence of the earth disappeared.

original: de bzhin du sa'i zhag la sogs pa yang byung nas med par gyur to zhes gsungs @98b pa dag kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa'i zhag la sogs pa yang byung nas med par gyur to zhes gsungs @98b pa dag kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the essence of the water of the earth, etc., appeared and disappeared.

original: de'i 'og tu phan tshun mig gis mig tshugs su blta'o zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig mngon sum du rtog cing mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu phan tshun mig gis mig tshugs su blta'o zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig mngon sum du rtog cing mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Then they looked at each other with eyes of desire, which is to say, they conceived of each other and grasped their characteristics.

original: de'i 'og tu gnyis kyi sa gnyis sprod pas nyal bo byed do zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang bud med gnyis kyi dbang po gnyis sprod cing gcig tu sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gnyis kyi sa gnyis sprod pas nyal bo byed do zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang bud med gnyis kyi dbang po gnyis sprod cing gcig tu sbyor ba'o //
translated: Then, by the union of two organs in two people, sexual union was born, which is to say, the union of the male and female organs, the union of one with the other.

original: gzhan yang mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du bram ze dang rje'i rigs dang dmangs rigs kyi rgyu rnams 'jig rten du 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni gnas 'jig de nas sems can da dag kha cig gis yongs su 'dzin pa de ni nad do //ğŸ”½yongs su 'dzin pa ni 'bras so //
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du bram ze dang rje'i rigs dang dmangs rigs kyi rgyu rnams 'jig rten du 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni gnas 'jig de nas sems can da dag kha cig gis yongs su 'dzin pa de ni nad do // yongs su 'dzin pa ni 'bras so //
translated: The appropriation of a body is a boil.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i zug rngu'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i zug rngu'o //
translated: The appropriation of a body is a thorn.ğŸ”½The appropriation of a body is the root of suffering.â€

original: yongs su 'dzin pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rtsa ba'o zhes bya bar rig nas dgon pa'i gnas su dong zhing //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rtsa ba'o zhes bya bar rig nas dgon pa'i gnas su dong zhing //
translated: Having understood this, they go to a solitary place.

original: spyil po dang lo ma'i spyil bu dag byas te 'khod nas /ğŸ”½de dag nub mo'i zan 'dod na ni dgongs kar zas kyi phyir grong du 'jug go //
analyzed: spyil po dang lo ma'i spyil bu dag byas te 'khod nas / de dag nub mo'i zan 'dod na ni dgongs kar zas kyi phyir grong du 'jug go //
translated: They build huts and leaf-huts and live there.ğŸ”½If they want food for the evening meal, they enter the village for alms in the evening.

original: dro ka'i zan 'dod na ni snga dro zas kyi phyir grong du 'jug go //
analyzed: dro ka'i zan 'dod na ni snga dro zas kyi phyir grong du 'jug go //
translated: If they want food for the morning meal, they enter the village for alms in the morning.

original: de nas sems can de dag kha cig gis bsam gtan de dang rab tu dben pa de dag mngon par ma rtogs nas phyogs gcig tu dong ste /
analyzed: de nas sems can de dag kha cig gis bsam gtan de dang rab tu dben pa de dag mngon par ma rtogs nas phyogs gcig tu dong ste /
translated: Then, some of those sentient beings, not understanding that concentration and that seclusion, went to one side.

original: spyil po dang lo ma'i spyil bu dag tu 'khod nas 'dir bdag cag gis gsang sngags kyi gzhung dag bya'o //
analyzed: spyil po dang lo ma'i spyil bu dag tu 'khod nas 'dir bdag cag gis gsang sngags kyi gzhung dag bya'o //
translated: They built huts and leaf-huts, and said, â€œHere we will compose the texts of the secret mantra.

original: rig byed dag sbyar bar bya'o zhes de dag de nas gsang sngags kyi gzhung dag byed cing rig byed dag sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: rig byed dag sbyar bar bya'o zhes de dag de nas gsang sngags kyi gzhung dag byed cing rig byed dag sbyor bar byed do //
translated: We will compose the Vedas.â€ They composed the texts of the secret mantra and composed the Vedas.

original: de nas sems can de dag kha cig gis bsam gtan de dang / rab tu dben pa de dang / gsang sngags kyi gzhung de dang / rig byed sbyar ba de dag mngon par ma rtogs nas yang dgon pa nas phyir grong du zhugs te khyim sgo bzhi pa dag byas te 'khod nas 'dir bdag cag gis sbyin bdag sbyin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya char bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sems can de dag kha cig gis bsam gtan de dang / rab tu dben pa de dang / gsang sngags kyi gzhung de dang / rig byed sbyar ba de dag mngon par ma rtogs nas yang dgon pa nas phyir grong du zhugs te khyim sgo bzhi pa dag byas te 'khod nas 'dir bdag cag gis sbyin bdag sbyin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya char bya'o //
translated: Then, some of those sentient beings, not understanding that concentration, that seclusion, those texts of the secret mantra, and the composition of the Vedas, again left the forest and entered the villages. They built four-doored houses and lived there, saying, â€œHere we will be the givers of gifts.â€ And so on at length.

original: de na 'di dag ni grong nas dgon par brten pas na phyi rol yod do zhes brjod pas bram ze zhes bya ba'i ming byung ngo //
analyzed: de na 'di dag ni grong nas dgon par brten pas na phyi rol yod do zhes brjod pas bram ze zhes bya ba'i ming byung ngo //
translated: Since they lived in the forest, they were called Brahmins.ğŸ”½Since they did not practice meditation, they were called reciters.

original: yang 'di dag ni bsam gtan mi byed pas ni tshig 'don pa'o zhes bya ba dang / grong la brten pas na grong mi zhes bya bar grags te /
analyzed: yang 'di dag ni bsam gtan mi byed pas ni tshig 'don pa'o zhes bya ba dang / grong la brten pas na grong mi zhes bya bar grags te /
translated: Since they lived in the village, they were called village people.

original: gnas 'jog sngon bram ze'i rigs ni de ltar 'jig rten du byung ste /
analyzed: gnas 'jog sngon bram ze'i rigs ni de ltar 'jig rten du byung ste /
translated: Thus the Brahmin caste arose in the world.

original: gzhan dag kyang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa dang sbyar ro //ğŸ”½de gnyis las kyang zla ba'i dkyil @99a * //ğŸ”½'khor ni ches mgyogs par 'gro ba dang zhes bya ba ni nyi ma ni zla ba gcig gas khyim las 'da'/
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa dang sbyar ro // de gnyis las kyang zla ba'i dkyil @99a * // 'khor ni ches mgyogs par 'gro ba dang zhes bya ba ni nyi ma ni zla ba gcig gas khyim las 'da'/
translated: The other castes arose in the same way.ğŸ”½The moon moves faster than the sunğŸ”½because the moon moves through one sign in a day and night,

original: zla ba ni nyin zhag gnyis dang nyin zhag gi bzhi cha gcig gis khyim las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½yang 'gros bsnan pa las bsam pa yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: zla ba ni nyin zhag gnyis dang nyin zhag gi bzhi cha gcig gis khyim las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½yang 'gros bsnan pa las bsam pa yin no zhes zer na /
translated: while the sun moves through one sign in a month.ğŸ”½If you add the movement of the sun and moon, the result is the movement of the stars.

original: 'gros phrin yang nyi ma bas mgyogs par 'gro ba kho na yin pas de'i bsam pa ni don med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gros phrin yang nyi ma bas mgyogs par 'gro ba kho na yin pas de'i bsam pa ni don med pa yin no //
translated: The sun moves faster than the wind, so this idea is pointless.

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyis ni gling gnyis cig car snang bar byed la zhes bya ba ni khams gsum du yang snang mod kyi bya ba byed pa'i phyir de skad smos so //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyis ni gling gnyis cig car snang bar byed la zhes bya ba ni khams gsum du yang snang mod kyi bya ba byed pa'i phyir de skad smos so //
translated: The sunâ€™s disk illuminates two continents simultaneously, but it is said this way because it is active in the three realms.

original: yang na mthar gyis nub pa'i cha gang yin pa de bzhin du yang shar bar zad kyi cha nyid gsum char snang ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na mthar gyis nub pa'i cha gang yin pa de bzhin du yang shar bar zad kyi cha nyid gsum char snang ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Or, the sun sets in one part of JambudvÄ«pa and rises in another part, but it does not illuminate all three parts.

original: de bas na gcig tu nyi ma phyed la zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe nyin zhag mnyam pa de'i tshe de ltar bgrang gi gzhan na ni cha gzhan yod par lta'o //
analyzed: de bas na gcig tu nyi ma phyed la zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe nyin zhag mnyam pa de'i tshe de ltar bgrang gi gzhan na ni cha gzhan yod par lta'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the sun is at the meridian at one time, but at other times it is calculated to be in other parts.

original: de dag gang gi tshe ri rab las thag ring du rgyu ba de'i tshe ni dgun du mngon no zhes bya ba ni 'dzam bu'i gling nas lho phyogs logs su ring du song ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag gang gi tshe ri rab las thag ring du rgyu ba de'i tshe ni dgun du mngon no zhes bya ba ni 'dzam bu'i gling nas lho phyogs logs su ring du song ba'i phyir te /
translated: When the sun moves far from Meru, it is winter.

original: de bas na rgyang ring ba'i phyir tsha ba yang med la grib ma yang byang phyogs logs su gzhol zhing ma bsgribs kyang myur du mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na rgyang ring ba'i phyir tsha ba yang med la grib ma yang byang phyogs logs su gzhol zhing ma bsgribs kyang myur du mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since it is far away, it is not hot and its shadow does not appear quickly, even though it is not blocked and inclines to the north.

original: gang gi tshe nyi bar rgyu ba de'i tshe ni tsha ba'i dus su mngon no zhes bya ba ni gling 'dir nye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyi bar rgyu ba de'i tshe ni tsha ba'i dus su mngon no zhes bya ba ni gling 'dir nye ba'i phyir te /
translated: When the sun moves, it appears at the time of heat because it is close to this continent.

original: de bas na tsha zhing nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor yang yun ring du snang ngo //
analyzed: de bas na tsha zhing nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor yang yun ring du snang ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is hot and the sunâ€™s mandala appears for a long time.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni yid tsam gyis steng du 'dzur bas na zla gam du snang ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni yid tsam gyis steng du 'dzur bas na zla gam du snang ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The moonâ€™s mandala appears like a half moon because it is slightly inclined above.

original: gal te zla ba'i 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba de lta bur snang ba yin na ci'i phyir 'phro steng rol na gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te zla ba'i 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba de lta bur snang ba yin na ci'i phyir 'phro steng rol na gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: If the moonâ€™s mandala appears as if it were connected in that way, why does it appear to be above?

original: de lta bas na de'i grib mas bsgribs pa kho na yin no zhes bye brag tu smra ba rnams zer ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i grib mas bsgribs pa kho na yin no zhes bye brag tu smra ba rnams zer ro //
translated: Therefore the VaibhÄá¹£ikas say that it is obscured by its own shadow.

original: gal te zla ba shas chung ba'i tshe na grib mas bsgribs pa'i phyir 'phro steng rol nas snang ba yin na tshes brgyad la sogs pa dag la yang ci'i phyir mi snang ste /
analyzed: gal te zla ba shas chung ba'i tshe na grib mas bsgribs pa'i phyir 'phro steng rol nas snang ba yin na tshes brgyad la sogs pa dag la yang ci'i phyir mi snang ste /
translated: If the moon is partially covered by the sun, the shadow of the earth would appear on the moon. But why does it not appear on the eighth and twenty-third days of the lunar month?

original: 'di la snang ba'i gzugs kyi rdzas rnams ni ji lta bu'i dbyibs kyis kyang gnas par snang ste /
analyzed: 'di la snang ba'i gzugs kyi rdzas rnams ni ji lta bu'i dbyibs kyis kyang gnas par snang ste /
translated: The substance of the form that appears there is arranged in such a way that it appears as a house, etc.

original: dper na khyim pa la sogs pa yod pa de bzhin du de la yang yod do //
analyzed: dper na khyim pa la sogs pa yod pa de bzhin du de la yang yod do //
translated: Just as a house, etc. exists here, so it exists there.

original: rus sbal la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni mdo sde las ri bong gi gzugs brnyan dang de las gzhan pa dag yod do @99b zhes gsungs pa yang bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: rus sbal la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni mdo sde las ri bong gi gzugs brnyan dang de las gzhan pa dag yod do @99b zhes gsungs pa yang bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The words â€œtortoise, etc.â€ include the statement in the sutra that the reflection of a rabbit and other things exist.

original: de'i 'og tu sems can gang yang rung ba zhig ces bya ba ni mthun par 'jug pa'i tshul las dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems can gang yang rung ba zhig ces bya ba ni mthun par 'jug pa'i tshul las dgongs pa'o //
translated: The words â€œany sentient beingâ€ refer to the point of view of one who is in agreement with the sutra.

original: mdo sde dag las ni byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mdo sde dag las ni byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The sutra itself says that it is a bodhisattva.

original: kha cig na re lha yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re lha yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that it is a god.

original: de'i 'og tu sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma rnams ni sprul pa lta bur 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sems can ma yin par sems can dag lta bur snang ba la bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma rnams ni sprul pa lta bur 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sems can ma yin par sems can dag lta bur snang ba la bya'o //
translated: Then, the guardians of the hells appear like emanations. This refers to what is not a sentient being appearing like a sentient being.

original: chu'i rgyun la rgyun 'chad pa med cing zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: chu'i rgyun la rgyun 'chad pa med cing zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: The stream of water is uninterrupted means it is continuous.

original: bar mtshams med par 'bar ba zhes bya ba ni rgyun gzhan dang yul gyi go skabs ring po med de rgyun gcig kho na bzhin du bar 'tshams med pa la bya'o //
analyzed: bar mtshams med par 'bar ba zhes bya ba ni rgyun gzhan dang yul gyi go skabs ring po med de rgyun gcig kho na bzhin du bar 'tshams med pa la bya'o //
translated: Blazing without interruption means that there is no other stream or interval of space, as it is like a single stream without interruption.

original: de na sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig ces bya ste bya ba ni gang du de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de na sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig ces bya ste bya ba ni gang du de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba ste /
translated: There, one buddha field is mentioned, where a Tathagata appears.

original: de'i phyir mnyam du 'byung zhing 'jig pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni bya ba gcig pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mnyam du 'byung zhing 'jig pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni bya ba gcig pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, all those that arise and perish together are called one buddha field because they have the same function.

original: de nyi tsher sems can gyi don mdzad par ma zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyi tsher sems can gyi don mdzad par ma zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not benefit sentient beings only in that way.

original: der de bzhin gshegs pa byung nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang smos so //
analyzed: der de bzhin gshegs pa byung nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang smos so //
translated: and the Tathagata appeared there.

original: 'dod pa la longs spyod pa bcu ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa la longs spyod pa bcu ste /
translated: There are ten types of sensualists,ğŸ”½and they are as described in the Ksudraka Collection.

original: de dag kyang lung bar ma las 'byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mgon med zas sbyin las brtsams nas khyim pa dag 'dod pa la longs spyod pa ni bcu po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang lung bar ma las 'byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mgon med zas sbyin las brtsams nas khyim pa dag 'dod pa la longs spyod pa ni bcu po 'di dag yin te /
translated: The householder Anathapindika said:

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: â€œThere are ten types of sensualists.

original: khyim bdag 'di na 'dod pa la longs spyod pa kha cig chos ma yin pas bab col du longs spyod pa dag sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: khyim bdag 'di na 'dod pa la longs spyod pa kha cig chos ma yin pas bab col du longs spyod pa dag sgrub par byed de /
translated: Householder, some sensualists here are sensualists who indulge in sensual pleasures through improper and unrighteous means.

original: de chos ma yin pas longs spyod pa dag bsgrubs nas kyang bdag kyang legs par bde bar tshim par mi byed la /
analyzed: de chos ma yin pas longs spyod pa dag bsgrubs nas kyang bdag kyang legs par bde bar tshim par mi byed la /
translated: Having indulged in sensual pleasures through improper and unrighteous means, they do not satisfy their own desires,

original: pha ma la yang ma yin /
analyzed: pha ma la yang ma yin /
translated: nor do they satisfy the desires of their parents,

original: bu dang chung ma dang bran dang bran mo dang las byed pa dang zho shas 'tsho ba rnams la yang ma yin /
analyzed: bu dang chung ma dang bran dang bran mo dang las byed pa dang zho shas 'tsho ba rnams la yang ma yin /
translated: nor do they satisfy the desires of their children, spouse, male and female servants, workers, and hired persons,ğŸ”½nor do they satisfy the desires of their friends and companions,

original: mdza' bshes dang nye du dang blon po dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams la yang ma yin /
analyzed: mdza' bshes dang nye du dang blon po dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams la yang ma yin /
translated: He does not give gifts to friends, relatives, ministers, or blood relatives.

original: dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams la yang gong du 'gro ba dang / skal ba can du 'gyur ba dang / rnam par smin pa bde ba dang / phyi ma la mtho ris su 'gyur ba'i sbyin pa dag dus dus su sbyin par mi byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams la yang gong du 'gro ba dang / skal ba can du 'gyur ba dang / rnam par smin pa bde ba dang / phyi ma la mtho ris su 'gyur ba'i sbyin pa dag dus dus su sbyin par mi byed pa yin te /
translated: He does not give gifts to ascetics and brahmins at the appropriate time, so that they might attain a good rebirth, a happy rebirth, and a heavenly rebirth.

original: khyim bdag de ni 'dod pa la longs spyod pa dang po ste /
analyzed: khyim bdag de ni 'dod pa la longs spyod pa dang po ste /
translated: This is the first type of householder who enjoys sense pleasures.

original: 'jig rten yod pa yin no //ğŸ”½gzhan yang 'di na 'dod @100a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten yod pa yin no // gzhan yang 'di na 'dod @100a * //
translated: The world exists.

original: ba la longs spyod pa kha cig chos ma yin pas bab col du longs spyod pa dag sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: ba la longs spyod pa kha cig chos ma yin pas bab col du longs spyod pa dag sgrub par byed do //
translated: â€œMoreover, there are some who enjoy sense pleasures who pursue sense pleasures through unrighteous and improper means.

original: des chos ma yin pas bab col du longs spyod pa dag bsgrubs nas kyang bdag dang nye du dang snag gi gnyen mtshams kyi bar dag kyang legs par bde bar tshim par byed la ;
analyzed: des chos ma yin pas bab col du longs spyod pa dag bsgrubs nas kyang bdag dang nye du dang snag gi gnyen mtshams kyi bar dag kyang legs par bde bar tshim par byed la ;
translated: Having pursued sense pleasures through unrighteous and improper means, they satisfy themselves, their relatives, and their blood relatives with what is good and pleasant.

original: / dge sbyong dang bram ze dag la yang dus dus su mi byed ces bya ba'i bar du snga ma bzhin te de ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: / dge sbyong dang bram ze dag la yang dus dus su mi byed ces bya ba'i bar du snga ma bzhin te de ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: and he does not do so for Å›ramaá¹‡as and brahmins from time to time, as before. This is the second.

original: gzhan yang 'di na 'dod pa la longs spyod pa kha cig chos ma yin pas bab col du longs spyod dag sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di na 'dod pa la longs spyod pa kha cig chos ma yin pas bab col du longs spyod dag sgrub par byed de /
translated: Moreover, here some enjoy sensual pleasures who, through unrighteous and improper means, acquire sensual pleasures.

original: des chos ma yin pas bab col du longs spyod dag bsgrubs nas kyang bdag kyang nye du dang snag gi gnyen mtshams kyi bar dag kyang legs par bde bas tshim par byed la /
analyzed: des chos ma yin pas bab col du longs spyod dag bsgrubs nas kyang bdag kyang nye du dang snag gi gnyen mtshams kyi bar dag kyang legs par bde bas tshim par byed la /
translated: Having acquired sensual pleasures through unrighteous and improper means, he satisfies himself with them, and he satisfies his relatives and kinsmen, up to his circle of friends.

original: de dge sbyong dang bram ze dag la yang dus dus su byed ces bya ba'i bar du snga ma bzhin te de ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de dge sbyong dang bram ze dag la yang dus dus su byed ces bya ba'i bar du snga ma bzhin te de ni gsum pa'o //
translated: and he does so for Å›ramaá¹‡as and brahmins from time to time, as before. This is the third.

original: chos ma yin pas gsum ji lta ba de bzhin du chos dang chos ma yin pas bab col dang bab col ma yin pas kyang gsum mo //
analyzed: chos ma yin pas gsum ji lta ba de bzhin du chos dang chos ma yin pas bab col dang bab col ma yin pas kyang gsum mo //
translated: Just as there are three [types] through unrighteousness, so there are three [types] through righteousness and unrighteousness, and through improper and proper means.

original: de la bye brag ni 'di yin te gzhan yang 'di na 'dod pa la longs spyod pa kha cig chos dang chos ma yin pas bab col dang bab col ma yin par longs spyod pa dag sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: de la bye brag ni 'di yin te gzhan yang 'di na 'dod pa la longs spyod pa kha cig chos dang chos ma yin pas bab col dang bab col ma yin par longs spyod pa dag sgrub par byed de /
translated: Moreover, here some who enjoy sense objects practice sense enjoyment through Dharma and non-Dharma, rashly and not rashly.

original: de chos dang chos ma yin pas bab col dang bab col ma yin par longs spyod dag bsgrubs nas kyang bdag kyang mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de chos dang chos ma yin pas bab col dang bab col ma yin par longs spyod dag bsgrubs nas kyang bdag kyang mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: Having practiced sense enjoyment through Dharma and non-Dharma, rashly and not rashly, they do not do it again, and so on, as before.

original: de bzhin du chos kyis bab col ma yin par zhes bya ba gzhan gsum mo //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyis bab col ma yin par zhes bya ba gzhan gsum mo //
translated: Similarly, there are three others, such as not rashly through Dharma.

original: de la dgu pa'i bye brag ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la dgu pa'i bye brag ni 'di yin te /
translated: The specific types of the ninth are as follows:

original: phyi ma la mtho ris su 'gyur ba'i bar du brjod nas ;
analyzed: phyi ma la mtho ris su 'gyur ba'i bar du brjod nas ;
translated: Having described up to rebirth in the higher realms in the future,

original: longs spyod de dag la chags pa dang zhen pa dang / mdud pa bor ba dang / brgyal ba dang / lhag par chags pa dang / lhag par chags par gyur ba dang / nyes dmigs su mi lta ba dang / nges par 'byung ba mi shes par yongs su spyod pa'o //

original: bcu pa yang dgu pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bcu pa yang dgu pa dang 'dra'o //

original: bye brag ni longs spyod de dag la yang ma chags pa dang / nges par 'byung ba shes pa'i bar gyi yongs su spyod pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bye brag ni longs spyod de dag la yang ma chags pa dang / nges par 'byung ba shes pa'i bar gyi yongs su spyod pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The difference is that he enjoys those resources without attachment, up to knowing how to escape.

original: sems can dmyal ba'i phung po dang sa bon dang 'bras bu bsdus pa rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i phung po dang sa bon dang 'bras bu bsdus pa rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The aggregates, seeds, and fruits of hell beings, and so on.

original: gal te sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba'i las kyi sa bon @100b de yang sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba yin na ji ltar 'gro ba 'dres bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba'i las kyi sa bon @100b de yang sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba yin na ji ltar 'gro ba 'dres bar mi 'gyur zhe na /

original: mi 'gro ba gang yin pa de kho na dang / de'i las tha mi dad do zhes sus smras /
analyzed: mi 'gro ba gang yin pa de kho na dang / de'i las tha mi dad do zhes sus smras /

original: kun tu 'byung ba tsam gyis 'dres pa ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: kun tu 'byung ba tsam gyis 'dres pa ni mi 'dod de /
translated: We do not accept that the person is mixed up with the action merely by the fact that it occurs.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / de'i sa bon yang 'dod pa na spyod pa nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /

analyzed: de lta bas na 'gro ba 'dres par 'gyur ba med do //

original: sha ma zhes bya ba ni bu'i dkris pa'o //
analyzed: sha ma zhes bya ba ni bu'i dkris pa'o //
