analyzed: / sems can gyi ris drug cu rtsa bzhi ni sems can gyi bye brag kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag tu rung ba rnams dang / de dag nyid la 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par byang ba kho na la 'jug pa'i bye brag rnam pa gsum las brtsams te / rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The sixty-four categories of sentient beings are established on the basis of the various kinds of sentient beings who are suitable for affliction and purification, those who are engaged in those very , and the distinctions of those who are engaged in purification alone.

original: de la dang po ni 'gro ba dang rigs rnam par gzhag pa dang / sems can du rnam par brtags pa dang / las kyi bye brag ste tshig bco lngas bstan to //
analyzed: de la dang po ni 'gro ba dang rigs rnam par gzhag pa dang / sems can du rnam par brtags pa dang / las kyi bye brag ste tshig bco lngas bstan to //
translated: The first is taught by fifteen terms: the categories of world and species, the designation of sentient beings, and the distinctions of karma.ğŸ”½The second is taught by two terms, two terms,

original: gnyis pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba de dag nyid kyi gzhi dang / bya ba dang yang dag par blang ba dang / 'bras bu dang / bsdu bar gtogs pa'i bye brag las brtsams te tshig gnyis dang / gnyis dang /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba de dag nyid kyi gzhi dang / bya ba dang yang dag par blang ba dang / 'bras bu dang / bsdu bar gtogs pa'i bye brag las brtsams te tshig gnyis dang / gnyis dang /
translated: three terms, two terms, and three terms, respectively, on the basis of the distinctions of the basis of those very afflictions and purifications, the action of taking them up, the result, and the categories of inclusion.

original: gsum dang / gnyis dang / gsum gyis bstan to //
analyzed: gsum dang / gnyis dang / gsum gyis bstan to //
translated: The third is taught by three terms, two terms,ğŸ”½and two terms, respectively, on the basis of the distinctions of the basis of those very afflictions and purifications, the action of taking them up, the result, and the categories of inclusion.

original: gsum pa ni sdom pa'i bye brag las te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni sdom pa'i bye brag las te /
translated: The third is due to the different kinds of vows.

original: sdom pa rnam pa brgyad kyi phyir ni tshig bdun gyis so //
analyzed: sdom pa rnam pa brgyad kyi phyir ni tshig bdun gyis so //
translated: The seven verses are for the sake of the eight kinds of vows.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis ni sdom pa can mchog gi rab tu dbye ba ston to //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis ni sdom pa can mchog gi rab tu dbye ba ston to //
translated: The remaining verses teach the classification of the best of those who have vows.

original: sdom pa can mchog gi rab tu dbye ba can yang bye brag rnam pa lnga'i phyir te /
analyzed: sdom pa can mchog gi rab tu dbye ba can yang bye brag rnam pa lnga'i phyir te /
translated: The best of those who have vows are classified in five different ways:

original: dge ba'i phyogs kyi bye brag dang / sdud par bya ba'i yul gyi bye brag dang / bstan pa la gnod pa dang phan ba'i bye brag dang / lung dang rtogs pa'i bye brag dang / mi'i lus thob nas 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mchog brnyes pa'i bye brag ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs kyi bye brag dang / sdud par bya ba'i yul gyi bye brag dang / bstan pa la gnod pa dang phan ba'i bye brag dang / lung dang rtogs pa'i bye brag dang / mi'i lus thob nas 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mchog brnyes pa'i bye brag ste /
translated: the classification of the side of virtue, the classification of the objects that are to be gathered, the classification of the harm and benefit of the teaching, the classification of the scriptures and the realizations, and the classification of the attainment of the highest mundane and supramundane states after obtaining a human body.

original: tshig gsum dang / dgu dang / drug dang / bcu dang / gnyis kyi sa bstan to //
analyzed: tshig gsum dang / dgu dang / drug dang / bcu dang / gnyis kyi sa bstan to //
translated: These are taught by three, nine, six, ten, and two verses, respectively.

original: de la lung dang rtogs pa'i bye brag gis ni so so'i skye bo rnams dang / 'phags pa rnams ji ltar rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la lung dang rtogs pa'i bye brag gis ni so so'i skye bo rnams dang / 'phags pa rnams ji ltar rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Among these, the classification of the scriptures and the realizations establishes the ordinary beings and the Äryas.

original: rtogs pa'i bye brag gis ni bden pa mthong ba rnams la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i bye brag gis ni bden pa mthong ba rnams la sogs pa'o //
translated: The various types of understanding are the various stages of seeing the truths, and so on.

original: 'tsho ba rnams ni sha thang ba chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngus 'tsho ba'i phyir rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'tsho ba rnams ni sha thang ba chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngus 'tsho ba'i phyir rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The various types of livelihood are established in terms of the great, medium, and small degrees of difficulty in obtaining oneâ€™s livelihood.

original: yi ge zhes bya ba ni yig 'bru rnams so //
analyzed: yi ge zhes bya ba ni yig 'bru rnams so //
translated: The various types of letters are the various types of syllables.

original: grangs zhes bya ba ni gcig gnyis zhes bya ba re re nas bskyed pa la sogs pa'o //ğŸ”½shod dgong pa zhes bya ba ni bgrang ba de nyid sa la 'god par byed pa'o //ğŸ”½kha cig na re shod dgod pa zhes bya ba ni sdom gong du spang ba la bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: grangs zhes bya ba ni gcig gnyis zhes bya ba re re nas bskyed pa la sogs pa'o // shod dgong pa zhes bya ba ni bgrang ba de nyid sa la 'god par byed pa'o // kha cig na re shod dgod pa zhes bya ba ni sdom gong du spang ba la bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The various types of numbers are the various types of enumeration, such as one, two, and so on.

original: rtsis zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa la sogs pa sdom pa'o //
analyzed: rtsis zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa la sogs pa sdom pa'o //
translated: The various types of calculation are the various types of addition, subtraction, and so on.

original: kun nas bsrung ba rnams ni gang gis gang bsrung ba dang / grogs gang yin pa de las brtsams te rnam par gzhag @102a * //
analyzed: kun nas bsrung ba rnams ni gang gis gang bsrung ba dang / grogs gang yin pa de las brtsams te rnam par gzhag @102a * //
translated: The various types of protection are established in terms of the various types of things that are to be protected, the various types of protectors, and the various types of assistance.

original: go ; / dpung bu chung gi tshogs zhes bya ba ni dmag mi'o //
analyzed: go ; / dpung bu chung gi tshogs zhes bya ba ni dmag mi'o //
translated: The various types of armies are the various types of military forces.

original: nor gyi stobs zhes bya ba ni mdzod do //
analyzed: nor gyi stobs zhes bya ba ni mdzod do //
translated: The power of wealth is the same as the power of possessions.

original: sdug bsngal rnams ni rang las byung ba dang / gzhan las byung ba dang / chog mi shes pa las byung ba sdug bsngal las brtsams te rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnams ni rang las byung ba dang / gzhan las byung ba dang / chog mi shes pa las byung ba sdug bsngal las brtsams te rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Suffering is established in terms of suffering that arises from oneself, from another, and from insatiability.

original: nga rgyal rnam pa bdun ni pha rol dman pa dang / 'bring dang / lhag pa dang / bdag med pa dang bla ma dang ngan pa'i chos rnams las brtsams te rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: nga rgyal rnam pa bdun ni pha rol dman pa dang / 'bring dang / lhag pa dang / bdag med pa dang bla ma dang ngan pa'i chos rnams las brtsams te rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The seven types of pride are established in terms of inferiority, equality, and superiority to others, in terms of the absence of self, in terms of a spiritual teacher, and in terms of bad qualities.

original: chung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni lhag pa la bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: chung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni lhag pa la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The pride of thinking i am is the pride of superiority.

original: rgyags pa rnam pa bdun la bzhi ni skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba la so sor rtog pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: rgyags pa rnam pa bdun la bzhi ni skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba la so sor rtog pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: The seven types of arrogance are the counteragents to the discernment of birth, old age, sickness, and death.

original: lhag ma rnams ni nang dang phyi rol gyis bsgrubs pa'i chos la so sor rtog pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni nang dang phyi rol gyis bsgrubs pa'i chos la so sor rtog pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: The remaining three are the counteragents to the discernment of internal and external qualities.

original: nang zhes bya ba ni phyi rol la ltos pa rnam par gcod pa'o //
analyzed: nang zhes bya ba ni phyi rol la ltos pa rnam par gcod pa'o //
translated: Internal refers to the elimination of dependence on external things.

original: rang zhes bya ba ni nang dag gi rgyud gzhan dag rnam par gcod pa'o //
analyzed: rang zhes bya ba ni nang dag gi rgyud gzhan dag rnam par gcod pa'o //
translated: The term own excludes other continua.

original: yang na 'jig rten gyis 'di lta bu'o zhes gzung bar mi nus pa la bya ste /
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten gyis 'di lta bu'o zhes gzung bar mi nus pa la bya ste /
translated: Or else, it is that which the world cannot apprehend as being such and such,

original: nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir dang / rang gi rtog pas gzhan gyi rnam par rtog pa yongs su bcad pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½so sor rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir dang / rang gi rtog pas gzhan gyi rnam par rtog pa yongs su bcad pa'i phyir ro // so sor rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: because it is not experienced and because one's own conceptualization does not delimit the conceptualization of another.

original: so sor rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi ni nyes pa rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen po yin te /
analyzed: so sor rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi ni nyes pa rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen po yin te /
translated: The four terms each for himself, etc., are antidotes to four errors.

original: nyes pa rnam pa bzhi ni log par rtog pa'i nyes pa dang / shes pa mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i spyod yul gyi nyes pa dang / de kho na'i ngo bo'i bar du chod pa'i nyes pa dang / lkog tu gyur pa'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa rnam pa bzhi ni log par rtog pa'i nyes pa dang / shes pa mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i spyod yul gyi nyes pa dang / de kho na'i ngo bo'i bar du chod pa'i nyes pa dang / lkog tu gyur pa'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The four errors are: the error of false conceptualization, the error of the domain of non-concentrated cognition, the error of the obstruction of the nature of reality, and the error of the obscure.

original: tha snyad kyi gzhi mang po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi gzhi mang po dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the many bases of designation?

original: de dag ni nges pa'i tshig gi gzhi rnams zhes kyang bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: de dag ni nges pa'i tshig gi gzhi rnams zhes kyang bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: These are also called the bases of etymologies.

original: nges pa'i tshig rnams zhes bya ba ni don dang mthun pas ming du btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig rnams zhes bya ba ni don dang mthun pas ming du btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bases of etymologies are so called because names are given in accordance with meanings.

original: spros pa'i gzhi rnams zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad rab 'byam sna tshogs kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spros pa'i gzhi rnams zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad rab 'byam sna tshogs kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bases of elaboration are so called because they are the bases of the various worldly conventions.

original: don bsdus pa'i gzhi rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don bsdus pa'i gzhi rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: The bases of the collections of names are so called because they are the bases of the collections of names.

original: sa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni thams cad bsdus pa yin //
analyzed: sa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni thams cad bsdus pa yin //
translated: The word â€œbasesâ€ includes all of them.

original: dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa drug gis ni gnyis gnyis so //
analyzed: dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa drug gis ni gnyis gnyis so //
translated: The six, beginning with the faculties, are the bases of the two.

original: gzhi'i tshogs de dag kyang bstan pa ni gcig gis so //
analyzed: gzhi'i tshogs de dag kyang bstan pa ni gcig gis so //
translated: The one, the aggregates, is the basis of the collections.

original: bshad pa ni lhag ma rnams kyis te /
analyzed: bshad pa ni lhag ma rnams kyis te /
translated: The remaining ones are the bases of the explanations.

original: de yang @102b byang chub sems dpa' 'dul ba dag la 'jug pa las brtsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang @102b byang chub sems dpa' 'dul ba dag la 'jug pa las brtsams pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, this is begun in the Bodhisattvabhumi in the section on the Vinaya.

original: 'dul ba de dag la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dul ba de dag la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of those who are disciplined:

original: mu stegs can rnams dang / de las gzhan pa dag go //
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams dang / de las gzhan pa dag go //
translated: those who are non-Buddhist and those who are Buddhists.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' mu stegs can rnams dang lhan cig tu bya ba dang / bdag la sogs pa'i dngos po gang la rnam par nges par bya ba dang / gnang ba la sogs pa gang thob pa dang / spang bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' mu stegs can rnams dang lhan cig tu bya ba dang / bdag la sogs pa'i dngos po gang la rnam par nges par bya ba dang / gnang ba la sogs pa gang thob pa dang / spang bar bya ba dang /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva teaches the sevenfold division of the verbal expression of the object, the object to be ascertained, the person who ascertains, the means of ascertaining, the ascertainment, the ascertainment of the object, and the ascertainment of the verbal expression.ğŸ”½The object to be ascertained is the person, the self, etc.ğŸ”½The means of ascertaining is the scripture, etc.

original: rnam par dbye ba bdun po gang gis tshig mngon par 'du bya ba dang / gdags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gis don nges par bya ba de ston to //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba bdun po gang gis tshig mngon par 'du bya ba dang / gdags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gis don nges par bya ba de ston to //
translated: The ascertainment is the ascertainment of the object and the ascertainment of the verbal expression.ğŸ”½The ascertainment of the object is the ascertainment of the person, the self, etc.ğŸ”½The ascertainment of the verbal expression is the ascertainment of the designation, etc.

original: gdags pa zhes bya ba ni ming du gdags pa la bya'o //
analyzed: gdags pa zhes bya ba ni ming du gdags pa la bya'o //
translated: The designation is the designation of the name.

original: de las gzhan pa yang khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa yang khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba'o //
translated: The person is the householder and the renunciate.

original: de la khyim ba ni rigs kyi 'du shes la sogs pa de dag gis don rnams ji ltar yang dag par sgrub par byed pa dang / pha dang ma la sogs pa dag yongs su gzung ba'i phyir gang gi don du yang dag par sgrub pa dang /
analyzed: de la khyim ba ni rigs kyi 'du shes la sogs pa de dag gis don rnams ji ltar yang dag par sgrub par byed pa dang / pha dang ma la sogs pa dag yongs su gzung ba'i phyir gang gi don du yang dag par sgrub pa dang /
translated: The householder is one who accomplishes the objects by means of the notions of family, etc., and for whose sake the accomplishment is for the sake of maintaining father, mother, etc.

original: de yongs su gzung ba'i nyes pa 'khor ba yun ring du skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de yongs su gzung ba'i nyes pa 'khor ba yun ring du skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: The fault of taking it up is that one is born in cyclic existence for a long time.ğŸ”½

original: rgud pa zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar de dag nyams su myong bar 'gyur bas na byang chub sems dpa' de dag de la skyo bar bya ba'i phyir ston par byed do //
analyzed: rgud pa zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar de dag nyams su myong bar 'gyur bas na byang chub sems dpa' de dag de la skyo bar bya ba'i phyir ston par byed do //
translated: The faults of taking up that [life] are taught in order to discourage the bodhisattvas from that [life], beginning with the statement: â€œOne is born for a long time in cyclic existence,â€ and ending with the statement: â€œOne is ruined.â€

original: rab tu byung bas yang ji ltar rab tu byung ba'i don rnams yang dag par sgrub par byed pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa' ston par byed de /
analyzed: rab tu byung bas yang ji ltar rab tu byung ba'i don rnams yang dag par sgrub par byed pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa' ston par byed de /
translated: The bodhisattvas teach in such a way that those who have gone forth will accomplish the aims of those who have gone forth.

original: rab tu byung ba'i don ni bslab pa gsum mo //ğŸ”½de la lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin ni mngon du 'ong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i don ni bslab pa gsum mo // de la lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin ni mngon du 'ong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: The aim of those who have gone forth is the three trainings.

original: spros pa med pa rnams zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar dag gis bstan to //
analyzed: spros pa med pa rnams zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar dag gis bstan to //
translated: Among them, superior morality and concentration are taught by the statements beginning with: â€œOne comes to have the pre-eminence of morality and concentration,â€ and ending with: â€œOne is not agitated.â€ğŸ”½Superior wisdom is taught by the statements beginning with: â€œOne is not carried away by elaborations,â€ and ending with: â€œOne is not carried away by elaborations.â€

original: shes rab ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i rigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du go bar byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i rigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du go bar byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Wisdom is the understanding of what is to be accomplished and the reasoning that accomplishes it.

original: de na nyams sto bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / 'dres pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / bsgrags pa rnams zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: de na nyams sto bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / 'dres pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / bsgrags pa rnams zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: It is taught by the words beginning with â€œthrough the loss of mindfulnessâ€ and ending with â€œthe confused.â€

original: yang khyim ba de'i don yang dag par sgrub pa ni dgos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad gang yin pa de dag ste /ğŸ”½de ltar tha snyad kyi rtsod pa byung ba la 'jigs pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa sgrub pa gang yin pa de la tshe 'di'i nyes dmigs bsad pa dang bcing ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: yang khyim ba de'i don yang dag par sgrub pa ni dgos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad gang yin pa de dag ste / de ltar tha snyad kyi rtsod pa byung ba la 'jigs pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa sgrub pa gang yin pa de la tshe 'di'i nyes dmigs bsad pa dang bcing ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: The purpose of the householder is the conventional expressions beginning with â€œthe need.â€ğŸ”½When there is a dispute about the conventional, the proof is the words beginning with â€œfearlessâ€ and ending with â€œthe conventional.â€

original: rnyog pa can zhes bya @103a * //
analyzed: rnyog pa can zhes bya @103a * //
translated: The faults of this life are the words beginning with â€œpunishment and imprisonmentâ€ and ending with â€œturbulent.â€

original: ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gang yin pa dag 'byung bas na de bzlog pa'i phyir de dag la ste ston par byed do //
analyzed: ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gang yin pa dag 'byung bas na de bzlog pa'i phyir de dag la ste ston par byed do //
translated: Since they occur, they are refuted and taught.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni dran pa can la sogs pa'i khyim la bya'o //
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni dran pa can la sogs pa'i khyim la bya'o //
translated: The place is the home of the mindful ones, etc.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' de dag gang gi mthus rnam par gtan la 'bebs par byed pa dang / chos kyang ston par byed pa'i yid ches ba'i lung dang rjes su dpag pa de dag ni mjug tu bstan te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' de dag gang gi mthus rnam par gtan la 'bebs par byed pa dang / chos kyang ston par byed pa'i yid ches ba'i lung dang rjes su dpag pa de dag ni mjug tu bstan te /
translated: The scriptural tradition and inference that are the basis for the bodhisattvas' discernment and teaching of the Dharma are indicated at the end.

original: de ltar na ji ltar sems can gyi don bya ba dang gang gi mthus bya ba de dag mdor bsdus te bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na ji ltar sems can gyi don bya ba dang gang gi mthus bya ba de dag mdor bsdus te bstan to //
translated: Thus, the means for accomplishing the aims of beings and the basis for accomplishing them are indicated in brief.

original: bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: The concluding verse:ğŸ”½The bodhisattva's explanation

original: mu stegs khyim pa dge slong la //
analyzed: mu stegs khyim pa dge slong la //
translated: to the tÄ«rthikas, householders, and monks

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bshad pa ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bshad pa ni //
translated: is taught by the treatise in terms of

original: ji ltar gang gi mthu yin pa //ğŸ”½de ngag bstan bcos tshig gis bshad //
analyzed: ji ltar gang gi mthu yin pa // de ngag bstan bcos tshig gis bshad //
translated: how and by what means.

original: ngo bo nyid la sogs pa las bar gyi rnam pa lnga po de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni gnas dang dmigs pa dang grogs rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la sogs pa las bar gyi rnam pa lnga po de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni gnas dang dmigs pa dang grogs rnams bsdu'o //
translated: The five topics beginning with the nature are indicated by the words, etc., which include the place, objective, and companion.

original: de las gzhan pa btags pa'i yod pa'i chos rnams ni zhes bya ba la kha cig na re 'dus ma byas kyang btags pa'i yod pa yin pa zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa btags pa'i yod pa'i chos rnams ni zhes bya ba la kha cig na re 'dus ma byas kyang btags pa'i yod pa yin pa zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that even the unconditioned is imputedly existent.

original: ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni phyung ba'o //
analyzed: ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni phyung ba'o //
translated: ...are excluded.

original: de dag dbyung ba ni gzugs can yang ma yin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid las skabs de'i rtsom pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag dbyung ba ni gzugs can yang ma yin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid las skabs de'i rtsom pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: They are excluded because the topic is introduced with the characteristic of not being form, and so on.

original: yang na rang nyid kyis kyang 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: yang na rang nyid kyis kyang 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyor bar byed de /
translated: Or, one should connect it with the statement, ...it is also like this, and so on.

original: 'dir ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnams ni dang po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i sa bon las mngon par 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnams ni dang po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i sa bon las mngon par 'grub ste /
translated: Here, external and internal things are first established from the seed of the foundation consciousness.

original: gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i lha rnams su skye ba na /
analyzed: gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i lha rnams su skye ba na /
translated: When one dies in the formless realm and is reborn as a desire realm god,

original: gzugs mngon par 'grub pa nyid sa bon gyi gzhi yin par de gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs mngon par 'grub pa nyid sa bon gyi gzhi yin par de gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the establishment of form is the basis of the seed because it clarifies that.

original: ji skad du rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las /
analyzed: ji skad du rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las /
translated: As the Compendium of Ascertainments says:

original: 'byung ba'i gzugs ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams kyi sa bon dang ldan pa yang yin la /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i gzugs ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams kyi sa bon dang ldan pa yang yin la /
translated: The primary elements possess the seeds of the derivative form,

original: rang gi sa bon dang ldan pa yang yin la /
analyzed: rang gi sa bon dang ldan pa yang yin la /
translated: and they possess their own seeds.

original: rang gi sa bon dang ldan pa yang yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis 'byung ba rnams ni dang po nyid nas gnyi ga'i sa bon dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: rang gi sa bon dang ldan pa yang yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis 'byung ba rnams ni dang po nyid nas gnyi ga'i sa bon dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: The text says that the primary elements possess the seeds of both,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang sa bon thams cad pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang sa bon thams cad pa nyid du ston to //
translated: and it also shows that minds and mental factors possess all the seeds.

original: de ni thams cad du yang rjes su 'jug pa'i tshul las bsams pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni thams cad du yang rjes su 'jug pa'i tshul las bsams pa yin te /
translated: This is stated in terms of the way they operate in all situations.

original: 'di ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par ma bzhag pa la spros pa dang bcas pa'i dbye ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par ma bzhag pa la spros pa dang bcas pa'i dbye ba bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus the presentation of the classifications of the elaborations is made without positing a foundation consciousness.

original: @103b rnam par rig pa tsam du smra ba dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: @103b rnam par rig pa tsam du smra ba dag gis smras pa /
translated: The Proponents of Mere Consciousness say,

original: skad cig pa'i gzugs thams cad ni kun gzhi'i sa bon las byung ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: skad cig pa'i gzugs thams cad ni kun gzhi'i sa bon las byung ba kho na yin te /
translated: All momentary forms arise only from the seeds of the store consciousness,

original: de lta bur snang ba'i sems skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bur snang ba'i sems skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind that appears in that way is born.

original: gang dag sems ni 'bru la sogs pa dag gi bdag po'i rkyen tsam du zad kyi rgyu'i rkyen ma yin no zhes zer ba de dag gis ni de las kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i sems can gyi 'jig rten 'grub pa'i rtsa ba yang yin te /
analyzed: gang dag sems ni 'bru la sogs pa dag gi bdag po'i rkyen tsam du zad kyi rgyu'i rkyen ma yin no zhes zer ba de dag gis ni de las kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i sems can gyi 'jig rten 'grub pa'i rtsa ba yang yin te /
translated: Those who say that the mind is merely the dominant condition of seeds, etc., and not the causal condition, have not seen the texts that say that the store consciousness is the root of the world of sentient beings,

original: rten dang bcas pa'i dbang po rnams dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams skyed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten dang bcas pa'i dbang po rnams dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams skyed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it produces the sense faculties with their supports and the active forms of consciousness.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten 'grub pa'i rtsa ba yang yin te /
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten 'grub pa'i rtsa ba yang yin te /
translated: It is also the root of the world of the physical environment,

original: snod kyi 'jig rten skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung de ma mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung de ma mthong ba yin no //
translated: because it produces the physical world.

original: de skyes pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba ched po rnams 'byung ba ni de skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de skyes pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba ched po rnams 'byung ba ni de skyes pa yin no //
translated: because it is the antecedent of that.

original: de ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi sngon du 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi sngon du 'gro ba yin te /
translated: The great elements are the antecedent of derivative form,

original: de yod na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because derivative form arises when it exists.

original: 'dir 'dus pa ni snga phyi med mod kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu la ni snga phyi yod do //
analyzed: 'dir 'dus pa ni snga phyi med mod kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu la ni snga phyi yod do //
translated: Although there is no temporal priority or posteriority among these, there is temporal priority and posteriority between cause and effect.

original: yang na dus la yang snga yod de /ğŸ”½'dir 'byung ba ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs med na mi 'byung ngo zhes bya bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na dus la yang snga yod de / 'dir 'byung ba ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs med na mi 'byung ngo zhes bya bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, there is temporal priority in terms of time.ğŸ”½There is no certainty that the great elements arise when derivative form arises, because derivative form does not arise when the great elements are absent.

original: 'di ltar rgyur byas pa'i gzugs skyes pa de 'byung ba'i phyogs dang tha dad med par gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba rnams dang nam mkha' yul gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyur byas pa'i gzugs skyes pa de 'byung ba'i phyogs dang tha dad med par gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba rnams dang nam mkha' yul gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, derivative form that has arisen is not separate from the direction of the great elements.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa dag ji ltar lhan cig na gnas par rung zhe na /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa dag ji ltar lhan cig na gnas par rung zhe na /
translated: How can those that are impeded to moving together exist simultaneously?

original: 'o na lha bar ma do'i srid pa'i gzugs dang sems mtshungs pa'i lha rnams dang / lha'i bu lag brgyad kyi thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs kyang ji ltar lhan cig gnas par rung ste /
analyzed: 'o na lha bar ma do'i srid pa'i gzugs dang sems mtshungs pa'i lha rnams dang / lha'i bu lag brgyad kyi thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs kyang ji ltar lhan cig gnas par rung ste /
translated: And how can the form of a god with eight arms and so on be simultaneous?

original: de'i phyir skyes pa'i phra ba yin par 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes pa'i phra ba yin par 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore it should be asserted that subtle form is that which arises.

original: de ni rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las /
analyzed: de ni rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las /
translated: This is to be understood from the Compendium of Ascertainment, which states:

original: phra ba nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: phra ba nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Subtlety is threefold:

original: gsal bas phra ba nyid dang / skyes pa phra ba nyid dang / dbang sgyur ba phra ba nyid do zhes 'byung bas de nas gzung bar bya'o ;
analyzed: gsal bas phra ba nyid dang / skyes pa phra ba nyid dang / dbang sgyur ba phra ba nyid do zhes 'byung bas de nas gzung bar bya'o ;
translated: subtlety of manifestation, subtlety of arising, and subtlety of mastery.

original: / gzugs 'dus pa la yang rdul phra rab ni nams kyang skye bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rdul phra rab ni re re nas 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: / gzugs 'dus pa la yang rdul phra rab ni nams kyang skye bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rdul phra rab ni re re nas 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Also, regarding the collection of form, it is said that atoms never arise individually and so on.

original: don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are meaningless.

original: gal te byung bas na sbyor ba byed na ni cha shas can du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te byung bas na sbyor ba byed na ni cha shas can du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they arise and then combine, it would follow that they have parts.

original: rdul phra rab ni blos tshad kyi mtha' yongs @104a * //
analyzed: rdul phra rab ni blos tshad kyi mtha' yongs @104a * //
translated: The atom is merely designated by the mind as the ultimate limit of extension.ğŸ”½When a composite is being divided, it is imagined to be an atom,

original: su bcad pa las 'dogs par zad de zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa la 'byed par byed pa na de dpogs par 'gyur te bshig nas rab kyi mthar phyin te bcad pa la sogs pa'i spyod yul las shin tu 'das pa gang yin pa de ni rdul phrağŸ”½rab ces bya ste /
analyzed: su bcad pa las 'dogs par zad de zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa la 'byed par byed pa na de dpogs par 'gyur te bshig nas rab kyi mthar phyin te bcad pa la sogs pa'i spyod yul las shin tu 'das pa gang yin pa de ni rdul phra rab ces bya ste /
translated: but that which is beyond the range of destruction, division, and so on, is called an atom.

original: blos yongs su bcad nas rnam par gzhag par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: blos yongs su bcad nas rnam par gzhag par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is merely designated by the mind as the ultimate limit of extension.

original: rdul phra rab kyang phyogs dang bcas pa yin te zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyang phyogs dang bcas pa yin te zhes bya ba la //
translated: The atom also has a direction.

original: phyogs ni dpag tu rung ba la bya ste /
analyzed: phyogs ni dpag tu rung ba la bya ste /
translated: Direction is to be understood as a measure,

original: de yod pa'i phyir phyogs dang bcas pa zhes bya bar zad kyi cha shas kyi phyogs dang bcas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yod pa'i phyir phyogs dang bcas pa zhes bya bar zad kyi cha shas kyi phyogs dang bcas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: because it exists, it is said to have a direction, but it does not have a direction in terms of parts.

original: yang kha cig na re 'dus pa rnams 'dul ba'i phyir rdul phra rab kyang phyogs dang bcas pa yin te zhes smos so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang kha cig na re 'dus pa rnams 'dul ba'i phyir rdul phra rab kyang phyogs dang bcas pa yin te zhes smos so zhes zer ro //
translated: Still others say: The atom has directional parts because it is the cause of the collection of atoms.

original: de lta na cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du brjod par nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du brjod par nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then it can be said to have parts.

original: yul lhan cig pa ni yul 'dab chags pa yin te /
analyzed: yul lhan cig pa ni yul 'dab chags pa yin te /
translated: The term â€œcontiguousâ€ means that the object is adjacent.

original: 'di ltar yul gyi rnam pa gang yang rung ba zhig bzung na /
analyzed: 'di ltar yul gyi rnam pa gang yang rung ba zhig bzung na /
translated: Thus, when one aspect of an object is apprehended,

original: lhag ma yang de'i rang bzhin lta bur gnas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lhag ma yang de'i rang bzhin lta bur gnas pa'i phyir te /
translated: the remaining aspects appear as if they are of the same nature.

original: de'i phyir rdul phra rab rnams kyis 'dus pa bskyed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdul phra rab rnams kyis 'dus pa bskyed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, the root text states, â€œThe collection of atoms does not generate a visual consciousness.â€

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thams cad kyang zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba 'dus pa la rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gang dag gnas pa la bya'o //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thams cad kyang zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba 'dus pa la rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gang dag gnas pa la bya'o //
translated: The term â€œall derivative formâ€ refers to the derivative form that exists in the primary elements and the collection of primary elements.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gang 'byung ba dang tha dad par 'jug pa yang la la yod do //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gang 'byung ba dang tha dad par 'jug pa yang la la yod do //
translated: Some derivative form exists separately from the primary elements.

original: dper na man me dang rin po che snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na man me dang rin po che snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a lamp and a jewel.

original: 'o na ji ltar de dag 'byung ba chen po dag gis skyes pa yin no zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar de dag 'byung ba chen po dag gis skyes pa yin no zhes bya zhe na /
translated: But how can they be said to be derived from the primary elements?

original: mar me dang rin po che yang 'byung ba chen po dag la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mar me dang rin po che yang 'byung ba chen po dag la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a lamp and a jewel also arise in dependence on the primary elements.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'byung ba chen po rnams ni 'byung ba chen po zhes bya ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'byung ba chen po rnams ni 'byung ba chen po zhes bya ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: That is why the primary elements are called primary elements.

original: chen po zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi gnas sbyin par byed pa la bya ste /
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi gnas sbyin par byed pa la bya ste /
translated: The term â€œprimaryâ€ signifies that which serves as the basis for others.

original: 'jig rten na yang rnam pa de lta bu la chen po zhes zer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang rnam pa de lta bu la chen po zhes zer ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For in the world, that which serves as the basis for something else is called â€œprimary.â€

original: gzugs 'dus pa de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rdzas rnam pa bcu bzhi yod de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs 'dus pa de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rdzas rnam pa bcu bzhi yod de zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those composites of form are, in brief, fourteen kinds of substances.

original: dkar po nyid la sogs pa dag ji ltar rdzas su yod ce na /
analyzed: dkar po nyid la sogs pa dag ji ltar rdzas su yod ce na /
translated: How can the states of lightness, etc., be substances?

original: de'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag thob pa'i 'byung ba chen po de dag nyid lhag mar gyur pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag las logs shig tu bgrang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag thob pa'i 'byung ba chen po de dag nyid lhag mar gyur pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag las logs shig tu bgrang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The great elements that are the particular states of those great elements that are obtained are counted separately from the remaining great elements.

original: yid kyi spyod yul gyi gzugs nyid ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni de 'dus @104b par gnas pa ma yin pas 'dir mi bgrang ngo //
analyzed: yid kyi spyod yul gyi gzugs nyid ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni de 'dus @104b par gnas pa ma yin pas 'dir mi bgrang ngo //
translated: The form that is the domain of the mental faculty is excluded because it is not included in the elements.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i rdzas thams cad kyi khams dang ldan no zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i rdzas ji skad bstan pa thams cad kyi sa bon rnams de la yod do zhes ston to //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i rdzas thams cad kyi khams dang ldan no zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i rdzas ji skad bstan pa thams cad kyi sa bon rnams de la yod do zhes ston to //
translated: All the substances that have been taught possess the elements. This shows that the seeds of all the substances that have been taught, such as earth, exist in the body.

original: lus kyi dbang po ni ci rigs su brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po ni ci rigs su brjod par bya'o //
translated: The body faculty should be mentioned in the appropriate place.

original: ji lta bar dbang po gzugs can gyi gnas 'byung ba chen pos bsdus pa yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni de dbang po dang spyi gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji lta bar dbang po gzugs can gyi gnas 'byung ba chen pos bsdus pa yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni de dbang po dang spyi gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The faculties that are form and the bases that are form are also like that, because they are the same as the faculties in general.

original: de bas na rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las dbang po gzugs can gnas dang bcas pa gang yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de gnyis ni mdor nas bon thams cad pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las dbang po gzugs can gnas dang bcas pa gang yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de gnyis ni mdor nas bon thams cad pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the Compendium of Ascertainment says, â€œThe physical faculties together with their bases and the consciousnesses are called the seeds of all.â€

original: de las gzhan pa'i 'dus pa ni dbang po gzugs can rnams ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa'i khams dang ldan no zhes bya ba ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni rang gis bon dang ldan pa yin gyi 'byung ba'i gzugs ni rang dang rgyur byas pa'i sa bonğŸ”½dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i 'dus pa ni dbang po gzugs can rnams ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa'i khams dang ldan no zhes bya ba ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni rang gis bon dang ldan pa yin gyi 'byung ba'i gzugs ni rang dang rgyur byas pa'i sa bon dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: The other compositional factors are associated with the elements other than the physical faculties. This means that derivative form is associated with its own seeds, but primary elements are associated with their own seeds and the seeds of derivative form.

original: ji ltar mthun pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mthun pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: They are associated according to their compatibility.

original: de bas na 'og nas kyang 'byung ba chen po'i gzugs ni sa bon gnyis dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na 'og nas kyang 'byung ba chen po'i gzugs ni sa bon gnyis dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it says below, â€œForm derived from the great elements is associated with two seeds.

original: 'byung ba chen po'i sa bon dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi sa bon dang ldan no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po'i sa bon dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi sa bon dang ldan no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is associated with the seeds of the great elements and the seeds of derivative form.â€

original: de la mtshan nyid kyis bsdus /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid kyis bsdus /
translated: Here, the Compendium of Ascertainment says:

original: rdzas bcu bzhi bo de dag tu gyur to zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan las 'dus pa yod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas bcu bzhi bo de dag tu gyur to zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan las 'dus pa yod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: These fourteen real entities are the collection of the specific characteristics.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la mig gi 'dus pa la rdzas bcu bzhi po dag med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la mig gi 'dus pa la rdzas bcu bzhi po dag med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But are not the fourteen real entities absent in the collection of the eye?

original: 'di ni 'dus pa spyir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dus pa spyir bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is a general statement about the collection.

original: dbye na mig la ni sa la sogs pa dang / lus dang / mig gi dbang po dang / yul yang ci rigs pa dag yod par sbyar ro //
analyzed: dbye na mig la ni sa la sogs pa dang / lus dang / mig gi dbang po dang / yul yang ci rigs pa dag yod par sbyar ro //
translated: If one distinguishes, one should say that earth, etc., the body, the eye faculty, and the object exist in the eye, as is appropriate.

original: gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The same for the others.

original: lus la ni kha cig tu mig la sogs pa dbri bar bya'o //
analyzed: lus la ni kha cig tu mig la sogs pa dbri bar bya'o //
translated: In the body, one should subtract the eye, etc.

original: 'di lta ste rdo dang zhes bya ba la sogs ba la /
analyzed: 'di lta ste rdo dang zhes bya ba la sogs ba la /
translated: For example, stone, etc.

original: gal te rdo la sogs pa la chu med na 'dus pa byas she na /
analyzed: gal te rdo la sogs pa la chu med na 'dus pa byas she na /
translated: If water does not exist in stone, etc., how can there be a collection?

original: kha cig na re chu'i khams kyis bsdus pa byas te 'gags pa na shugs gnas pa de lta bu'i gnas skabs su 'dug go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re chu'i khams kyis bsdus pa byas te 'gags pa na shugs gnas pa de lta bu'i gnas skabs su 'dug go zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that the water element is collected, and that when it ceases, the water remains in the form of a latent force.

original: de la re zhig rang gi mtshan nyid las chu med kyang bya ba byed pa'i phyir de bzhin du skyes shing nge bzhin du byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: de la re zhig rang gi mtshan nyid las chu med kyang bya ba byed pa'i phyir de bzhin du skyes shing nge bzhin du byung bar gyur to //
translated: In this regard, although water does not exist in its intrinsic reality, it arises in that way and comes into existence because it performs a function.

original: yang na gang la chu med pa de las bsags shing 'dus pa mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba de @105a * //
analyzed: yang na gang la chu med pa de las bsags shing 'dus pa mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba de @105a * //
translated: Or, that which does not have water does not have a collection or aggregation.

original: yang ci'i phyir /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir /
translated: Why is that?

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor rdul dang bcas pa'am zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor rdul dang bcas pa'am zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: de ltar na gang la gang dmigs pa de ni de'i mtshan nyid kyis yod la /

original: bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis so //

analyzed: bsags pa las byung ba'i tshig gnyis ni rdzas mang po las gyur pa dang / shin tu gsal ba las gyur pa yin no //
translated: The two that arise from accumulation are those that arise from a multitude of substances and those that arise from a very clear substance.

original: de la gzugs ni gnyis so //
analyzed: de la gzugs ni gnyis so //
translated: Form is twofold.

original: de las gzhan la 'og nas 'byung ba dag ni 'og nas so //
analyzed: de las gzhan la 'og nas 'byung ba dag ni 'og nas so //
translated: The others are as will be explained later.

original: 'gyur ba'i rgyu mthun pa las byung ba zhes bya ba ni mi 'dra ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i rgyu mthun pa las byung ba zhes bya ba ni mi 'dra ba las byung ba'o //
translated: Those that arise from the natural outflow of transformation are those that arise from a dissimilar cause.

original: rang bzhin gyis rgyu mthun pa las zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rgyu mthun pa las zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba las byung ba'o //
translated: Those that arise from the natural outflow of the essential nature are those that arise from a similar cause.

analyzed: rnam par smin par skyes pa zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams so //
translated: Those that arise from the cause of karmic maturation are the store consciousness and the factors that are associated with it.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag go //
translated: Those that arise from the result of karmic maturation are the eye consciousness, etc.

analyzed: chung dus bskal ba zhes bya ba ni ma bsgribs kyang skye ba po phra mo la sogs pa dag lta bu'o //
translated: â€œBy a small oneâ€ means by a small being, etc.

original: gang du rjes su chags pa der zhes bya ba ni yul mang po 'dus pa yod kyang gang 'dod par ro //
analyzed: gang du rjes su chags pa der zhes bya ba ni yul mang po 'dus pa yod kyang gang 'dod par ro //
translated: â€œWhere there is attachmentâ€ means where there is attachment to a multitude of objects.

original: gang du shin tu mtshan mar bzung ba zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du 'dzin @106b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang du shin tu mtshan mar bzung ba zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du 'dzin @106b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œWhere there is a strong signâ€ means where there is a strong sign of the object, because of repeated apprehension.

original: yang na shas cher 'jug pa la bya'o //ğŸ”½shin tu rab tu bkra bar bzung ba der zhes bya ba ni rnam pa mang pos 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na shas cher 'jug pa la bya'o // shin tu rab tu bkra bar bzung ba der zhes bya ba ni rnam pa mang pos 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or it means where there is a strong engagement.

original: cher yid du 'ong ba'am zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: cher yid du 'ong ba'am zhes bya ba'am /
translated: â€œWhere there is a strong vividnessâ€ means where there is a strong vividness of the object, because of the apprehension of many aspects.ğŸ”½â€œWhere there is a strong beautyâ€ means where there is a strong beauty of the object.

original: lam zhes bya ba'i sgras na yid du mi 'ong ba bzung ngo //
analyzed: lam zhes bya ba'i sgras na yid du mi 'ong ba bzung ngo //
translated: Or the word â€œpathâ€ refers to the unpleasant.

original: shin tu 'dris shing zhes bya ba ni brdas goms shing 'dris par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu 'dris shing zhes bya ba ni brdas goms shing 'dris par gyur pa'o //
translated: â€œWhere there is a strong familiarityâ€ means where there is a strong familiarity with the sign.

original: shin tu yongs su 'dris par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dbang pa'i sgo nas yongs su 'dris pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu yongs su 'dris par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dbang pa'i sgo nas yongs su 'dris pa'o //
translated: â€œVery familiarâ€ means familiar through the faculty.

original: yang na brdas 'dzin pa la goms pa'o //
analyzed: yang na brdas 'dzin pa la goms pa'o //
translated: Or, it means accustomed to apprehending through conventional symbols.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te rgyu bzhi po de dag med par gyur na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te rgyu bzhi po de dag med par gyur na'o //
translated: â€œOtherwiseâ€ means if those four causes do not exist.

original: dmigs pa gcig la /
analyzed: dmigs pa gcig la /
translated: â€œIn one objectâ€ means in one object-field.

original: rtag tu yid la byed pa rnam pa gcig pu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan la 'byung ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang po kho na rgyu nye bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu yid la byed pa rnam pa gcig pu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan la 'byung ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang po kho na rgyu nye bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œThe single mode of mental attention would occurâ€ means that the first object-field would be the cause, because it is the cause that is present, since there is no cause for the others.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i skad cig gnyis lan cig tu 'byung ba yang med la zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig gi mjug thogs su mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba med pa la bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i skad cig gnyis lan cig tu 'byung ba yang med la zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig gi mjug thogs su mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba med pa la bya'o //
translated: â€œThere is no occurrence of two moments of the five collections of consciousness at one timeâ€ means that, following the moment of visual consciousness, visual consciousness does not occur.

original: phan tshun gyi mjug thogs su phan tshun 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang med do zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mjug thogs su rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'byung ba med pa la bya'o //
analyzed: phan tshun gyi mjug thogs su phan tshun 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang med do zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mjug thogs su rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'byung ba med pa la bya'o //
translated: And there is no arising of one from the other. This means that the ear consciousness, etc., do not arise immediately after eye consciousness.

original: yang kha cig na re de dag gi mjug thogs su mig gi rnam par shes pa yang 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang kha cig na re de dag gi mjug thogs su mig gi rnam par shes pa yang 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that eye consciousness arises immediately after those.

original: yang kha cig na re lhan cig tu 'byung ba yang med la zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig gnyi ga cig car 'byung ba med par bstan pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang kha cig na re lhan cig tu 'byung ba yang med la zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skad cig gnyi ga cig car 'byung ba med par bstan pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that the meaning of â€œthere is no simultaneous arisingâ€ is that two moments of eye consciousness do not occur simultaneously.

original: yang kha cig na re lnga po dag cig car cig car du 'jug pa med pa'i don zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang kha cig na re lnga po dag cig car cig car du 'jug pa med pa'i don zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that the meaning is that the five do not operate simultaneously.

original: phan tshun gyi mjug thogs su phan tshun du 'byung bar 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa des ni rigs mthun pa rnams mjug thogs su 'byung ba dgag par byed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: phan tshun gyi mjug thogs su phan tshun du 'byung bar 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa des ni rigs mthun pa rnams mjug thogs su 'byung ba dgag par byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: and it is not possible for one of a certain type to arise immediately after one of a different type.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yul yongs su tshol bar byed pa'i sems kyi rgyud kyis bsam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yul yongs su tshol bar byed pa'i sems kyi rgyud kyis bsam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase â€œthe mental consciousness definitely arisesâ€ is intended to refer to a continuum of mind that seeks an object.

original: nges pa ni dus gzhan na yang mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: nges pa ni dus gzhan na yang mi 'byung ste /
translated: It is definite because it does not arise at another time.

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba ni brda la sogs pa gsal bar nyams su myong ba la rag las pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba ni brda la sogs pa gsal bar nyams su myong ba la rag las pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, its arising depends on the experience of a clear indication, such as a sign.ğŸ”½In this regard, the mental consciousness arises from both causes.

original: de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa la ni rgyu gnyi gas 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnyid log pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dag na ni sngon gyi 'phen @107a * //ğŸ”½pas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa la ni rgyu gnyi gas 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnyid log pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dag na ni sngon gyi 'phen @107a * //ğŸ”½pas 'byung ngo //
translated: The mental consciousness arises from a prior impetus in the states of sleep, etc.

original: de dag ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar tshul bzhin ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: de dag ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar tshul bzhin ma yin pa'am /
translated: Because they are non-conceptual.

original: tshul bzhin gyi mtshan ma bzung na 'dod chags dang / dad pa la sogs pa dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: tshul bzhin gyi mtshan ma bzung na 'dod chags dang / dad pa la sogs pa dag 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, when one grasps the sign of what is not so or of what is so, attachment, faith, etc. arise.

original: lung las kyang //
analyzed: lung las kyang //
translated: And in the scriptures it is said:

original: drug pa bdag po rgyal po ste //
analyzed: drug pa bdag po rgyal po ste //
translated: The sixth is the lord, the king.

original: chags par gyur na chags can yin ;
analyzed: chags par gyur na chags can yin ;
translated: When attached, he is attached.

original: / ma chags chags can ma yin te //
analyzed: / ma chags chags can ma yin te //
translated: When not attached, he is not attached.

original: chags na byis par brjod pa yin //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba gsungs pa lta bu'o //ğŸ”½gang sems gcig gam zhes bya ba ni mdo sde dag las sems gcig bskyed pas bde 'gror 'gro'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: chags na byis par brjod pa yin // zhes bya ba gsungs pa lta bu'o // gang sems gcig gam zhes bya ba ni mdo sde dag las sems gcig bskyed pas bde 'gror 'gro'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa la bya'o //
translated: When attached, he is called a fool.ğŸ”½When it is said in the sutras that one goes to a good rebirth by generating a single thought, etc.,

original: de'i phyi ma rnam par zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos las sems gnyis sam gsum gyis mngon par rtogs so zhes ji skad bshad pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyi ma rnam par zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos las sems gnyis sam gsum gyis mngon par rtogs so zhes ji skad bshad pa la bya'o //
translated: it is in reference to the thought that is the immediately preceding condition of the thought of the first meditative concentration.

original: tshig gcig la brten nas dngos po gcig la dus ji tsam gyis rnam par rig pa 'byung ba de tsam la sems gcig ces bya ba ni ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis bde bar gshegs pa ni ston pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gcig la brten nas dngos po gcig la dus ji tsam gyis rnam par rig pa 'byung ba de tsam la sems gcig ces bya ba ni ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis bde bar gshegs pa ni ston pa'o //
translated: As for the statement, â€œOne mind is that which cognizes an object in a single moment of time, based on a single word,â€ this is like the statement by the Blessed One:ğŸ”½â€œThe Well-Gone One is the Teacher.

original: bde bar gshegs pa ni ston pa'o zhes de ltar sems skyed par byed do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa ni ston pa'o zhes de ltar sems skyed par byed do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The Well-Gone One is the Teacher.â€

original: de la bde bar gshegs pa ni ston pa'o zhes bya ba de ni tshig gcig yin te /
analyzed: de la bde bar gshegs pa ni ston pa'o zhes bya ba de ni tshig gcig yin te /
translated: In this statement, the Well-Gone One is the Teacher is a single word.

original: de la brten nas don nges pa de'i tshig 'dis yongs su bstan to zhes dus ji tsam gyis 'byung ba de ni rnam par rig byed gcig yin te don gcig brjod pa 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brten nas don nges pa de'i tshig 'dis yongs su bstan to zhes dus ji tsam gyis 'byung ba de ni rnam par rig byed gcig yin te don gcig brjod pa 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Based on that, the meaning is ascertained. That word is taught in a single moment of time. That is a single instance of informative form, because it is the result of expressing a single meaning.ğŸ”½That which moves in a similar way is also called a single instance.

original: de dang 'dra bar rgyu ba de la yang gcig ces bya'o zhes bya ba ni dpe de kho na la nges par gang yin pa'i 'og tu rigs mthun pa kho na 'byung ba la bya'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar rgyu ba de la yang gcig ces bya'o zhes bya ba ni dpe de kho na la nges par gang yin pa'i 'og tu rigs mthun pa kho na 'byung ba la bya'o //
translated: This is like the example just given, where it is ascertained that only a similar type of state arises after a particular state.

original: ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa gzhan la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa gzhan la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to other concentrations, etc.

original: de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa rtsol ba med cing rnam par g-yengs par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa gzhan la glo bur du 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa rtsol ba med cing rnam par g-yengs par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa gzhan la glo bur du 'jug pa ste /
translated: Among them, the mental consciousness is said to be â€œwithout effort and distractedâ€ because it suddenly engages other objects.

original: des na 'dun pa la sogs pa med par ston te /
analyzed: des na 'dun pa la sogs pa med par ston te /
translated: Therefore, it is shown that it lacks aspiration, etc.

original: rtsol ba'i rgyu'i gtso bo ni 'dun pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsol ba'i rgyu'i gtso bo ni 'dun pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because aspiration is the primary cause of effort.

original: dmigs pa 'dris pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni dran pa dang goms pa dag med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa 'dris pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni dran pa dang goms pa dag med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: By saying â€œfamiliar with the object,â€ it is shown that it lacks mindfulness and cultivation.

original: yang na 'das pa nyams su myong ba'am /
analyzed: yang na 'das pa nyams su myong ba'am /
translated: Or, that which is experienced in the past

original: lan cig nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de ni ma 'dris pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lan cig nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de ni ma 'dris pa zhes bya'o //
translated: or that which is experienced once is called unfamiliar.

original: 'dun pa la sogs pa 'jug pa med do zhes bya ba ni so sor nges pa lnga po de dag ni 'dod pa la sogs pa'i yul la 'byung bar nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dun pa la sogs pa 'jug pa med do zhes bya ba ni so sor nges pa lnga po de dag ni 'dod pa la sogs pa'i yul la 'byung bar nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said that aspiration, etc., do not operate because those five certainties arise in relation to objects such as desire.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de ni nye @107b bar gnas pa las byung ba zhes brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni don la reg pa tsam las gzhan mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de ni nye @107b bar gnas pa las byung ba zhes brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni don la reg pa tsam las gzhan mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That mental consciousness should be called â€œarisen from the nearby,â€ because it does not do anything else than merely contact the object.

original: 'das pa la dmigs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'das pa la dmigs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It has only the past as its object.

original: kha cig na re nye bar gnas pa las byung ba de nyid ni ma 'ongs pa la dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re nye bar gnas pa las byung ba de nyid ni ma 'ongs pa la dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Some say: That very consciousness arisen from the nearby does not have the future as its object,

original: de ni thos pa la 'dris pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni thos pa la 'dris pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is familiar with what is heard.

original: gzhan du na de la rnam par shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na de la rnam par shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, consciousness would not arise from it.

original: de ltar byung ba la yang dmigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar byung ba la yang dmigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It also does not have the present as its object,

original: de ni mig la sogs pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: de ni mig la sogs pa'i sgo nas /
translated: because it arises from the eye, etc.,

original: so sor rang rig pa la sogs pa dag la 'byung ba'i phyir de la rtsol ba gdon mi za bar yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: so sor rang rig pa la sogs pa dag la 'byung ba'i phyir de la rtsol ba gdon mi za bar yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: and because it is self-awareness, etc. Therefore, it is certain that it arises from effort.

original: yang kha cig na re gzhan gyi byin gyi rlabs kyis glo bur du pha rol gyi sems la sogs pa mthong ba la 'dun pa la sogs pa med par yang de ltar byung ba la sogs pa la dmigs nas nye bar gnas pa las byung ba yod pas
analyzed: yang kha cig na re gzhan gyi byin gyi rlabs kyis glo bur du pha rol gyi sems la sogs pa mthong ba la 'dun pa la sogs pa med par yang de ltar byung ba la sogs pa la dmigs nas nye bar gnas pa las byung ba yod pas
translated: Some say: It exists because it suddenly occurs through the blessing of another, such as the mind of another, without the desire to see it and so on and it exists through the power of observation.ğŸ”½

original: / de'i phyir bshad pa de ni bzang po ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: / de'i phyir bshad pa de ni bzang po ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: It is not good to explain that way, because there is also that which arises from the ripening cause, since it is observed that some suddenly see the minds of others and so on through the blessing of another, even though they do not have aspiration and so on.

original: yang kha cig na re 'das pa la dmigs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba de ni 'og ma dang sbyar bar bya ste /ğŸ”½'das pa la dmigs pa yin yang /
analyzed: yang kha cig na re 'das pa la dmigs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba de ni 'og ma dang sbyar bar bya ste / 'das pa la dmigs pa yin yang /
translated: Some say: That which focuses on the past alone is to be connected with the latter.

original: da ltar gyi yul can kho na'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu gzhan gyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: da ltar gyi yul can kho na'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu gzhan gyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to zhes zer ro //
translated: Even though it focuses on the past, it is only the domain of the present because it is a different cause.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag gi mjug thogs su byung ba'i yid tshol ba pa ma nges pa ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag gi mjug thogs su byung ba'i yid tshol ba pa ma nges pa ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mental faculty that occurs immediately after the five collections of consciousness is called the indeterminate mental faculty.

original: kha cig na re tshol ba ni 'khor lo dang po la'o ;
analyzed: kha cig na re tshol ba ni 'khor lo dang po la'o ;
translated: Some say: The indeterminate mental faculty is the first wheel.

original: / nges pa ni gnyis pa la sogs pa dag la'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: / nges pa ni gnyis pa la sogs pa dag la'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The second wheel is for those who are definite, and so on.

original: kha cig na re de lta na nges pas 'khor lo dang po spangs par 'gyur bas de'i phyir /
analyzed: kha cig na re de lta na nges pas 'khor lo dang po spangs par 'gyur bas de'i phyir /
translated: Some say: In that case, the first wheel would be abandoned by those who are definite.

original: mjug thogs zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nye ba'i don la bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mjug thogs zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nye ba'i don la bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, the term â€œimmediately afterâ€ should be taken to mean â€œin close proximity.â€

original: yang kha cig na re mjug thogs zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshol ba pa kho na'i don du byas pa yin gyi nges pa dang 'brel pa ni med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang kha cig na re mjug thogs zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshol ba pa kho na'i don du byas pa yin gyi nges pa dang 'brel pa ni med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: The term â€œimmediately afterâ€ is used only in the sense of searching, not in the sense of being related to being definite.

original: de lta na bye brag gi 'bras bu med pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta na bye brag gi 'bras bu med pa yin te /
translated: In that case, there would be no specific result,

original: gzhan du na bye brag 'byung ba med pa'i phyir chu skyar dkar mo bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na bye brag 'byung ba med pa'i phyir chu skyar dkar mo bzhin no //
translated: because otherwise there would be no specific arising, like a white crane.

original: yang na gang yang rung ba'i 'khrul pa yod pas bye brag gi sbyor ba byas so //
analyzed: yang na gang yang rung ba'i 'khrul pa yod pas bye brag gi sbyor ba byas so //
translated: Or else, the specific application is made because there is error in any case.

original: de ltar gyi yul can kho nar zhes bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dra ba la de nyid do zhes rgyun gcig tu byed pas de ltar gyi nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar gyi yul can kho nar zhes bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dra ba la de nyid do zhes rgyun gcig tu byed pas de ltar gyi nyid do //
translated: â€œIn that way, only the subjectâ€ means that what is similar to that is that itself, because it makes a single continuum. Thus, it is just that.

original: kho na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gal te de ni 'das pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kho na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gal te de ni 'das pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word â€œonlyâ€ is because it is also called â€œthat which has the past as its object.â€

original: de la rnam par shes pas ni dngos po mtha' dag gi mtshan nyid rnam par shes par byed do zhes bya ba ni char dbye ba ma byas par rnam par shes pas @108a * //
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pas ni dngos po mtha' dag gi mtshan nyid rnam par shes par byed do zhes bya ba ni char dbye ba ma byas par rnam par shes pas @108a * //
translated: With regard to that, consciousness is the characteristic of the cognition of all things means that without making a distinction, consciousness

original: ni bye brag med par yul mtha' dag gi gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan shes par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ni bye brag med par yul mtha' dag gi gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan shes par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is the cognition of the image of form of all objects without distinction.

original: de nyid rnam par ma gyur pa ni zhes bya ba ni don de la rnam par shes pa 'jug pa ni yid la byed pa la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par ma gyur pa ni zhes bya ba ni don de la rnam par shes pa 'jug pa ni yid la byed pa la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That very thing is unmanifested means that the engagement of consciousness with that object is dependent on attention.

original: rnam par shes par bya ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste zhes bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa'i bye brag gang gis yul rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes par bya ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste zhes bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa'i bye brag gang gis yul rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is called the characteristic of the object of consciousness means that it is the uncommon particular that causes the object to become the domain of the activity of consciousness.

original: de ni yid la byed pas rnam par shes par byed do zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pas de'i rnam par shes par bya ba de gzung nas dngos po rung ba la sems gtod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yid la byed pas rnam par shes par byed do zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pas de'i rnam par shes par bya ba de gzung nas dngos po rung ba la sems gtod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is cognized by mental attention. Mental attention holds that which is to be cognized by it and directs the mind to a suitable object.

original: de ltar 'dzin pa'i rnam pa brjod pa 'di ni rtogs sla par 'gyur bas de ltar brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'dzin pa'i rnam pa brjod pa 'di ni rtogs sla par 'gyur bas de ltar brtags pa yin no //
translated: This explanation of the mode of apprehension is easy to understand, so it is considered in this way.

original: dus mnyam na yang de ni rnam pa de lta bu kho nar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dus mnyam na yang de ni rnam pa de lta bu kho nar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Even if they are simultaneous, they should be viewed in just this way.

original: btsun pa rengs byed la sogs pa dag yid la byed pa ni med pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: btsun pa rengs byed la sogs pa dag yid la byed pa ni med pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The Venerable BhÄviveka and others say that mental attention does not exist at all. That is not reasonable.

original: yul gzhan la gtod pa'i tshe na de'i nus pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gzhan la gtod pa'i tshe na de'i nus pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when the mind is directed to another object, its capacity is seen.

original: de dag gis smras pa tshogs pa nyid sgrub par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa tshogs pa nyid sgrub par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: They say that the collection itself is the agent.

original: bden te chogs pa de nyid kyang yid la byed pa med par ni med do //
analyzed: bden te chogs pa de nyid kyang yid la byed pa med par ni med do //
translated: That is true, but that collection itself does not exist without mental attention.

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis kyang de dang 'byung ba yid la byed pa nye bar gnas par ma gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pas 'dir lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis kyang de dang 'byung ba yid la byed pa nye bar gnas par ma gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pas 'dir lan btab pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One himself has already responded to this, when he said, â€œIf the attention that gives rise to that does not remain near at hand.ğŸ”½â€

original: de ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa'i sa bshad pa'i skabs su yang rdzas gzhan du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa'i sa bshad pa'i skabs su yang rdzas gzhan du bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is also taught as a separate substance in the context of the level that possesses the five collections of consciousness.

original: de nyid la reg pas rig pa gang yin pa ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang gnyi ga las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de nyid la reg pas rig pa gang yin pa ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang gnyi ga las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The defining characteristic of contact is the awareness that occurs through contact with that object, which has the characteristics of being pleasant, unpleasant, or neither.

original: yul sdug pa la sogs par 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ni reg pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: yul sdug pa la sogs par 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ni reg pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The aspect of apprehending an object as pleasant and so on is the intrinsic identity of contact.

original: sdug pa nyid la sogs pa de dag gi bye brag gzhan du bzung ba gang yin pa de ni tshor ba'i gzung ba yin te /
analyzed: sdug pa nyid la sogs pa de dag gi bye brag gzhan du bzung ba gang yin pa de ni tshor ba'i gzung ba yin te /
translated: The specific apprehension of those objects as pleasant and so on is the object of contact.

original: dper na za ba pos yul yid du 'ong ba nyid du 'dzin pa de lta bu ni reg pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na za ba pos yul yid du 'ong ba nyid du 'dzin pa de lta bu ni reg pa yin no //
translated: For example, the act of eating is contact, while the act of enjoying the taste of food is feeling.

original: ji ltar de nyid yid du 'ong bas drangs nas yul de myangs par gyur pa de lta bu ni reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar de nyid yid du 'ong bas drangs nas yul de myangs par gyur pa de lta bu ni reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba yin te /
translated: The feeling that arises from contact is like the experience of the object when one is attracted by its beauty.

original: de gnyis kyi bye brag ni de yin no //ğŸ”½btsun pa dpal 'dzin pa la sogs pa dag rnam par shes pa nyid reg pa yin no zhes zer ba de yang rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi bye brag ni de yin no // btsun pa dpal 'dzin pa la sogs pa dag rnam par shes pa nyid reg pa yin no zhes zer ba de yang rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: This is the difference between the two.ğŸ”½The Bhadanta ÅšrÄ«rÄja and others say that consciousness itself is contact.

original: de dang lhan cig 'byung bar gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig 'byung bar gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not correct, because it is said that contact is simultaneous with feeling.

original: gang zhig gang dang lhan cig 'byung bar @108b gsungs pa de ni de las don gzhan pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang dang lhan cig 'byung bar @108b gsungs pa de ni de las don gzhan pa yin te /
translated: That which is said to be simultaneous with something is different from it,

original: dper na rnam par shes pa de kho na las tshor ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rnam par shes pa de kho na las tshor ba bzhin no //
translated: like feeling, which is simultaneous with consciousness.

original: yang rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa'i zas nyid du gsungs pa 'di'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: yang rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa'i zas nyid du gsungs pa 'di'i yang phyir te /
translated: This is also because contact is said to be a separate nutriment from consciousness,

original: yid la sems pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yid la sems pa bzhin no //
translated: like intention.ğŸ”½Contact is a real entity,

original: yang rag pa ni rdzas su yod pa yin te /
analyzed: yang rag pa ni rdzas su yod pa yin te /
translated: because it is a faculty.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pas sems las byung ba dag tu btags pa'i phyir te 'du shes bzhin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pas sems las byung ba dag tu btags pa'i phyir te 'du shes bzhin no //
translated: because they are designated as mental factors since they are associated with thought, like ideation.

original: ldog pa ni bag yod pa la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: ldog pa ni bag yod pa la sogs pa dag go //
translated: The counterexamples are non-negligence and so on.

original: yang tshor ba dang lhan cig tu sems las byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir te sems pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yang tshor ba dang lhan cig tu sems las byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir te sems pa bzhin no //
translated: They are mental factors because they are concomitant with feeling, like intention.

original: ldog pa ni nam mkha'o //
analyzed: ldog pa ni nam mkha'o //
translated: The counterexamples are space and so on.

original: 'di la lung yang yod de /ğŸ”½mig dang gzugs rnam gnyis la brten nas su //
analyzed: 'di la lung yang yod de / mig dang gzugs rnam gnyis la brten nas su //
translated: There is also scripture:ğŸ”½Two things are the basis for the arising of mental factors:

original: sems las byung ba'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'gyur //
