translated: the eye and form.ğŸ”½Consciousness, contact, ideation,

original: rnam shes reg pa sems pa 'du shes dang // 'du byed gtogs rnams rgyur bcas lhan cig tu'o //
analyzed: rnam shes reg pa sems pa 'du shes dang // 'du byed gtogs rnams rgyur bcas lhan cig tu'o //
translated: volition, and all the aggregates associated with consciousness arise simultaneously with their causes.

original: zhes tshigs su bcad pa las gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes tshigs su bcad pa las gsungs so //
translated: This is stated in the verse.

original: btsun pa dpal 'dzin ni tshigs su bcad pa de la 'di skad du /
analyzed: btsun pa dpal 'dzin ni tshigs su bcad pa de la 'di skad du /
translated: Bhadanta ÅšrÄ«dhara explains this verse as follows:

original: der ni sems las byung ba rnams rim gyis 'byung ba'i don du gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: der ni sems las byung ba rnams rim gyis 'byung ba'i don du gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the verse is that mental factors arise sequentially.

original: rnam par shes pa bstan pa'i phyir ba'am /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bstan pa'i phyir ba'am /
translated: The verse is stated to demonstrate consciousness.

original: med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mental factors do not occur if the contact does not exist.

original: de las byung ba'i phyir mig dang gzugs dag las rnam par shes pa'i reg pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i phyir mig dang gzugs dag las rnam par shes pa'i reg pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The contact of consciousness arises from the eye and form.

original: de nas sems pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba rnams kyang lhan cig tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de nas sems pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba rnams kyang lhan cig tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Then, the mental factors such as intention arise simultaneously with the mind.

original: de ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni mi rung ste /
translated: This is not correct.

original: der bcom ldan 'das kyis gnyis la brten nas sems las byung ba rnams 'byung ngo zhes gsal bar gsungs kyi gsum zhes ma gsungs pas /
analyzed: der bcom ldan 'das kyis gnyis la brten nas sems las byung ba rnams 'byung ngo zhes gsal bar gsungs kyi gsum zhes ma gsungs pas /
translated: The Blessed One clearly stated that the mental factors arise in dependence on two factors, but he did not say that they arise in dependence on three factors.

original: de'i phyir 'dir sgro btags te reg par bshad pa ni cir yang mi rung ngo /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir sgro btags te reg par bshad pa ni cir yang mi rung ngo /
translated: Therefore, it is not correct to superimpose contact here and explain it as a mental factor.

original: rnam par shes pa bstan pa dang / med na mi 'byung nyid kyang gnod pa med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bstan pa dang / med na mi 'byung nyid kyang gnod pa med pa kho na yin te /
translated: The teaching of consciousness and the non-occurrence of contact are not contradicted.

original: kho bo yang rnam par shes pa med na reg pa mi 'byung ngo zhes smras te de la ci zhig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: kho bo yang rnam par shes pa med na reg pa mi 'byung ngo zhes smras te de la ci zhig tu 'gyur /
translated: We also say that if consciousness does not exist, contact does not occur. What is the problem with that?

original: lhan cig tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'di ni lung yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'di ni lung yin no //
translated: The term â€œarising togetherâ€ is a scriptural statement.

original: kun tu 'gro ba dag gi rigs pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa'i skabs su smras zin to //
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba dag gi rigs pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa'i skabs su smras zin to //
translated: The reasonings for the universal mental factors have already been explained in the section on the five collections of consciousness.

original: 'phags pa mang pos bkur ba la sogs pa dag shes rab la sogs pa dag sa chen po pa yin par smra ba dag gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa mang pos bkur ba la sogs pa dag shes rab la sogs pa dag sa chen po pa yin par smra ba dag gi phyir smras pa /
translated: The noble Saá¹ƒmitÄ«yas and so on assert that wisdom and so on are great grounds.

original: sems dmigs pa la bul bar 'jug pa na las mi dmigs pa'i phyir dad pa bzhin du shes pa med de /ğŸ”½de'i phyir shes @109a * //
analyzed: sems dmigs pa la bul bar 'jug pa na las mi dmigs pa'i phyir dad pa bzhin du shes pa med de / de'i phyir shes @109a * //
translated: When the mind engages its object slowly, it is not wisdom because it does not apprehend its object as it does faith.

original: rab ni sa chen po ma yin no //
analyzed: rab ni sa chen po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore wisdom is not a great ground.

original: de bzhin du sems the tshom dang ldan na yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems the tshom dang ldan na yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Similarly, when the mind is associated with doubt, it is not wisdom.

original: dran pa ni 'dris pa la dmigs pa yin par gnyi ga la yang grub pa //
analyzed: dran pa ni 'dris pa la dmigs pa yin par gnyi ga la yang grub pa //
translated: It is established for both of us that mindfulness focuses on familiar objects.

original: de las gzhan pa'i dmigs pa la ni lung yang med la rigs pa yang med do //ğŸ”½gal te nyams su myong bar dran pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dmigs pa la ni lung yang med la rigs pa yang med do // gal te nyams su myong bar dran pa med do zhe na /
translated: There is no scripture or reasoning for it to focus on other objects.ğŸ”½If you say that it does not remember what was experienced,

original: dran pa nyid kyis nyams su myong ngo zhes bya ba de yang ga la yod /
analyzed: dran pa nyid kyis nyams su myong ngo zhes bya ba de yang ga la yod /
translated: how can it be said that mindfulness itself experiences?

original: mi mthun pa'i dngos po la 'dod pa yang ga la yod /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i dngos po la 'dod pa yang ga la yod /
translated: How could there be desire for a non-concordant object?

original: ma nges pa'i don la mos pa yang ga la yod /
analyzed: ma nges pa'i don la mos pa yang ga la yod /
translated: How could there be aspiration for a meaning that is not ascertained?

original: btsun pa 'dus bzang ni nges pa'i don la mos par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: btsun pa 'dus bzang ni nges pa'i don la mos par mi 'dod de /
translated: Bhadanta Saá¹ƒghabhadra does not assert that aspiration is for a meaning that is ascertained,

original: de ni mdo sde dang bstan bcos dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de ni mdo sde dang bstan bcos dang 'gal lo //
translated: because that contradicts the sÅ«tras and treatises.

original: mdo sde las ni bdag gis sems ni ci nas kyang skye mched drug po 'di dag la bdag med par mos so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mdo sde las ni bdag gis sems ni ci nas kyang skye mched drug po 'di dag la bdag med par mos so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The sÅ«tras state, â€œI aspire that my mind will not be attached to these six sense bases as a self.â€

original: gro bzhin skyes kyi mdo las kyang nges pa kho na yin par gsungs kyi 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bkag go //
analyzed: gro bzhin skyes kyi mdo las kyang nges pa kho na yin par gsungs kyi 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bkag go //
translated: The SÅ«tra on Jyotiá¹£ka also states that it is definite, but it does not say that it is desire.

original: bstan bcos las kyang mos pa ni dmigs pa yin no zhes 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos las kyang mos pa ni dmigs pa yin no zhes 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The treatises also state that the object of aspiration is the object of concentration.

original: ci ste de gnyi ga yang dran pa'i don yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste de gnyi ga yang dran pa'i don yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that both are the object of memory,

original: 'o na ni don rang gi 'dun pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'o na ni don rang gi 'dun pa nyid do //
translated: then the object is oneâ€™s own aspiration.

original: de lta bas na kun du 'gro ba ni lnga kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na kun du 'gro ba ni lnga kho na'o //
translated: Therefore the omnipresent mental factors are only five.

original: tshor bas las ci byed ce na /
analyzed: tshor bas las ci byed ce na /
translated: What function does feeling have?

original: srid pa skye ba dang btang snyoms su 'jog pa'i las byed do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: srid pa skye ba dang btang snyoms su 'jog pa'i las byed do zhes bya ba la /
translated: It has the function of producing existence and of maintaining equanimity.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba ni phrad par sred pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba ni phrad par sred pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Pleasant feeling is the cause of craving for contact.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni 'bral bar srid pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni 'bral bar srid pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Painful feeling is the cause of craving for separation.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni gnyi ga med cing bar mdor gnas pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni gnyi ga med cing bar mdor gnas pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling has the characteristic of remaining in a state that is neither of those two.

original: btang snyoms su 'jog pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: btang snyoms su 'jog pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: It is the cause of maintaining equanimity.

original: 'o na sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'i ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'i ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the intrinsic nature of neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling?

original: ci'i phyir som nyi za ba 'di ltar sems las byung ba rnams kyi 'jug pa ni so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir som nyi za ba 'di ltar sems las byung ba rnams kyi 'jug pa ni so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin te /
translated: Why is there doubt? The engagement of mental factors is to be known by each one personally.

original: 'di ltar bde ba'i tshor ba ni sim par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bde ba'i tshor ba ni sim par byed pa yin la /
translated: Thus, pleasant feeling is soothing,

original: sdug bsngal ni gdung bar byed pa yin na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni gdung bar byed pa yin na /
translated: and painful feeling is painful.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i byed pa gang yin par bzung ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i byed pa gang yin par bzung ste /
translated: and that which is neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: de'i phyir de ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal med pa tsam yin par rtogs pas de lta bas na gnyi ga bkag par bstan pa yin no zhes grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal med pa tsam yin par rtogs pas de lta bas na gnyi ga bkag par bstan pa yin no zhes grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, since it is understood that it is the mere absence of pleasure and pain, it is taught that both are negated.

original: kye reg pa dang sems pa la sogs pa dag ji ltar so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin pa dang / ci de dag kyang med pa yin nam je smros shig de'i las ni sngar yang cung @109b zad smras mos kyi gsal bar 'og nas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: kye reg pa dang sems pa la sogs pa dag ji ltar so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin pa dang / ci de dag kyang med pa yin nam je smros shig de'i las ni sngar yang cung @109b zad smras mos kyi gsal bar 'og nas brjod par bya'o //
translated: Oh, how are contact, intention, etc. to be known by each one for himself? Are they also nonexistent? Tell us! We have already said something about their function, but we will clarify it later.

original: gnyi ga bkag tu zin kyang mi gnag mi dkar ba'i las gzhan du de yang med pa tsam ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga bkag tu zin kyang mi gnag mi dkar ba'i las gzhan du de yang med pa tsam ma yin no //
translated: Even though both pleasure and pain are negated, there is another action that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant, and it is not merely nonexistent.

original: gzhan yang 'di la mang po dag the tshom za bas na de'i phyir btang snyoms 'di ni lung dang / rigs pa dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / dmigs pa dang / gnas skabs dang / bag la nyal ba dang / rnam pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di la mang po dag the tshom za bas na de'i phyir btang snyoms 'di ni lung dang / rigs pa dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / dmigs pa dang / gnas skabs dang / bag la nyal ba dang / rnam pa dang /
translated: Moreover, since many have doubts about this equanimity, it should be understood through scripture, logic, cause, effect, focal object, occasion, latent tendency, aspect,

original: ngo bo nyid dang rab tu dbye ba dag gis go sla bar bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang rab tu dbye ba dag gis go sla bar bya'o //
translated: nature and classification.ğŸ”½Regarding that, the scripture states:

original: de la lung ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba myong ba ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba myong ngo zhes bya ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so zhes gsungs
analyzed: de la lung ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba myong ba ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba myong ngo zhes bya ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so zhes gsungs
translated: The experience of neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling is the correct knowledge that the experience of neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling is as it is.

original: pa dang / yang sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa la brten nas sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du de bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal yang spangs te /
analyzed: pa dang / yang sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa la brten nas sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du de bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal yang spangs te /
translated: and â€œhaving abandoned pleasure, abandoned pain,

original: snga nas yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba yang nub pas bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin ba btang snyoms dang / dran pa yongs su dag ba bsam gtan bzhi pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: snga nas yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba yang nub pas bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin ba btang snyoms dang / dran pa yongs su dag ba bsam gtan bzhi pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: and previously having removed joy and sorrow, he dwells having attained the fourth meditation, which is neither painful nor pleasant and is accompanied by pure mindfulness.â€

original: rigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the reasoning?

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs kyi sems ni tshor ba'i rdzas dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs kyi sems ni tshor ba'i rdzas dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
translated: The mind in the state that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant is concomitant with a substance that is a feeling.

original: sems yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is a mind.

original: bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems bzhin no //
analyzed: bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems bzhin no //
translated: like the mind that is concomitant with pleasure.

original: chos mi mthun pa ni gzugs so //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa ni gzugs so //
translated: The example of form is dissimilar.

original: yang na tshor ba btang snyoms ni rdzas su yod pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na tshor ba btang snyoms ni rdzas su yod pa yin te /
translated: Or else, the feeling of equanimity is a real entity,

original: gsum du bgrang ba las 'byung ba'i phyir te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gsum du bgrang ba las 'byung ba'i phyir te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: because it is counted as one of the three, just as the previous feeling was.

original: yid kyi sa'i skabs su yang tshor ba med na sems 'byung ba yang med do zhes shes par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi sa'i skabs su yang tshor ba med na sems 'byung ba yang med do zhes shes par byas pa yin no //
translated: And in the section on the mental faculty, it is understood that if there were no feeling, there would be no mental factors.

original: sems can thams cad ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang ldan pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang ldan pa ma yin pas /
translated: Since all sentient beings are not endowed with pleasure and pain,

original: de'i phyir btang snyoms ni rdzas su yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir btang snyoms ni rdzas su yod pa yin te /
translated: therefore equanimity is a real entity.

original: lung ni yod pa nyid tsam du bstan pas mthu zad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: lung ni yod pa nyid tsam du bstan pas mthu zad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The scriptures do not lose their power by merely teaching the existence of equanimity.

original: 'di ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i tshig yod pas na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i tshig yod pas na /
translated: Since the statement â€œIt occurs in this wayâ€ exists,

original: de'i rgyu ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa mong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa mong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: the cause of that is contact that is neither pleasure nor pain, as the BhagavÄn said.

original: de'i phyir myong bar 'gyur ba de las byung bar gsungs pas na de'i rdzas nyid @110a * //ğŸ”½du yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir myong bar 'gyur ba de las byung bar gsungs pas na de'i rdzas nyid @110a * // du yod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, since it is said that the result arises from that which is to be experienced, it exists as a substance.

original: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba las bde ba yod par gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba las bde ba yod par gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as it is said that pleasure exists because there is the experience of pleasure.

original: 'bras bu ni mi 'bral bar sred pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni mi 'bral bar sred pa yin no //
translated: The result is craving for non-separation.

original: dmigs pa ni phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa las bzlog pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa las bzlog pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The object is the characteristic of that which is to be experienced, which is the opposite of benefit and harm.

original: dmigs pa'i dngos po'i cha 'ga' zhig yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i dngos po'i cha 'ga' zhig yin no //
translated: It is a part of the entity of the object.

original: gnas skabs ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po la phan pa dang gnod pa las bzlog pa'i lus dang sems kyi gnas skabs dag go //
analyzed: gnas skabs ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po la phan pa dang gnod pa las bzlog pa'i lus dang sems kyi gnas skabs dag go //
translated: The state is the state of body and mind, which is the opposite of benefit and harm to the great elements of the sense faculties.

original: bag la nyal ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la ni gti mug bag la nyal lo zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la ni gti mug bag la nyal lo zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: The latent tendency is the latent tendency to delusion in the feeling that is neither suffering nor pleasure, as it is said.

original: rnam pa ni ji skad smos pa'i dngos po'i gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni ji skad smos pa'i dngos po'i gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: The aspect is the arising of the aspect of the reflection of the entity as described.

original: ngo bo nyid ni bde ba dang mi bde ba'i mtha'i phyogs su ltung ba dang bral ba ste //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni bde ba dang mi bde ba'i mtha'i phyogs su ltung ba dang bral ba ste //
translated: Its nature is free from falling into the extremes of pleasure and pain.ğŸ”½

original: bar ma dor gnas pa'i so sor rig pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: bar ma dor gnas pa'i so sor rig pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: Its nature is the experience of the intrinsic nature of the feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant, which is free from falling to an extreme of pleasantness or unpleasantness.

original: / rab tu dbye ba ni slob dpon gyis bye brag med par bstan kyang btang snyoms ni bar ma dor gnas pa'i don gyis rnam pa gcig pa yang yod do //
analyzed: / rab tu dbye ba ni slob dpon gyis bye brag med par bstan kyang btang snyoms ni bar ma dor gnas pa'i don gyis rnam pa gcig pa yang yod do //
translated: Its classification is as follows: Although the Master taught equanimity without differentiation, there is one type that is the meaning of abiding in the middle.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis ni rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis ni rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: There are two types by the differentiation of affliction and purification.

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis ni rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis ni rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: There are three types by the differentiation of virtue and so on.

original: brtson 'grus kyi btang snyoms dang / tsher ba'i btang snyoms dang ; yan lag drug gi btang snyoms dang / tshangs par gnas pa'i btang snyoms dang / byang chub kyi yan lag gi btang snyoms dang / 'du byed kyi btang snyoms dang / lhag mthong gi btang snyoms dang /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi btang snyoms dang / tsher ba'i btang snyoms dang ; yan lag drug gi btang snyoms dang / tshangs par gnas pa'i btang snyoms dang / byang chub kyi yan lag gi btang snyoms dang / 'du byed kyi btang snyoms dang / lhag mthong gi btang snyoms dang /
translated: equanimity of effort, equanimity of sensation, equanimity of the six limbs, equanimity of the Brahma abodes, equanimity of the factors of enlightenment, equanimity of the formative forces, equanimity of insight,

original: bar ma dor gnas pa'i btang snyoms dang / bsam gtan gyi btang snyoms dang / yongs su dag pa'i btang snyoms kyi bar dag gis rnam pa bcu'o //ğŸ”½de la brtson 'grus kyi btang snyoms ni ha cang yang mi 'grus /
analyzed: bar ma dor gnas pa'i btang snyoms dang / bsam gtan gyi btang snyoms dang / yongs su dag pa'i btang snyoms kyi bar dag gis rnam pa bcu'o // de la brtson 'grus kyi btang snyoms ni ha cang yang mi 'grus /
translated: equanimity of the intermediate state, equanimity of the meditative concentration, and equanimity of complete purity.

original: ha cang yang mi lhod pa'i brtson 'grus su bgrang ste /ğŸ”½de'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: ha cang yang mi lhod pa'i brtson 'grus su bgrang ste / de'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Equanimity of effort is the effort that is neither too intense nor too lax.ğŸ”½With reference to this, it is said:

original: de dus dus su btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma sgom par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de dus dus su btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma sgom par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: â€œFrom time to time, he cultivates the signless equanimity.â€

original: tshor ba btang snyoms ni ji skad smos pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba btang snyoms ni ji skad smos pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: Equanimity of sensation is that which has the characteristics that have been mentioned.

original: de'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In consideration of that, it is said:

original: gang gi tshe de'i sems 'dod pa na btang snyoms dang ldan par 'byung bar gyur pa zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de'i sems 'dod pa na btang snyoms dang ldan par 'byung bar gyur pa zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: When his mind becomes indifferent to desire.

original: yan lag drug gi btang snyoms ni rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba @110b spangs pa'i dgra bcom pa 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i yul drug dang nye bar gyur cing /
analyzed: yan lag drug gi btang snyoms ni rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba @110b spangs pa'i dgra bcom pa 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i yul drug dang nye bar gyur cing /
translated: The equanimity of the six limbs is the nature of the arhat who has abandoned attachment and anger, and who is indifferent to the six objects of desire and the six objects of non-desire.

original: yongs su dag pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po yang de'i rnam pa yod pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po yang de'i rnam pa yod pa ste /
translated: It is also the nature of the purity of the six sense faculties.ğŸ”½In consideration of that, it is said:

original: de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di la dge slong zag pa zad pa ni mig gis gzugs rnams mthong na yid bde bar yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di la dge slong zag pa zad pa ni mig gis gzugs rnams mthong na yid bde bar yang mi 'gyur /
translated: Here, the monk who has exhausted the defilements, when he sees forms with the eye, does not become happy,

original: yid mi bde bar yang mi 'gyur zhing btang snyoms su gnas te dran pa dang shes pa bzhin can yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yid mi bde bar yang mi 'gyur zhing btang snyoms su gnas te dran pa dang shes pa bzhin can yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: does not become unhappy, but remains equanimous, mindful and fully aware.

original: tshangs pa'i gnas pa'i btang snyoms ni gnod sems dang 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi mtha' las dben zhing bar ma dor gnas pa nye bar sgrub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas pa'i btang snyoms ni gnod sems dang 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi mtha' las dben zhing bar ma dor gnas pa nye bar sgrub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The equanimity of the Brahma abodes is characterized by the attainment of a state of neutrality that is free from the extremes of malice and attachment to sense objects.

original: de'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With reference to that, it is said:

original: btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i sems kyis phyogs gcig tu mos te /
analyzed: btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i sems kyis phyogs gcig tu mos te /
translated: With a mind endowed with equanimity, one focuses on one side,

original: khyab par byas nas rdzogs par byas te gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: khyab par byas nas rdzogs par byas te gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: pervades it, and remains in that state.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag gi btang snyoms ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams kyi bar ma dor gnas pa'i rnam par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag gi btang snyoms ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams kyi bar ma dor gnas pa'i rnam par gyur pa ste /
translated: The equanimity of the branches of enlightenment is a state of neutrality that occurs in relation to the coemergent phenomena.

original: de'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With reference to that, it is said:

original: btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag sgom par byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag sgom par byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: One cultivates the branch of enlightenment of equanimity.

original: 'du byed kyi btang snyoms ni sgrib pa la sogs pa la so sor rtog cing dbyibs su mi 'dzin par bar ma dor gnas par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi btang snyoms ni sgrib pa la sogs pa la so sor rtog cing dbyibs su mi 'dzin par bar ma dor gnas par gyur pa ste /
translated: The equanimity of formative factors is a state of neutrality that occurs in relation to the discernment of obscurations, etc., without grasping them in terms of their shape.

original: de'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With reference to that,

original: de dang de dag las zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi phyogs ni btang snyoms zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te //
analyzed: de dang de dag las zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi phyogs ni btang snyoms zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te //
translated: it is said, â€œThe factors of serenity and insight in those and those are called equanimity.â€

original: de'i rnam par mang du yod kyang 'dir bye brag med par byas te bzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam par mang du yod kyang 'dir bye brag med par byas te bzhag pa yin no //
translated: Although it has many aspects, here it is presented without distinction.

original: lhag mthong gi btang snyoms ni spong ba'i las kyi mjug thogs su bar mdo'i las la gnas par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi btang snyoms ni spong ba'i las kyi mjug thogs su bar mdo'i las la gnas par gyur pa ste /
translated: The equanimity of insight is the attainment of equanimity after abandoning the object of the action of rejection and abiding in the action of the middle.

original: de'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With reference to that,

original: gang yod pa dang ; gang byung ba de spong bar byed cing btang snyoms bar thob par byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang yod pa dang ; gang byung ba de spong bar byed cing btang snyoms bar thob par byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, â€œWhatever exists and whatever arises, he abandons it and attains equanimity.â€

original: de la bar ma dor gnas pa'i btang snyoms lhan cig skyes pa'i chos rnams mnyam du 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de la bar ma dor gnas pa'i btang snyoms lhan cig skyes pa'i chos rnams mnyam du 'jug pa ste /
translated: In that, the equanimity of abiding in the middle is the simultaneous engagement of the dharmas that are coemergent.

original: de'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With reference to that,ğŸ”½it is said,

original: 'dun pa la sogs pa spong ba'i 'du byed rnams kyi bar ma dor gnas par gyur pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi bar ma dor gnas pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dun pa la sogs pa spong ba'i 'du byed rnams kyi bar ma dor gnas par gyur pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi bar ma dor gnas pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The equanimity of the meditative development of the factors that contribute to enlightenment is the absence of the mental attention associated with the notional attachment to the signs of all meditative development.

original: bsam gtan gyi btang snyoms ni bde ba'i snying po la yang phyogs su ltung ba mi skyed pa ste /ğŸ”½de'i dbang du mdzad nas dran pa dang ldan par btang snyoms su gnas pa yin no zhes gsungs so //ğŸ”½yongs su dag pa'i @111a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi btang snyoms ni bde ba'i snying po la yang phyogs su ltung ba mi skyed pa ste / de'i dbang du mdzad nas dran pa dang ldan par btang snyoms su gnas pa yin no zhes gsungs so // yongs su dag pa'i @111a * //
translated: The equanimity of the meditative absorption is the absence of the mental attention associated with the signs of the pleasure of the meditative absorption.ğŸ”½The equanimity of purification is the absence of the mental attention associated with the signs of the counteragent and the counteracted.ğŸ”½The equanimity of the absence of mental attention is the absence of the mental attention associated with the signs of all things.ğŸ”½The equanimity of the absence of conceptual differentiation is the absence of the mental attention associated with the signs of the absence of mental attention itself.

original: btang snyoms ni mthun pa thams cad yongs su dag cing mi mthun pa nye bar zhi ba la spyad pa med par gyur pa ste /ğŸ”½de'i dbang du mdzad nas /ğŸ”½btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni mthun pa thams cad yongs su dag cing mi mthun pa nye bar zhi ba la spyad pa med par gyur pa ste / de'i dbang du mdzad nas / btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: The equanimity of the sphere of totalization is the absence of the mental attention associated with the signs of the absence of conceptual differentiation itself.ğŸ”½The equanimity of the sphere of the inestimable is the absence of the mental attention associated with the signs of the sphere of totalization itself.ğŸ”½The equanimity of the sphere of the inestimable is the absence of the mental attention associated with the signs of the sphere of totalization itself.ğŸ”½The equanimity of the sphere of the inestimable is the absence of the mental attention associated with the signs of the sphere of the inestimable itself.ğŸ”½The equanimity of the sphere of the inestimable is the absence of the mental attention associated with the signs of the sphere of the inestimable itself.ğŸ”½The equanimity of the sphere of the inestimable is the absence of the mental attention associated with the signs of the sphere of the inestimable itself.ğŸ”½The equanimity of the sphere of the inestimable is the absence of the mental attention associated with the signs of the sphere of the inestimable itself.ğŸ”½The equanimity of the sphere of the inestimable is the absence of the mental attention associated with the signs of the sphere of the inestimable itself.ğŸ”½The equanimity of the sphere of the inestimable is the absence of the mental attention associated with the signs of the sphere of the inestimable itself.ğŸ”½The equanimity of the sphere of the inestimable is the absence of the mental attention associated with the signs of the sphere of the inestimable itself.ğŸ”½The equanimity of the sphere of the inestimable is the absence of the mental attention associated with the signs of the sphere of the inestimable itself.

original: dag thams cad kyang shes rab dang tshor ba dang 'du byed kyi btang snyoms kyi bye brag gis ni rnam pa gsum du zad do //
analyzed: dag thams cad kyang shes rab dang tshor ba dang 'du byed kyi btang snyoms kyi bye brag gis ni rnam pa gsum du zad do //
translated: The equanimity of the sphere of the inestimable is the absence of the mental attention associated with the signs of the sphere of the inestimable itself.ğŸ”½The

original: de la dus gsum rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'chi 'pho dang skye ba'o zhes bya ba des phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnams 'byung ba'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir dus rnams dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la dus gsum rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'chi 'pho dang skye ba'o zhes bya ba des phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnams 'byung ba'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir dus rnams dang sbyar ro //
translated: Death and birth are mentioned in order to connect the times with the arising of internal and external things.

original: yang gzhan dag na re de las gzhan pa btags pa'i chos rnams ni ma gtogs so zhes smos pa de dag kyang gang zhe na zhes bya ba de'i phyir 'dir dus la sogs pa dag brtsams so zhes zer ro /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag na re de las gzhan pa btags pa'i chos rnams ni ma gtogs so zhes smos pa de dag kyang gang zhe na zhes bya ba de'i phyir 'dir dus la sogs pa dag brtsams so zhes zer ro /
translated: Others say that the present treatise is composed in order to explain what those other than the aggregates are, since it is said that the other imputed things are excluded.

original: de lta na da ltar byung ba'i tshig kyang 'bras bu med pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta na da ltar byung ba'i tshig kyang 'bras bu med pa yin la /
translated: In that case, the present expression would be pointless.

original: btags pa'i yod pa gzhan dag kyang ci'i phyir ma smos zhes bya ba la sogs par brjod par bya ba mang du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: btags pa'i yod pa gzhan dag kyang ci'i phyir ma smos zhes bya ba la sogs par brjod par bya ba mang du 'byung ngo //
translated: And there would be many expressions such as, â€œWhy are the other imputed things not mentioned?â€

original: sa bon rnams ni chos de las tha mi dad pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa bon rnams ni chos de las tha mi dad pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The seeds are not different from those things.

original: kha cig na re sa bon gyi rten rnam par shes pa'am gzugs 'das pa de la ni sa bon yang 'das pa yin par gzhag gi rang las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re sa bon gyi rten rnam par shes pa'am gzugs 'das pa de la ni sa bon yang 'das pa yin par gzhag gi rang las ni ma yin te /
translated: Some say: The seed is posited as past in dependence on the consciousness or form that is the basis of the seed, but not from its own side,

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½de yang 'bras bu ma byin pa'i sa bon gyi dbang du byas te brjod pa yin no zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro // de yang 'bras bu ma byin pa'i sa bon gyi dbang du byas te brjod pa yin no zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: because it would not have the characteristics of a conditioned state.ğŸ”½And this is stated from the perspective of a seed that has not yet yielded a result.

original: 'bras bu ma byin las zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma byin las zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: To prove that, he says, â€œfrom that which has not yet yielded a result.â€

original: 'bras bu byin pa'i sngon la ni de lta bur rnam par gzhag pa med de /
analyzed: 'bras bu byin pa'i sngon la ni de lta bur rnam par gzhag pa med de /
translated: Prior to yielding a result, it is not posited in that way,

original: de med kyang rten ni da ltar gyi yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de med kyang rten ni da ltar gyi yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because even though it does not exist, the basis is present,

original: skyes zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has already arisen.

original: de'i tshe na sa bon ni 'das pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe na sa bon ni 'das pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: At that time, the seed is past.

original: yang kha cig na re de lta na 'bras bu ma byin pa zhes bya ba de tsam zhig brjod par bya bar zad na de'i phyir /
analyzed: yang kha cig na re de lta na 'bras bu ma byin pa zhes bya ba de tsam zhig brjod par bya bar zad na de'i phyir /
translated: Some say: In that case, it would be sufficient to say â€œfrom that which has not yet yielded a result,â€ğŸ”½but to say â€œfrom that which has not yet yielded a resultâ€ is not correct.

original: 'bras bu byin ma byin pa las zhes bya bas ni sa bon rnams 'das pa la sogs pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa cig shos 'di bstan no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu byin ma byin pa las zhes bya bas ni sa bon rnams 'das pa la sogs pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa cig shos 'di bstan no zhes zer ro //
translated: The phrase â€œin virtue of giving or not giving an effectâ€ indicates the other way of positing the past, etc., in terms of seeds.

original: yang kha cig na re de lta na yang 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra brjod par bya dgos pas /
analyzed: yang kha cig na re de lta na yang 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra brjod par bya dgos pas /
translated: Some say that even so, the word â€œorâ€ must be stated.

original: de'i phyir de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, that is not reasonable.

original: yang kha cig na re thams cad ltar yang nyes pa med de /
analyzed: yang kha cig na re thams cad ltar yang nyes pa med de /
translated: Others say that there is no fault in any of these positions.

original: re zhig phyogs snga mas kyang 'bras bu ma byin pa las zhes res par brjod dgos te /
analyzed: re zhig phyogs snga mas kyang 'bras bu ma byin pa las zhes res par brjod dgos te /
translated: First, the opponent must state the phrase â€œin virtue of not giving an effect.â€

original: de'i 'das pa nyid ni 'bras @111b bu ma byin pa kho na'i phyir ro zhes shes bar bya dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'das pa nyid ni 'bras @111b bu ma byin pa kho na'i phyir ro zhes shes bar bya dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the past of that seed is known only in virtue of not giving an effect.

original: gnyis pa'i yang 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra med kyang sbyor ba yod de /ğŸ”½dper na // 'jig rten na yang 'gro 'ong sgyel 'dug pa //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i yang 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra med kyang sbyor ba yod de / dper na // 'jig rten na yang 'gro 'ong sgyel 'dug pa //
translated: In the second position, even though the word â€œorâ€ is not stated, the sense of â€œorâ€ is present.

original: ji ltar 'dod bzhin byos zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod bzhin byos zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
translated: For example, in the world, one says, â€œGo or come, lie down or sit, do whatever you wish.â€

original: rgyu yod pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas rnam par gcod pa ste ;
analyzed: rgyu yod pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas rnam par gcod pa ste ;
translated: The phrase â€œwhen there is a causeâ€ excludes the unconditioned.

original: dus de dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus de dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For those times are distinguished by the characteristics of conditioned states.

original: ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni skye ba la sogs pa dag ston te /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni skye ba la sogs pa dag ston te /
translated: How are they established? The phrase â€œwhen there is birthâ€ and so on indicates birth and so forth.

original: 'dir yang snga ma kho na bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang snga ma kho na bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: Here, too, the phrase should be connected as before.

original: kha cig na re sa bon rnams kyis skye ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyud thams cad la zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems dang mtshungs par ston to zhes zer ro //ğŸ”½yang kha cig na re gang las skye ba de sa bon yin par ston te zhes bya ba des na /
analyzed: kha cig na re sa bon rnams kyis skye ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyud thams cad la zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems dang mtshungs par ston to zhes zer ro // yang kha cig na re gang las skye ba de sa bon yin par ston te zhes bya ba des na /
translated: Some say that the establishment of birth and so on by means of seeds is indicated by the phrase â€œin all the streams of consciousnessâ€ and so on.

original: de'i phyir rgyu yod la zhes smras pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu yod la zhes smras pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the phrase â€œthat from which something arises is its seedâ€ indicates that the phrase â€œwhen there is a causeâ€ refers to the causal condition.

original: rkyan yod la zhes bya ba ni sa bon ma nyams pa la bya ste /
analyzed: rkyan yod la zhes bya ba ni sa bon ma nyams pa la bya ste /
translated: The phrase â€œwhen there is a conditionâ€ refers to the non-deterioration of the seed.

original: des ni rgyu'i rkyen bstan to /
analyzed: des ni rgyu'i rkyen bstan to /
translated: This indicates the causal condition.

original: rkyen gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba ni rkyen gzhan gsum gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba ni rkyen gzhan gsum gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: â€œDue to the power of conditionsâ€ means due to the power of the other three conditions.

original: dang po chos gang 'byung ba de ni zhes bya ba ni rgyud kyi skad cig dang po 'byung ba la skye ba zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: dang po chos gang 'byung ba de ni zhes bya ba ni rgyud kyi skad cig dang po 'byung ba la skye ba zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: â€œThe first arising of any dharmaâ€ refers to the arising of the first moment of a continuum.

original: de'i phyir rgyud snga ma 'byung ba la zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyud snga ma 'byung ba la zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, â€œthe arising of a previous continuum.â€

original: skyes ma thag pa'i skye ba tsam gyi skad cig rjes su 'jug pa ni gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni skad cig gnas pa las bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes ma thag pa'i skye ba tsam gyi skad cig rjes su 'jug pa ni gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni skad cig gnas pa las bsams pa yin no //
translated: â€œThe mere arising of what has arisen, the subsequent continuation of that is enduranceâ€ is from the perspective of the endurance of a moment.

original: gzhan dag na skad cig gnas pa mi 'dod pas tshig 'di rgyun gyi gnas pa kho na yin par yongs su sgyur par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag na skad cig gnas pa mi 'dod pas tshig 'di rgyun gyi gnas pa kho na yin par yongs su sgyur par byed do //
translated: Others, not accepting the endurance of a moment, transform this statement into the endurance of a continuum.

original: de rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba tsam gyi rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa la bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba tsam gyi rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa la bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: â€œIts subsequent continuationâ€ should be taken to mean the uninterrupted continuation of the mere arising of that.

original: de lta na skye ba tsam zhes bya ba'i tshig lhag par gyur pas de'i phyir skad cig gnas pa kho na yin par 'dod par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta na skye ba tsam zhes bya ba'i tshig lhag par gyur pas de'i phyir skad cig gnas pa kho na yin par 'dod par bya ste /
translated: Thus, the phrase â€œmere arisingâ€ would be redundant. Therefore, it should be accepted that the characteristic of the conditioned is â€œto exist for just an instant.â€

original: 'di ltar de dang de dag las kyang de'i mtshan nyid kho na yin par bshad do //ğŸ”½'dir rgyun gyi gnas pa ni gnas rnam pa lnga po skad cig gnas pa dang / rgyun gyi gnas pa dang / rkyen la rag las pa'i gnas pa dang / mi g-yeng ba'i gnas pa dang / rnam par gzhag pa'i gnas pa dag ni rab tu dbye ba 'ba' zhig tu gsungs par zad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dang de dag las kyang de'i mtshan nyid kho na yin par bshad do // 'dir rgyun gyi gnas pa ni gnas rnam pa lnga po skad cig gnas pa dang / rgyun gyi gnas pa dang / rkyen la rag las pa'i gnas pa dang / mi g-yeng ba'i gnas pa dang / rnam par gzhag pa'i gnas pa dag ni rab tu dbye ba 'ba' zhig tu gsungs par zad do //
translated: In this way, the characteristic of the conditioned is explained as â€œto exist for just an instantâ€ in the following passage:ğŸ”½â€œWhat is arising? It is the initial production of something that was not previously existent. What is passing away? It is the destruction of something that was previously existent. What is enduring? It is the continuity of something that was previously existent. What is aging? It is the alteration of something that was previously existent.â€

original: rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las ni snga na med pa'i 'byung ba ni dngos po la ltos pa yin no zhes @112a * //
analyzed: rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las ni snga na med pa'i 'byung ba ni dngos po la ltos pa yin no zhes @112a * //
translated: In the Compendium of Ascertainments, it is explained that â€œthe nonexistence of something prior to its arising is dependent on the thing itself.â€

original: bshad la / 'dir ni chos gang 'byung ba ni skye ba zhes bshad pa de ji ltar 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: bshad la / 'dir ni chos gang 'byung ba ni skye ba zhes bshad pa de ji ltar 'gal zhe na /
translated: Here, it is explained that â€œthe arising of a phenomenon is its birth.â€ How can these two explanations be reconciled?

original: de ni bye brag bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni bye brag bstan pa yin no //
translated: The explanation in the Compendium of Ascertainments is a specific explanation.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni zhes bya ba ni tshogs gcig pa ni thams cad re re nas 'byung ba'i phyir mnyam pa yin no //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni zhes bya ba ni tshogs gcig pa ni thams cad re re nas 'byung ba'i phyir mnyam pa yin no //
translated: The condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent is the same in that all members of a single group arise individually.

original: rigs 'dra ba bar du ma chod pa rnams kyi rkyen du gyur pa'i phyir bar du ma chod pa'i rkyen nyid do //
analyzed: rigs 'dra ba bar du ma chod pa rnams kyi rkyen du gyur pa'i phyir bar du ma chod pa'i rkyen nyid do //
translated: It is the condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent because it is the condition for those of similar type that are not obstructed.

original: yang 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi ni de dag kho na dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir mnyam pa yin no //
analyzed: yang 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi ni de dag kho na dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir mnyam pa yin no //
translated: Or, in the realm of desire, they are the same because they are associated with those of similar type.

original: yang na tshogs thams cad ni tshogs kyi rkyen yin par mnyam pa la bya'o //
analyzed: yang na tshogs thams cad ni tshogs kyi rkyen yin par mnyam pa la bya'o //
translated: Or, the condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent is the same in that all groups are the condition for a group.

original: rnam par shes pa gang gi mjug thogs su rnam par shes pa gang dag 'byung bar nges pa ni zhes bya ba ni drug po rnams kho na la bya'i kun gzhi yang ma yin la yid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang gi mjug thogs su rnam par shes pa gang dag 'byung bar nges pa ni zhes bya ba ni drug po rnams kho na la bya'i kun gzhi yang ma yin la yid kyang ma yin no //
translated: The consciousnesses that definitely arise immediately after any consciousness are the condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent for that consciousness.

original: sems las byung ba rnams kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams kyang de bzhin te /
translated: The same is true for the mental factors.
